loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua, a wheat farmer for the last five years, is 32 years, married to Beatrice, a housewife, and blessed with three children. Having learned about KADET from KADET staff marketing done in the area, Joshua is requesting his first loan to purchase farm supplies and seedlings for the next planting season. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.

An industrious man who can do well if funded, Joshua aspires to be the best and most well-known farmer in the area.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
La Sra Mirna tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su pareja el Sr. Jorge quien trabaja en una firma privada desempeñando la Funcion de Basculero, juntos tienen dos hijos menores de edad.
Mirna se dedica a las confecciones, realiza trabajos sobre pedido como sabana, cortina, cubre sofa, busos para escuela ect. desde hace 8 meses. Comenzó con un pequeño capital que obtuvo a través de un credito de la Fundación Paraguaya y también gracias a la ayuda de su pareja, juntos pudieron montar dicha actividad. Hoy día ambos generan ingresos y aportan a la canasta familiar.
Actualmente posee clientela formada, pues, su negocio esta  ubicado en una zona muy poblada, cerca de una escuela.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, lo cual es el elemento fundamental de su trabajo. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Mirna, 30, lives with her spouse, Jorge, who works for a private firm as a scale operator; they have two minor children.

Mirna is a seamstress.  She makes items to order like sheets, curtains, sofa covers, school sweatshirts, etc.  She’s been in business 8 months.  She started out with a little capital that she got from a loan from Fundación Paraguaya and also with help from her spouse.  They were able to start up the business together.  Today, they both generate income and contribute to the household’s basic needs.

She has a well-established clientele now because her business is located in a highly populated area near a school.

She is asking for the loan to buy fabric which is the fundamental material for her work.  She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it gives her.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Sibumba Mission B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sibumba Mission B Group in Western Kenya! Batholomayo is the facilitator of the Sibumba Mission B group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Batholomayo is a father of 2 children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Batholomayo had an excellent maize yield harvesting 8 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Batholomayo was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Batholomayo and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Batholomayo will buy a piece of land and ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Sibumba Mission B group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Batholomayo is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Juvina

texts.es: Juvina, de 50 años es una mujer admirable. Hace 22 años enviudó del que fue su esposo, Pedro. Ambos tuvieron 2 hijos. Jessica y Irania, con los que vive en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Usibamba. Sola tuvo que sacar adelante a sus hijas, su principal actividad es la costura, con la confección de faldas, mandiles y fustanes (vestimenta típica), a los pobladores de su localidad, quien conocen la destreza de Juvina. Cuenta que llega a confeccionar de 6 a 8 prendas al día, donde obtiene una ganancia neta de 30 nuevos soles por falda. Pero como es una mujer del campo, también se dedica a la ganadería con la crianza de 8 vacas, de las cueles saca un promedio de 15 litros diarios, que aprovecha muy bien, pues vende a los acopiadores de leche que visitan su casa constantemente. Como le va muy bien en su negocio, desea mejorar la calidad de sus costuras y aumentar su ganado, por ello trabaja muy duro, todos los días. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “los ganaderos” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Juvina de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de un becerro y comida balanceada para sus vacas.
texts.en:
Juvina, age 50, is an admirable woman. She became a widow at the age of 22 after the death of her husband, Pedro. They had 2 children, Jessica and Irania with whom she lives in her own house located in the small village of Usibamba. On her own, she has had to get ahead with her two daughters. Her main business is sewing embroidered skirts (traditional clothing) for people in her community, who are familiar with Juvina’s artistry. She says that she can make 6 to 8 garments a day and can obtain net earnings of 30 new soles per skirt.

In addition, as a woman of the countryside, she is also engaged in raising 8 cows, from which she gets an average of 15 liters of milk daily. This benefits her a lot since she sells to milk merchants who visit her house constantly.

Her business is doing well, and she wants to improve the quality of her dressmaking. That’s why she works very hard every day.

She belongs to the “Los Ganaderos “ (Cattleraisers) communal bank. This is her first loan with MFP, and she hopes that, through this collaboration, she will be able to achieve her plans. In addition, she promises to fulfill the payment of her installments. She is thankful to be a part of her communal bank because all its members are very responsible and supportive persons. Juvina receives their support. She will invest the money applied for in the purchase of a calf and balanced feed for her cows.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and balanced feed for her cows.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Marites has a shop that sells electronic loads (prepaid phone cards) from several networks like GLOBE & SMART. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy stocks of electronic loads. Marites has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic loads (prepaid phone cards)

loans.name: Eutemia

texts.en:
Eutemia is a sari-sari (variety) store owner from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 51 years old and married. Eutemia sells various items like biscuits, sugar, soap, and canned goods. She is able to help provide for her family's needs through her business.

Eutemia has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and canned goods. She hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell, such as soft drinks and canned goods.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 51 years old and is married to Amelia. They are blessed with five children. Rogelio is engaged in a hog-raising business. He raises hogs primarily for breeding.  Sometimes, Rogelio has difficulty feeding his pigs. That’s why he decided to request a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy vitamins and feed for the maintenance of his pigs. He also plans to buy galvanized iron to repair the roof of his piggery house.

He hopes to maintain his business to secure the future of his family. He will manage his business well, gain more income and save some of it for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for his pigs

loans.name: Sena 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SENA 1 est composé de trois personnes qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Antoinette Pélagie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Antoinette Pélagie est âgée de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Antoinette Pélagie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Antoinette Pélagie est mariée à un certain Mathias. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Antoinette Pélagie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Antoinette Pélagie mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d’année, la vente d’ignames frites et non frites dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Antoinette Pélagie vend des tissus. Antoinette Pélagie s’approvisionne dons une ville du Bénin et dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Antoinette Pélagie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SENA 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The SENA 1 Group is made up of three people belonging to the same tontine group.  This is the third time that this group is requesting a loan from Alidé, so as to raise the standard of their business.  The representative of the group, Antoinette Pélagie, is the one in the photo with her hand raised.

Antoine Pélagie is 33 years old and lives in Benin.  Antoinette Pélagie has not attended school.  Antoinette Pélagie is married to a man named Mathias. The couple has four children, all in school, and all dependents.  Antoinette Pélagie lives together with her husband and children.

The couple shares the household responsibilities.  To support herself and her children, Antoinette Pélagie has run a business for the last decade selling yams, both fried and otherwise, in her area.  Secondarily, Antoinette Pélagie sells fabrics.

Antoinette Pélagie stocks up in a city in Benin as well as in her area.  In order to ensure the satisfaction of her clientele and to improve her turnover and profits, Antoinette Pélagie is asking for a third loan along with the other members of the SENA 1 Group. The two previous loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase bags of yams and fabric.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson is 33 years old, married, and has one child, aged two. He does carpentry to earn a living and has been in the business for five years. He also earns extra income from his farming activities. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to expand his business. He hopes to expand his business to a big carpentry firm in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy timber

loans.use: To buy timber.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. Evangeline has operated a medicinal shop for 5 years, selling generic medicines such as syrups and tablets. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy more stock of generic medicines. Evangeline has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of generic medicines

loans.name: Ameeda

texts.en: Although Ameeda has received no prior formal education, she is a petty trader. She specializes in selling saucepans in Elmina. She has been involved in this enterprise for some years. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a blacksmith. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Aweeda will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of saucepans, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of saucepans, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.en: Sanobar is smart and kind woman. She was born in 1952 year. Sanobar is higher educated woman and she works at the university as a teacher. She works in this filed more than 10 years and she is one of the best teachers. Sanobar likes her job very much and she makes her deal with pleasure. She is widowed and she is only feed keeper of her children. Her children are in 16, 18 ages. Her younger daughter is ill and Sanobar must pay for her treatment. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to pay for the university tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment of her daughter

loans.name: Adrine

texts.en:
K. Adrine is an active member of life in Africa. She is a single mother of two children. She was deserted by her husband and left to make a life the best she could. Being poor and a single mother is very difficult but she works hard in spite of the challenges to provide for her children and give them the education she never had.

She works for Invisible Children Crew as a bracelet maker. This helps her provide for the basics at home and even pay school fees for her children. Her son will be joining Kyambogo University this coming year. The greatest challenge she has, is having no house in the village. She had to leave her children in the village with her family while she came to Kampala to earn money. When she goes to the village to visit them, she has to share a room with her brothers. It is not easy to get one family to share their home with another family when they are already crowded. In Kampala she is only able to rent one small room for herself and she dreams of the day when she will be reunited with her children.

Her plan is to build a house in the village where her children will live comfortably and where she will stay on her visits. Her son and her brother will supervise the construction for her. She owns two cows which she plans to sell. They are worth 900,000/=. In addition to this she is seeking a loan in the amount of 500,000/= to complete the project. She will be able to repay this loan in 12 months. Her payment will be 50,000/= per month.

Below is her budget:

Bricks 3000 @ shs. 60...........................................180,000/=

Cement 15 bags @ shs. 18,000................................... 270,000/=

Sand 2 trips @ shs. 60,000..................................... 120,000/=

Timber, nails and iron sheets.................................. 303,000/=

Shutters....................................................... 200,000/=

Transport....................................................... 70,000/=

Labour..........................................................200,000/=

Total.........................................................1,343,000/=

Adrine's loan has been reviewed and guaranteed by her peers at the Life in Africa WE Center community in Kampala. She has designated the 25% community impact portion of the interest on her loan to support Life in Africa's craft product development team. For more about Adrine, her life and her worldview, visit http://lifeinafrica.com/4/adrinekyalisima

loans.use: Building Family House

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is involved in dry season agricultural production. He cultivates pineaples, pepper, garden eggs and onions. He serves a very big population of students and workers in his village. He has been trained by staff of Kraban in the TEACH lending model. He needs a loan of $1000 to purchace a water pump.

loans.use: Water Pumping Machine

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yem S. S. is 20 years old and sells sugar cane juice.  On an average day, she makes about $10, and her household income is complemented by the $6/day that husband makes working as a carpenter.  She also supports her father who lives in their home.  Yem S. S. will use this loan to buy a motorbike for transportation to work.  In the long-term, this will save her transportation costs, and she can also rent the motorbike out when she does not need it for additional income.  In the future, her husband and her have ambitions of starting a larger juice production business.  If this is successful, they will build a proper home for their future family.

loans.use: To buy motorbike for transportation to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing wholesale and reselling retail

loans.name: Antonieta Aide

texts.es:
Antonieta AiD. L. D. E. lives in the town of Nueva Requena, in the department of Ucayali, and which is located 48km from the city of Pucallpa. It is surrounded by the Aguaytia river and several lakes. Antioneta is 54 years old and is separated from her husband. She is raising two grandchildren, which has caused her to confront very difficult situations, especially economic troubles. Some friends told her about a feminist institution that gives training workshops to women. She attended a meeting and felt like a part of the family with the Las Amigas Zulmiritas Communal Bank. She later received a loan of S/. 300.00 (approximately $49 dollars), which she invested in grocery items. She then traded them for chickens, plantains, and fruits from the region, which she sold in the city of Pucallpa. Her customers are people from villages where many do not have cash.

This loan of S/. 2,500.00 (approximately $790.00) will be used to invest in more merchandise (milk, rice, noodles) and to expand her business with agricultural implements (such as lanterns, hammocks, mosquito nets). People from this area have many needs. She is very happy to be able to proviD. this service to the people from this area so that they don’t have to go to Pucallpa. Additionally, the income from the business allows her to pay for her grandchildren’s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonieta AiD. L. D. E., residente del poblado D. Nueva Requena del departamento D. Ucayali, se encuentra a 48km D. la ciudad D. Pucallpa y está rodeado del río Aguaytia, D. lagos y cochas. Antonieta a sus 54 años se separó D. su esposo y tiene a su cargo dos nietos donD. tuvo que enfrentarse a situaciones muy difíciles, en especial económico, unas amigas le comentaron D. una institución feminista que daba charlas para mujeres, fue cuando asistió y se sintió ser parte D. la familia del Banco Comunal Las Amigas Zulmiritas, posteriormente recibió un prestamos D. S/. 300.00 soles (US$ 94 aprox.) que invirtió en abarrotes, los mismos que intercambia con gallinas, plátanos, frutas D. la región y los venD. en la ciudad D. Pucallpa. Sus clientes son personas D. los caseríos donD. muchos D. ellos no cuentan con efectivo. Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El prestamos D. S/. 2,500.00 soles (US$ 790.00 aprox.) servirá para invertir en mas mercadería (leche, arroz, fideos) y ampliar su negocio con implementos para la agricultura (linternas, amacas, mosquiteros), estos pobladores tienen muchas necesidades. Está muy contenta D. poder dar facilidades a estos pobladores donD. ya no tienen la necesidad D. ir a la ciudad D. Pucallpa y además estos ingresos le permiten costear los estudios D. sus nietos.

loans.use: To buy grocery merchandise and agricultural implements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience O. is 50 years old and married with 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Patience sells cooking utensils including stoves, pots, dishes and cookers. She is in need loan of $800 to buy more cooking utensils to sell. She has been in business since 1996. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more cooking utensils to sell

loans.name: Natividad De

texts.es:
Natividad is a 32-year-old woman. She has a family of eight, the two parents and 6 children who are 17, 15, 13, 11, 9, and 7 years old. Natividad has a business in her home, which is located in the community of Los Ciervos, more than 30 Km. away from Warnes. In this business, she sells general store products, cosmetics, and she also uses the space as a beer distributor. She tends to this business Monday to Sunday.

Natividad has over 10 years of experience in this activity so she is very well known in her area and can count on regular customers, which decreases her risk from competing businesses. Her business is one of the largest in the area.

The purpose of this loan is to buy merchandise to stock her business. The prices of these products vary depending on the season and price variation from the different merchants. She has a very good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Natividad es una señora de 32 años de edad, su familia está compuesta por ocho personas, los dos padres y sus seis hijos que tienen 17, 15, 13, 11, 9 y 7 años respectivamente. Natividad tiene su negocio que se encuentra en su domicilio y se ubica en la Comunidad de los Ciervos, misma que se encuentra distante a más de 30 Km. de Warnes, en el negocio ella vende abarrotes, cosméticos, también aprovecha el espacio como distribuidora de cerveza, este negocio lo atiende de lunes a domingo.

Natividad cuenta ya con una experiencia en el rubro de más de 10 años por lo que es bastante conocida en la zona y por lo tanto cuenta con clientela fija, disminuyendo de esta forma el riesgo de la competencia que es relativamente media. Su negocio es uno de los comercios más grandes de la zona. La presente solicitud es para adquirir mercadería, para surtir su negocio. Los precios de estos producto varian de acuerdo a la época y a las variaciones de precios de los proveedores. Sus antecedentes crediticios en el sistema financiero son muy buenos.

loans.use: Buying merchandise to sell (Capital de trabajo)

loans.name: Alusine

texts.en:
Alusine C. is married and has 4 children. He sells used clothing and has been in business for the past 15 years. Alusine has been able to send all of his 4 children to school because his business provide a good profit.

“The previous loan played a significant role in improving my family life and business capacity,” said Alusine. He would like to expand the business sell clothing in the nearby village. Therefore, he is requesting a loan for $525.00.

loans.use: To expand clothing sales to nearby village to increase profits

loans.name: Dayra

texts.es:
Ms. Dayra is single woman. She lives in the Memorial Sandino settlement , a very poor semi-rural sector where there is a shortage of drinking water and the streets are not paved. For six years she has worked as a cook for the Nicaraguan army. Every day she works from 7:00 AM. to 6:00 PM. She has obtained some financing which has allowed her to improve her dwelling. Although the structure is made of cement blocks and the floor is tiled, the roof is damaged and needs to be changed. At this time the dwelling does not have iron gates that could secure the house. She leaves for work very early and returns late at night, leaving the house empty most of the time. She fears that delinquents will damage the house. That is why she requests a loan with which she can fix the roof of her house and buy an iron gate for the door of her dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Dayra es soltera, habita en el asentamiento Memorial Sandino, sector muy pobre, semi rural, existe escasez de agua potable, las calles no están pavimentadas. Hace 6 años la señora se desempeña de cocinera en el ejército de Nicaragua, todos los días trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m. Ha conseguido ciertos financiamientos los cuales le han permitido mejorar su vivienda, aun siendo de bloques la estructura, el piso es embaldosado, el techo esta dañado y requiere cambiarse. En estos momentos la vivienda no cuenta con verjas que aseguren la casa, sale a trabajar desde muy temprano y llega noche, la casa casi siempre está sola y teme por la delincuencia, es por eso que solicita un préstamo con el cual pueda cambiar el techo de su casa y comprar la verja para la puerta de su vivienda.

loans.use: To buy perlines (metal supports), cement, zinc and iron gates

loans.name: Mistawi Budi

texts.id:
Mistawi Budi is a used goods collector. He looks for used goods, collects them to be resold. He lives in a rented room at Bedahulu street in Badung, Indonesia. He pays IDR 150,000 per month for this room (around USD 20/ month).

He drives his motorcycle everyday to residential areas, market places and office buildings to look for used goods. He hopes that with the loan money from Dinari, he can have more working capital to enable him to acquire more used goods.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mistawi Budi adalah seorang pemulung yang setiaphari aktifitasnya mencari barang-barang bekas. Tinggal di jalan Bedahulu dengan mengontrak sebuah kamar dengan harga 150.000/bulan. Dengan menggunakan sepeda motor miliknya yang dipasang kotak di kedua sisi belakang motornya Mistawi menjalankan aktifitasnya sebagai seorang pemulung. Dengan menyusuri lorong-lorong perumahan, pasar, gedung-gedung dengan tujuan untuk mendapatkan barang-barang bekas, lebih sering Mistawi membeli barang-barang bekas dari para ibu-ibu rumah tangga yang suka mengumpulkan barang yang sudah tidak terpakai lagi. Barang-barang bekas tersebut ditimbang dan dihargai sesuai dengan kualitas barang. Dana yang didapat dari DINARI digunakan sebagai modal untuk membeli barang bekas dari para pengepul. Harapannya bersama keluarga semoga keadaan ekonomi keluarga mereka semakin membaik di masa yang akan datang.

loans.use: To purchase more used goods (Menambah modal untuk membeli barang bekas)

loans.name: Ildika

texts.en:
Ildika is a small entrepreneur from Beregovo, Ukraine. She owns a venture selling groceries at affordable prices in a local store. One of the best attractions of her business is a nice selection of different food items that are always fresh and sell well. Ildika has benefited from loans she has received through Nadiya Ukraine over the last two years. Today her turnover capital has grown to $5000 and her net profit is about $1000 a month.

Ildika dreams about the further growth and expansion of her trade. She is very persistent and motivated, and likes to set new goals and achieve success. She is also an entrepreneur of integrity and responsibility. We believe her highly motivated business perspectives and natural characteristics as an efficient business manager are a wonderful combination of qualities that can help her repay this loan and achieve her long-term business plans.

loans.use: Ildika would like to increase the assortment of her inventory for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Yus

texts.en:
Yus B. is 70-years-old and has resided in the outskirts of the city for many years. Four children are married and live outside the home but two nieces live with her. After her husband passed away, she works very hard to support the family. Yus is a tailor and earns approximately $1.50 per day.

To increase the family income, she would like a loan to purchase more cloth and another sewing machine so her niece can operate a small business at home with her.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and another sewing machine.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Lun S., 28, is the mother of two children, both of whom are too young to attend school. For the last year, she has made a living working in a beer factory. Her husband, Ung Monkol, is a taxi driver whose income is falling because gas prices keep going up. Prices have driven some taxis out of business, but Ung has regular customers who provide him with a steady income.

Lun S. is applying for a loan to replace her husband's old and unreliable motorbike with a more efficient one that uses less gas and needs fewer repairs. In the future, the young couple plan to open a small stall from which they will sell groceries. (Mrs. Lun is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Delia And Precila Group

texts.en:
Delia and Precila are members of the Suni Community Bank. (Suni meaning “Secure” in Quechua). Delia is a thirty-four year old mother of three children.

Delia travels to regional fairs once a week to buy animals and cheese that she sells door to door. Her sales have increased as her credit has increased

Precila is a married, sixty three year old mother of five children. Pricila travels to the Ayacuchana Jungle where she sells groceries and buys cacao, ajonjoli, coffee and other products to sell to middlemen in the city of Lima.

Delia and Precila request respective loans of 600 and 750 soles to invest in pigs, lambs, cheese, sugar and rice.

They dream of being able to construct their own houses, to have their own stores and to acquire cars to transport their products.

loans.use: To purchase pigs, lambs, cheese, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Khadi

texts.fr: Mme M., mere de famille, vend des produits locaux non transformes. Grace a son activite elle parvient a satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille. Maintenant, elle sollicite ce pret pour renforcer son stock notamment en mangue et de caba.
texts.en:
Mrs. M. is the mother of a family, and she sells untransformed local products. Thanks to her business, she manages to provide for her needs and for those of her family. She now seeks this loan to bolster her stock,in particular of mangoes and caba fruits.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her stock of mangoes and palm oil

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Mrs. Suy N., 59 is a widow with seven children: three sons and four daughters. Two of her children are married and live away from home. One son is a driver and another is a monk. Three of her daughters are silk weavers.

Mrs. Suy has been selling silk products for ten years. She buys finished products from weavers in the village and then takes them to sell in Posat Province. Suy has four looms in her family for her daughters to weave silk at home.

Suy is requesting a loan of 1,000 to purchase silk materials for her daughters to continue their weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her daughters to weave.

loans.name: Jani

texts.es:
La Señora Jany es socia D. Banco Comunal “Las Brisas de la Molina II”, vive en la región  y provincia de San Martín, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. 29 de Julio Mz E – Lt 16 D. A.A. H.H. Las Brisas de la Molina, lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes que son mayormente los vecinos de su  barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes marcas y tamaños, entre otros, para poder surtir bien su negocio y sus clientes encuentren  lo que buscan. 

Jany tiene 24 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo que aún es pequeño. Es una mujer trabajadora y muy optimista. Su meta es ampliar su casa para implementar más su negocio y pueda seguir creciendo como hasta ahora y también tenerlo bien surtido para la satisfacción de ella y la de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Jany is a member of Las Brisas de la Molina ll Communal Bank. She lives in the district of La Banda de Shilcayo in the region and province of San Martin. Her grocery business is located in her own home in Jr. 29 de Julio Mz E â Lt 16 D. A.A. H.H. Las Brisas de la Molina where her customers go daily. For the most part, they live in the same neighbourhood. With this S/.500 loan, which she will pay back in four months, Jany will buy basic necessities like rice, bags of sugar, food in cans of different sizes, cartons of toilet paper, detergent, a variety of soap brands and sizes etc. In this way she will be able to increase the stock in her grocery store and her customers will be able to find what they want. Jany is 24 years old, lives with her husband and son who is still small. She is a hardworking, optimistic woman. Her goal is to make her house bigger so that she can expand her business and continue expanding and stocking it in the future, thus providing satisfaction both to herself and to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic necessities like rice, sugar, milk, oil etc.

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Tham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Thắm năm nay 50 tuổi, chị đã tham gia Quỹ tình thương được 10 năm. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị chủ yếu làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư đi buôn chiếu. Hiện nay đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu cho gia đình chị với mức thu nhập 2,500.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9 triệu đồng để đầu tư vốn cho việc kinh doanh buôn bán chiếu.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tham Thi D., 50 years old, joined the TYM fund 10 years ago. Before joining, her family focused on farming and livestock. Then, she borrowed money to start selling sedge mats. Now, this business generates 2,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. Mrs. D. plans to make the next loan of 9,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Mayra Senaida

texts.en:
Mayra is a member of the Tu Angel Lucy (“Your Angel Lucy”) Village Bank, named for FINCA founder Lucinda Lanao. Mayra is 24 years old and separated with one child. Mayra sells clothing by special order. Her clients are her friends, neighbors, family members and acquaintances; she sells on credit and collects payments weekly. Mayra also travels to regional fairs, where she buys grains, which she brings to the markets of the city of Ayacucho to sell. Mayra needs a loan of 1400 soles to buy sweaters and pants. Mayra’s dreams are to build her own home and to buy a car to transport her wares.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow.

Mayra es del Banco Comunal Tu Ángel Lucy. Mayra es separada, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Mayra vende ropa variada de acuerdo a pedidos de sus clientes, sus ventas los realiza a vecinos, amigos, familiares y conocidos, sus ventas son al crédito y cobra semanalmente. Además Mayra viaja a las ferias en donde compra cereales y luego lo vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Mayra necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas, pantalones. Los sueños de Mayra son construir su casa, comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.

loans.use: Buy sweaters and pants

loans.name: Emmanuella

texts.en:
Emmanuella O. is 37 years old. She is married and has four children. She says with the help of God that all her children attend school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, and biscuits in her neighborhood of Babiani, where she lives.

With this loan, Emmanuella wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, and boxes of biscuits to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school.

Emmanuella has being selling grocery products for eight years now and she belongs to a Trust group called Adehye, which means Royals Trust Group. She was so enthused when her business was assessed and she was offered business advice. Emmanuella says she would be very grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her grocery store, such as cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water, and boxes of biscuit.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier  yokoé, elle a pour activité la vente de produits alimentaires, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2005 et elle le fait de façon ambulante, elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES, elle sollicite ce premier crédit  d’un montant de 300000f pour acheter des produits alimentaires, elle s’approvisionne au marché local d’adidogomé, elle est  marié et mère de 04 enfants, le surplus de revenu qu’elle gagne lui permet d’aider son mari.
texts.en:
This lady lives in the Yokoé neighborhood. She sells foodstuffs. She began this business in 2005 and she goes from door-to-door to make her sales. She has never received a loan from WAGES, so now she is requesting her first loan in the amount of 300,000 F to buy foodstuffs. She does her buying in the local market of Adidogomé. She is married and the mother of 4 children. The extra income she earns allows her to help her husband.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Modinot

texts.en:
Modinot designs lovely clothes for her customers. The demands for her tailoring skills are high in her community. She therefore hopes for a loan of N100,000 so she can purchase one sewing machine. This will help her meet the demands of her customers.

She is 32 years old and married with 2 children.

She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase one sewing machine

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
La señora Flor D. Maria H. D. D., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz”, vive en el Jr. Leoncio Prado Nº 629, Distrito D. Tarapoto, departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 71 años y es madre 05 hijos, que ya no dependen D. ella.

Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00, que fue por iniciativa propia se dedico a la venta D.  comida preparada y a la crianza D. gallinas . Tiene 08 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad solamente se dedica a la venta D. comidas preparadas con entrega a domicilio, donD. ella prepara a diario sus alimentos y parrilladas.

 Con el préstamo D. S/1,500.00 que cancelará a plazo D. 06 meses, desea invertirlo, comprando insumos para la preparación D. los alimentos como carnes en sus diferentes variedades, cereales, verduras, todo esto al por mayor a fin D. estar abastecida , asimismo comprara ollas mas grandes y embases especiales para la distribución D. la comida. 

Ambos; ella y su esposo toman las decisiones en los gastos y ganancias D. su negocio. En lo personal, siente que sus ventas se incrementaron. Se siente una Mujer independiente, más responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas.

Flor D. Maria, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Ms. Flor D. Maria H. D. D. is a member of the “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz” (Our Lady of Peace) Microfinance Institute. She lives in the Tarapoto district of the department of San Martín. She is a 71-year-old married mother of 5 independent children.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, which she obtained on her own initiative, she decided to sell meals and raise chickens. She has been working with the institute for 8 years.

She currently prepares the meals in her own home, then delivers them to her customers’ doors.

She hopes to invest this 1,500.00 PEN loan, which she will repay in 6 monthly installments, in purchasing the wholesale supplies she needs to prepare her different meals (various meats, grains, vegetables) so that she can be well-stocked. She also wants to buy bigger pots and special containers so that she can distribute her meals.

Both she and her husband make the decisions regarding the business’ expenses and profits. She personally feels that her sales have increased. She feels like an independent woman who is responsible when making payments.

Flor D. Maria expresses her gratituD. to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow both as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food preparation supplies

loans.name: Benedicta Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina is 66 years old and lives in a rural, predominately agricultural area in the Municipality of Anta, about an hour outside the city of Cusco. Aquilina is a member of the San Pedro de Katañiray Village Bank, along with six of her children: Damiana, Jose Luis, Juan Carlos, Luis Alberto, Basilia Sulema and Rosa, the group's current president. 

Aquilina buys beans, grains and potatoes from area farmers and brings them to Cusco to resell. She has been in this business since she was very young. Aquilina currently works with her daughter, Sulema, who has her own market stall in Cusco. Aquilina is requesting a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy more potatoes to sell in the city.

Aquilina has been a member of the San Pedro de Katañiray Village Bank for about five years and has always been very responsible about making her repayments on time. The group's loan officer, Franklin, says that it's often considered a bad idea to have many family members participate in one village bank (because many individuals are dependent on a single business, or may all be taking out money to give to a single family member). However, Aquilina and her six children are involved in different businesses, are long-time Arariwa clients, and have always been very reliable.

loans.use: Buy potatoes to sell in Cusco

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es: Yenny tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo Ricardo, el cual es policía, y sus hijos Marcia D. 12 y Ricardo D. 9 años. ElL. se dedica a L. preparación D. deliciosos platillos en su restaurante, el cual puso para mejorar L. economía D. su hogar, ya que pese a que su esposo es policía y tiene un sueldo fijo, a elL. siempre le ha gustado ser independiente y trabajar para lograr sus propios objetivos, es así que le pone mucho empeño a su trabajo. Jenny cuenta con una persona que L. ayuda en L. atención y cocina, con L. cual se da abasto para atender a L. cantidad D. clientes que frecuentan su restaurante haciéndolo muy rentable. Yenny se encuentra en su cuarto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, siendo muy puntual en sus pagos y en su banco comunal se siente muy feliz, ya que todas son muy unidas. Con el dinero que está solicitando quiere refaccionar un carro que tiene, aunque es un poco antiguo cree que con algunos arreglos quedará óptimo para ponerlo a trabajar como servicio D. trasporte, y con las ganancias hacer crecer su restaurante, haciéndolo más amplio para que pueda albergar a gran cantidad D. personas.
texts.en:
Jenny is 30 years old, and she lives with her husband Ricardo and their children Marcia (12) and Ricardo (9). She prepares delicious meals in her restaurant, which she started to improve the monetary situation of the household. Although her husband is a police officer and receives a steady salary, she has always enjoyed being independent and working to achieve her own goals, which is why she puts so much effort into her job. Jenny has one person who helps in the kitchen and with waiting tables, which is enough to attend to the number of customers which frequent the restaurant, making it very profitable. This is Jenny's 4th loan with PRISMA microfinances. She has been very punctual with her payments, and she feels very happy with her local bank since everyone there is very close. With the money that she is asking for, she is looking to fix up her car. Although it's a little old, she believes that with a few repairs it could serve very well as a taxi, and with the profits that she makes from that, she would like to grow her business, making the space larger and more open so that the restaurant has room for more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbish a car for use as a taxi

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Mrs. Yon V. is shown providing food to her family's pig that she raised two months ago. She is 54-years old and the mother of ten children: nine are single and one is married and lives separately. Five of her single children are working in different occupations. Her husband helps with her business. The family always takes time to grow rice during the farming season.
Mrs. V. and her husband hope to reduce taxi expenses. Therefore, they would like a $600 loan in order to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta M. is from the city of San Vicente, Oroquieta City. She is 39 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Loreta owns and operates a sari-sari (general store). While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Loreta has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Loreta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Loreta is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional goods to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es una mujer muy sincera y honesta, tiene 40 años, vive junto a su única hija Karla de 23 años en su casa propia, y lo que más desea es mejorar su vida. Pasa sus días vendiendo productos de belleza en las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, va puerta por puerta ofreciendo sus productos, es una persona muy alegre y conversadora, por lo cual sus clientes la prefieren. Maria disfruta mucho de aconsejar sobre qué crema, perfume, etc., le quedará mejor a la persona. Lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es que después de cada día de ventas termina muy sucia y cansada debido a las largas caminatas. Para un futuro cercano desea tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos de belleza y otros artículos, para así mejorar su calidad de vida y darle a su hija un mejor futuro. Este el quinto préstamo de Maria con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más cosméticos, para así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Maria is a sincere and honest woman. She is forty, and she lives in her own house with her only daughter, Karla, who is twenty three. What she wants more than anything is to improve her life. She spends her day selling beauty products on the streets of the city of Juliaca. She goes door to door offering her products. She is a happy, chatty person; her customers prefer doing business with her. Maria really enjoys advising which cream, perfume, etc. will go well with a customer. She has been doing this for four years. What she likes the least is at the end of every day of selling, she is very dirty and tired because of the amount of walking she does. In the near future she would like to have a store where she could sell her beauty products and other things. This would improve her quality of life and give her daughter a better future. This is Maria’s fifth loan with MFP. She is prepared to make all of her payments on time. She does not want to cause problems for her community bank, where she is loved by the rest of her colleagues. She will use the 1,000 PEN to buy cosmetics. She will then be able to offer her customers a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Taualupe

texts.en: Taualupe F., 50, is married with 6 children.  She has 4 years of experience in the sewing business.  Taualupe sells to the general public 4 days per week.  She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala.  SPBD loans are Taualupe’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase poplin materials, sewing machine, linen materials,needles.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Thư Nguyễn Thị (1407081658) is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has two infant children.

Thư owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising ducks for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over nineteen years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2008, Thư joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

Thư is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase ducklings to raise and sell. The loan will be her 2nd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase ducklings to raise and sell

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Mao, 32, and her husband, Mr. Sophea Sao, 29, have been married since 2002 and have two young daughters. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

S. has been selling jasmine flowers and longan for 5 years. She buys them in her village and transports them on her motorbike to the Korky Market, about 5 kilometers from her house, to sell. Her motorcycle is old and breaks down very often, so she is applying for her first loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike to replace the old one and to buy longan on contract to resell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to replace the old one and buy longan on contract.

loans.name: Jarol Ronne

texts.es: El joven Jarrol de 20 años de edad, reside junto con sus padres en Villa del Carmen de la alcaldía 2 c al lago, soltero. Se desempeña en servicios de seguridad para ayudar con los gastos de la casa. Termino la secundaria pero por falta de recursos económicos no ha entrado a  estudiar una carrera técnica oh la universidad, lo cual espera hacerlo mas adelante. Con este préstamo va hacer mejoras a su casa para lograr estar cómodo e ir poco a poco construyendo. Esta contento por que es un comienzo en su vida el poder trabajar y poder apoyar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Young Jarol, 20 years old, is single and lives with his parents in Villa del Carmen, two blocks from Lake Managua. He works in security services and helps his parents with household expenses. Jarol finished secondary school but a lack of economic resources has prevented him from studying in the university for a technical career, which he hopes to do later on.

With this loan Jarol intends to make improvements to their house, to make it more comfortable; to go on, little by little, building it. He is very pleased to be able to work and to help his parents, which represents a new beginning in his life.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUY CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS TO MAKE IMPROVEMENTS IN HIS FAMILY'S HOUSE

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es: El señor José Guadalupe vive en nuestra ciudad con su esposa la señora Francisca quien se dedica a las labores domesticas y atiende su negocio que aun es pequeño porque debido a una enfermedad de su hija la mas pequeña dejo de surtir, pero cuenta con el apoyo del otro ingreso del señor José ya que el labora para una empresa de venta de gas domestico en el puesto de chofer desde hace un año, ellos están solicitando este crédito para surtir mas mercancía para su negocio de nombre “Abarrotes ADLITH” ya que la tienen establecida desde hace3 años y no dejan de vender pero les hace falta producto y mercancías para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jose Guadalupe lives in our city with his wife Francisca, who takes care of the domestic chores and attends to her business, which is small still due to their youngest daughter's illness. She counts on the support of Jose's income, since he has worked for one year as a chauffeur for a company that sells gas cylinders. They are requesting this credit in order to stock more merchandise in their business, called "Abarrotes ADLITH". They established it three years ago and although they haven't stopped selling, they are lacking products and merchandise to satisfy the needs of their clients.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in his business (the purchase of merchandise)

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario is already 58 years old. She is married to Charlie who works as a farmer  old. They are gifted with five children and her youngest daughter is still studying. Rosario is dreaming to have additional income to continuously support her child needs in school to finish her studies. She is requesting to borrow loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 to further buy at least three sacks of rice to retail in her vending stall. Rosario is hoping that someday, she will sustain her business to give her family with a stable source of income.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline P. is currently in the business of selling phaste and tomatoes  and is requesting a loan to purchase more groundnut and  make phaste to sell.  Jackline is 29 years old and is Married with a husband that is a clinician. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a parmanent house for her family.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more groundnut and make phaste to sell

loans.name: Brema

texts.en: Brema K. is forty years old and married with six children who are attending primary and secondary schools. He is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for the first time from Kiva through SMT. Brema will use this loan to pay school fees and other school-related charges for his children.

loans.use: Pay school fees and other school related charges for his children

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
Vivian W. is a senior student at the University of Liberia but business is her life. She is 32 years old and married with three children between the ages of 1 and 13 years old (kindergarten to 7th grade). She also cares for a sister-in-law, a niece and a nephew. She and her family live in the Fiamah community, a crowded community that lacks both water and electricity and also has the largest refuse deposit south of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia. Vivian sells general goods like biscuits, candy, soap, sugar, etc. She buys wholesale and sells retail on a table to the residents of Fiamah.

Vivian has been running her business for 13 years, starting with 125 Liberian dollars and the sale of charcoal. She is hoping to expand into a shop. Vivian sells goods that customers want and speaks well to them in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. She needs this loan to purchase more general goods like biscuits, soap, etc. to improve the business. Vivian dreams of her family excelling and being well established in the future. She is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "God is Able".

loans.use: To purchase more general goods like biscuits, soap, etc.

loans.name: Mrs. Savon Khun Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan consists of fifteen people, all of whom live in Preak Ta Ong village in Kandal province. Mrs. Savon K. has been selected by the village bank members as their president. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land used for cultivating rice. She needs fertilizers and pesticides to support her business because her soil is infertile, so she has decided to ask for a loan to purchase these supplies. Her husband, Mr. Ma Vibol, is a construction worker who supports the family with his small income. The couple have two children; the elder is attending the local school, while the younger is too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: George Kamau

texts.en:
George Kamau K. runs the Soi Paints store. He sells varnish, paint and spirits to carpenters in his locality. He has been in this business for the last fourteen years.  His business is located at Githurai, a semi-urban town within the outskirts of Nairobi. 

George does not have enough money to buy materials for making paints and varnish, so he is using his loan of KES 50,000 to buy the materials to make varnish and dyes. His goal in life is to be the main supplier of paints in the area.  

He is married and has three children ranging from one year to seventeen years old. He describes himself as hard-working, friendly and a dedicated father.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur George Kamau from  Kenya

loans.use: To buy material to make varnishes and dyes.

loans.name: Griselda Marisol

texts.es: Griselda Marisol M. Z. de 27 años de edad, reside en Atiquizaya ubicado en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 6 años de edad. Ella posee una venta de productos perecederos, la cual la posee hace un año. Ella junto a su esposo han trabajado por poder surtir su tienda, ya que esta es la  única fuente de ingresos la cual poseen. Griselda solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos perecederos como pan, jugos enlatados, sodas, shampoo en sobrecitos y detergente, productos los cuales son más solicitados en el lugar, y los cuales les permitan mejorar la condiciones del negocio, ya que tanto Griselda como su esposo se han esforzado por tratar de sacar adelante la tienda, todo con el deseo de poder obtener mayores beneficios de esta.
texts.en:
Griselda Marisol M. Z., 27 years old, lives in Atiquizaya, located in the department of Ahuachapán. She lives with her husband and their 6-year-old son. She has a store with perishable products, which she has had for a year. She and her husband have worked together to stock their store, since it is their only source of income.

Griselda is requesting a loan which they can use to buy a larger quantity of products like bread, cans of juice, soda, packets of shampoo and detergent, since these are the most needed products in their area. This will allow them to improve the condition of their business, since Griselda and her husband have worked hard to make their store succeed, and hope to earn greater benefits from it.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bread, juice, and cereals

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie P. is from the village of Guinsiliban , Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old. Melanie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Melanie owns & operates a business venture running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Melanie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Melanie is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Melanie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: United We Stand Group

texts.en:
Steven B. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called United We Stand. He is 42 years old and is married with 5 children aged 4-18 years old and their educational levels are kindergarten-10th grade. Steven and his family live in a factory community, but he works in the largest market of Liberia, which is located in Paynesville, near Monrovia, Liberia. He could not continue his education through 9th grade due to poverty.

Steven’s business is the sale of plastic materials. He buys his goods from wholesalers and sells retail from a table in the market in Paynesville. He has been running this business for 13 years and hopes to get into the real estate business in the near future. He started selling with 500.00 Liberian Dollars that was given to him by his friends as working capital.

Steven sells clean and good plastic materials in order to attract more customers to buy from him. He needs this loan to purchase more plastic materials for resale to improve his business. Steven dreams of building another house for his family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Steven is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts an emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic materials for resale to improve his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of corn

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en:
Jefferson L. is from the village of Sugarland, Valencia City. He is 22 years old. Jefferson is single. To make a living, Jefferson owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling purified drinking water in the local community. Jefferson has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jefferson joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jefferson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Jefferson is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jefferson from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Halima Rahima Group

texts.en:
Abdull Qader G. A. is the leader of Halima Rahima group. He is thirty-five years old and is married. He lives with his own family of eight members in Kabul, Afghanistan. He sells ice cream. He has been involved in this business for more then ten years. Now, he wants to repair his shop for the coming season of spring in Afghanistan, but he needs money to buy new chairs and tables for his shop and to organize it in the proper way.       
He hopes the loan will help improve his business and help with his family. He is very happy with this small-loan process in Afghanistan that helps the poor.

loans.use: To repair his shop for the spring and to buy new chairs and tables

loans.name: Elma's Group

texts.en:
Elma M. is from the village of Guiwanon, Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Elma is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Guava 1.

Elma is married. To make a living, Elma owns & operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Sister

texts.en:
Sister A. sells second-hand clothing at Akotokyire. She moves from house to house selling her goods.  Sister has not received any form of education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason. 

Sister has been selling second-hand clothes for about two years now. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy bales of second-hand clothing for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: to buy bales of second hand clothing for sale

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 47-year-old married man who has four children.  He has been selling poles for the past five years.  In addition, he rears dairy cattle and grows tea and vegetables to earn a living.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya in a group called Wendo, he has been able to start dairy farming and put electricity in his home.  This is because he was previously guaranteed a loan of Kes. 20,000 from Faulu Kenya by his group members. He has requested a loan of Kes. 30,000 to buy more poles for sale.  He hopes to educate his children to the university level.  He dreams of owning a lorry in the future for transporting his goods.

loans.use: To buy poles

loans.name: Carmen Barsarsa Group

texts.en: Carmen B. is from the village of Cartajena. She is 53 years old. Carmen is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if someone is delinquent or defaults. Carmen is married and has nine adult children. To make a living, Carmen runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Carmen has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2007, Carmen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Carmen is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Carmen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian B., age 36, is from the village of Parog-Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She and her husband have two school-aged children. To make a living, Lilian raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lilian has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Lilian joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Lilian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Lilian is now requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lilian from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure, for her rice field

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. Her spouse makes a living as a driver, and works hard to be sure his family's needs -- particularly for food and schooling -- are met. Anna helps pay the bills as well, by running a bar where most of her customers are men. She supplements the income she earns there by selling second-hand clothes. 

Anna has applied for a loan for Kshs 20,000 loan to buy five crates of beer to sell in her shop. In the future, she hopes to become a wholesaler, and joined Yehu to get the loans and training she needs to meet this goal.

loans.use: to buy five crates of beer to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nelly Judith

texts.es:
Nelly Judith V. B. tiene 33 años.  Es casada y vive con su esposo y 4 hijos, Edwin (15), Ronaldo (13), Adriano (10) y Wilson (8), en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

Nelly es una socia de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Nelly trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando papas, trigo, cebada y maíz. Realiza sus compras cada semana y sus ventas cada 6 meses en Guaranda.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar 2 vacas de leche si puede, para hacer queso. Sus sueños son tener un terreno y dar estudios a los niños. Trabaja duro y enfrenta falta de lluvia. 

Le gusta trabajar y ver la televisión cuando tiene tiempo.
texts.en:
Nelly Judith V. B., 33, is married and lives with her husband and four sons: Edwin, 15, Ronaldo, 13, Adriano, 10 and Wilson, 8, in Guaranda canton, Bolívar province. Nelly is a member of the Patrón San Juan communal bank located half an hour from Guaranda. It has a total of 16 members most of whom are potato and corn farmers. This is their first loan request from Cooperativa San José. Nelly farms potatoes, wheat, barley and corn. She makes her purchases weekly and her sales every six months in Guaranda. She is asking for a loan to buy two dairy cows, if possible, to make cheese. Her dream is to own a plot of land and to provide schooling for her sons. She works hard and faces the challenge of lack of rain. She enjoys working and watching television when she has time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows, if possible, to make cheese.

loans.name: Mame Isseu

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Mame Isseu N. est une célibataire de 32 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Mbenguene  dans la localité de Yoff. 
Mademoiselle N. s’adonne à la vente de cigares  et d’accessoires pour fumeurs, une activité qu’elle a choisie par hasard lorsqu’elle a abandonné l’école. Elle pratique cette activité  depuis 7 ans au marché Kermel  au centre  ville à Dakar. C’est une collaboratrice de la société Marlboro.
Mademoiselle N. est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis le mois de mai 2004.Elle a déjà  remboursé un prêt antérieur.  Elle sollicite un crédit  de 75 000 frs pour acheter des pipes, des cigarettes, des filtres cigarettes, des bonbons, etc en vue de diversifier ses produits offerts.
Elle espère  ainsi un accroissement de ses bénéfices, ce qui lui permettra d’améliorer  sa situation sociale.
texts.en:
Mlle Mame Isseu N. is a 32-year-old single woman. She lives in the Mbenguene neighborhood of Yoff. She sells cigarettes and smoking supplies, a trade she chose when she left school. She has been running her business for seven years at the Kermel marketplace in downtown Dakar. She holds a franchise from Marlboro. She has belonged to the Yoff branch since May, 2004, and has repaid one previous loan. She is asking for a loan of CFA 75,000 to buy pipes, cigarettes, filtered cigarettes and candy, planning to diversify her product lines. She hopes to increase her profits and so improve her standard of living.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Noli

texts.en:
Noli C. is from the town of Pangal Norte, Echague. He is 42 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice to sell. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty years and earns approximately $340 per harvest for his activities.

In 2008, Noli joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Noli is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 4th loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated  to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim P., 40, is married and lives with two of her children in Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$2.50 each day and are supported by two children working in the garment factory.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Kim P. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$1,200 to purchase fertilizer and cows. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and be better able to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and cows

loans.name: Casiano

texts.es:
El cliente es un señor de 38 años está casado con la señora Florencia Claros, juntos tienen 2 hijas las cuales están estudiando, son una familia de escasos recursos  económicos ya que no tienen casa propia, viven en la casa de su padre de 80 años  el cual está muy enfermo se quedo siego, por lo tanto el cliente tiene que estar al cuidado de su padre, ya que después les heredara la casa aunque dicha casa está en muy malas condiciones.
El señor Casiano vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la provincia de Punata en la comunidad de Chilcar Grande, su principal actividad es la agricultura, produce Papa, Tomate, Cebolla, Zanahoria y flor, desde muy pequeños ambos se dedican a esta actividad ya que su esposa no sabe leer y escribir, ella no tenía la oportunidad de estudiar por falta de recursos económicos.

El préstamo es destinado para la compra de semillas y abonos y así empezar la siembra de sus productos para la cosecha de este fin de año.
Entre sus sueños y metas del señor Casiano realizar una nueva construcción en la casa antigua que le heredara su padre, otra de sus sueños más importantes es que sus dos hijas estudien una carrera profesional y de esa manera tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Casiano, 38, is married to Florencia Claros and they have two daughters who are in school. They are a family with few economic resources.
