They don’t own their own house but live in his 80-year-old father’s house. The father is very very ill and is now blind so Casiano must care for him. Eventually he will inherit the house even though it is in very bad condition. Casiano lives in the city of Cochabamba, Punata province, Chilcar Grande community. His main activity is farming: he grows potatoes, tomatoes, onions, carrots and flowers. From very young ages, both of them have been farmers for his wife is illiterate; she never had the economic resources to make schooling possible. The loan will be used to buy seed and manure to start this end of year planting cycle. Among his dreams and goals is to rebuild the old house he’ll inherit from his father and another important goal is that his two daughters study professional careers so that they can have a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed and manure.

loans.name: Grace Wanjiru

texts.en:
Grace Wanjiru is a 30-year-old lady married to Simon N.. They have three children aged 10 years, seven years, and five years. She has been practicing farming for five years and has earned an income of Kshs 15,000. Dairy farming is doing well in Githunguri Kiambu.

She has no other history with any other MFI, so this marks her first loan with KADET LTD. She is requesting Kshs 20,000 to buy a dairy cattle. She looks forward to the anticipated income from the proceeds of this loan.

This purchase will improve her dairy farming because the best breeds produce a good quantity of milk. In the future, Grace hopes to have four "best" dairy cows that she can breed on her farm. She is a very hard working lady.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia L. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 47 years old. Verginia is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Verginia owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Verginia has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Verginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Verginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Verginia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Verginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old single man living alone. He is a construction worker with almost ten years experience. He is especially talented at completing woodwork projects. He works on local projects at the request of his clients. He has requested a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., with which he will purchase more wood for his newest project.
 
In the future he is planning to improve his work and to expand his business operation by taking on bigger projects, and to start working with construction entrepreneurs to develop his work and earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase more wood

loans.name: Jerusalem Cruz Blanca Group

texts.es:
Jerusalém    cruz blanca
Este grupo está   conformada por Doña Amalia B. siendo la líder del grupo y por Adela C.  y Josefina quienes tienen grandes sueños ya que con el crédito desean progresar en sus negocios Amalia quiere invertir más en la compra de productos comestibles  como lo es el maíz ya que por la tormenta Ágata que sacudió hace pocos días Guatemala , éste ha subido su costo ya que la mayor parte de la plantación se ha perdido por lo  que se vio en la necesidad de solicitar este crédito para la compra del maíz, Doña Adela por su parte tiene una venta de Flores y Verduras por los pueblos y aldeas muy alejadas de la ciudad capital por  lo que ella quisiera invertir en la ocmpra de verduras  y así poder vender un poco mes  a las personas, Doña Josefina se dedica a la fabricación de muebles junta mente con su esposo desde  varios años, por lo que necesita el dinero para invertirlo en tela para tapizar los mismos  ya que la temporada navideña es donde tienen más demanda de muebles decorativos de  todo tipo. Son mujeres  muy trabajadoras por lo que ven su futuro mejor con esfuerzo y dedicación al lado de sus familias.
texts.en:
Jerusalém cruz blanca (Jerusalem White Cross)
This group has the following members:  Doña Amalia B. who is the leader of the group, Adela C. and Josefina.  They have big dreams and would like to use this loan to make progress in their businesses.  Amalia would like to invest more in the purchase of foodstuffs such as corn.  As a result of Tropical Storm Ágata which shook Guatemala recently the price of corn has risen since most of the plantations were lost.  For this reason, she needs to request this loan to buy corn.

Doña Adela has a business selling flowers and vegetables in the towns and villages which are furthest from the capital city.  She would like to invest in buying vegetables and thereby be able to sell a little more to people.   Doña Josefina has had a furniture-making business with her husband for several years.  She needs money to invest in material for covering the pieces of furniture since the Christmas period is when they have most demand for decorative furniture of all kinds.  They are all hard-working women who see a better future for themselves and their families through hard work and dedication.

loans.use: Foodstuffs, vegetables and fabric for covering furniture

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic E. is requesting a large loan to support the needs of her fishing business and at the same to continue its operation. With Marivic’s passion of giving her family a brighter tomorrow, she will be eager to work hard and help her husband to meet the needs of her family. Marivic’s business has been very helpful in achieving her family dreams. Her greatest hope is that her family will be able to have a decent way of life, out of poverty.
 
Her long-term goals are to help support her children’s education until they complete college, invest and build a better house for the family, have a winning business providing a life that is full of happiness.

A dedicated member of ASHI since 2006, Marivic has been a model member demonstrating regular attendance at weekly meetings and timely repayments on loans. Since joining ASHI, she has gained more self-confidence as an entrepreneur managing her own fishing business.

loans.use: To finance her fishing business

loans.name: Adnan

texts.ar:
عدنان في عمر 50 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل شركة يحب عائلته ويريد دائما
التطور له ولعائلته فهو يعيل 3 اولاد في تعليمهم وغيره يريد ان يؤمن لهم العيش الكريم والمستقبل الجيد عدنان
له سمعة جيدة مع المجموعة يلقى دائما الدعم من محيطه فهو طموح وجدي في العمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من
المجموعة الى دفع الاقساط المدرسية لأولاده بسبب اقتراب دفع الاقساط ولا يريد ان يضطر الى تخلي اولاده عن التعليم بسبب
نقص في المادة
texts.en: Adnan is a 50-year-old husband and father who loves his family and is always trying to provide a good education for his three children. Adnan receives a lot of support from his community. He is very driven and earnest in his work. Given his good standing with Al Majmoua from a previous loan, Adnan is now seeking another loan to help pay the tuition bills of his children, the deadline for which are fast approaching. He very much does not want to have to tell them that they cannot keep studying just because of a lack of money.

loans.use: To pay his children's school tuition

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes S. is from the village of Agusan Canyon, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old. Gertrudes is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Gertrudes owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and snack  foods in the local community. Gertrudes has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Gertrudes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Gertrudes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Gertrudes is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like beverages and biscuits. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Gertrudes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Djiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
DJIGUISEME  est un regroupement de 7 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans. Mariées et mères d’au moins 8 enfants, elles mènent différentes activités qui sont entre autres la vente de diverses marchandises et  des condiments alimentaires. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Kassene, dans la préfecture de TOMINIAN (Région de Ségou, République du Mali). 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, le groupe  a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  cette année et  est à son premier prêt. 
NANA T. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 cartons de maggi 50kg d’oignons frais, 25kg de l’ail, 3 petits sacs de sel, 1carton de  concentrée de tomate. Elle   s’approvisionne à TOMINIAN et à SAN. Elle très connues à Kassene dans cette activité.  
Elle espère sur un bénéfice de 17000 FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité. Les autres membres comptent sur un bénéfice de 15000  FCFA par mois  somme qui leurs permettra de rembourser le prêt et de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
DJIGUISEME is a group of 7 women who know one another through parental and neighborhood ties.  They are, on average, 41 years old.  Married and the mothers of at least 8 children, they run various businesses which include the sale of different merchandise and condiments.  They live in large traditional families in Kassene, in the Tominian prefecture (region of Ségou, Republic of Mali).  In the interest of meeting the growing needs of their customer base, the group joined the Soro Yirwaso loan program this year and is on their first loan.  

Nana T. expects to use her loan to buy 2 cartons of broth cubes, 50 kg of fresh onions, 25 kg of garlic, 2 small bags of salt, and 1 can of tomato concentrate.  She stocks up in Tominian and in San.  She is very well-known in Kassene for her business.  She expects to make a profit of 17,000 FCFA, a sum which will allow her to repay the loan and to re-invest in her business.  The other members expect a profit of 15,000 FCFA per month which will allow them to repay the loan and to support their families' needs.

loans.use: Purchase of condiments.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna V. is from the village of Aurora. She is 46 years old. Myrna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 29 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Myrna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Cazadoras Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama  LAS CAZADORAS, se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de México, decidieron ponerle ese nombre ya que cuenta la historia que el lugar que hoy ocupa este municipio ere favorable para la caza y recolección en la epoca prehispanica, tal y como lo dice su nombre. En el cerro del Chapulin está integrado por 11 miembros una de ellas es la señora Patricia G., tiene tres hijos de 15, 11 y 3 años de edad respectivamente, antes de iniciar con su negocio se dedicaba exclusivamente al hogar pero la necesidad y las ganas de salir adelante la llevo a buscar nuevas fuentes de ingreso, con los ahorros que contaba decidierón poner una Miscelanea, la cual ha sido el sustento de su familia, la ilusion de la señora es que un día sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida y que estudien ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad para desarrolllarse como una gran profesionista, con el crédito que la institucion le ha otorgado desea, adquirir más mercancia para que su negocio crezca y algún día poder contar con un minisuper que le permita tener una tranquilidad para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called “LAS CAZADORAS” (The Huntresses) and is located in the state of México.  They decided on this name because legend has it that the place this town now sits on was once favorable for hunting and gathering during the Pre-Hispanic era, just like its name indicates.  It is in Cerro del Chapulín and has 11 members.

One of the members is Mrs. Patricia González.  She has three children who are 15, 11 and 3 years of age, respectively.  Before starting her business she was exclusively a housewife but need and the desire to get ahead led her to seek new sources of income.  With saving she had they decided to open a general store which has been her family’s support.  Her dream is that her children have a better quality of life some day and that they go to school since she never had the opportunity to develop as a great professional.

With the loan the institution grants her she wants to acquire more merchandise so that her business will grow and someday she’ll be able to open a minisupermarket that will give her and her family tranquility.

loans.use: For groceries and furniture for her store.

loans.name: Jivia

texts.es: Jivia, es una mujer de 35 años. Como madre soltera cuida con mucho amor de sus 4 hijos, todos ellos menores de edad. En su casa propia ubicada en Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano, se dirige al puesto que tiene a orillas del puente, donde vende desde hace 8 años, tamales, refresco a base de diferentes frutas, y de vez en cuando comida típica del lugar. Según menciona los días sábado y domingos genera una ganancia neta de 100 nuevos soles diarios. Su mayor ambición y deseo es poder mejorar su negocio y por ende obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan solventar los gastos de sus hijos, pues la pensión económica que recibe de parte del que fue su esposo, no le alcanzará para poder  brindar una buena educación. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “comerciantes”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde es una de las socias más comprometidas, con el desarrollo de su asociación. Jivia, viaja constantemente a las ferias que se realizan en la ciudad de Villa Rica y Oxapampa, por ello con el crédito comprará de 30 javas de frutas de todas la variedades, para comercializarlos a los pobladores del lugar.
texts.en: Jivia is a 35 year-old woman.  As a single mother, she cares for her 4 minor children with a lot of love in her own home, located in Puente Paucartambo (in the central Peruvian rainforest.)  For the last 8 years she has gotten up early every morning and gone to a post that she has on the side of the bridge where she sells tamales, drinks made from different fruits, and occasionally, dishes that are typical of the area.  On Saturdays and Sundays she generates net earnings of 100 Peruvian soles a day.  Her main ambition and desire is to be able to improve her business, so that she can have higher earnings that would allow her to cover the expenses of her children, because with the stipend that she receives from her ex-husband she cannot provide them with a good education.  She belongs to the communal bank "Comerciantes," and this is their 5th loan cycle with MFP.  She is one of the members who is most committed to the development of her association.  Jivia travels constantly to the markets that are held in the cities of Villa Rica and Oxapampa.  With this loan she will buy 30 crates of fruits of all varieties, to sell to the residents in her area.

loans.use: to buy 30 crates of fruit

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy engine oil, filters, shampoo and polisher

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn T., age 66, is a widower who has four children. Three are single and two of them are working. One is married and lives independently. 

Sourn T. is highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses. He lives in Kompong Tom province. He has a few laborers to help provide his service. He receives a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses. 

Recently, Sourn T. has been very busy at his business due to there being many clients who need him to build their houses, but he is still lacking material for construction. That is why Sourn T. requested a loan as capital to buy extra construction materials.

loans.use: to buy extra construction materials

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es:
Don Julio, es un señor de 53 años de edad, reside en Chilanga departamento de Morazán, vive en compañía de su esposa, se dedica a la venta de CD Y DVD de forma ambulante, ofreciendo sus productos a los vecinos del lugar y a otros municipios. Este  negocio lo tiene desde hace 7 años, surgió la idea por la necesidad y el desempleo, para llevar el sustento a su familia.

Actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, este inversión será importante para fortalecer el negocio y ofrecer a los clientes variedad de música y películas, obteniendo más oportunidad de venta.

Su objetivo es crecer en el negocio, que a través de él pueda adquirir un lote para hacer su propia casa.
texts.en:
Julio is 53 years old and lives with his wife in Chilanga, within the Morazán department.  He sells CDs and DVDs on foot, offering his products to his neighbors and others.  He’s been in this business for seven years, after he got the idea out of necessity to support his family while he was unemployed.

He is asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise.  This will be an important investment that will help strengthen his business by allowing him to offer his customers a greater variety of music and movies, improving his chances of making sales.

He wants to grow with his business and eventually be able to buy a lot where he can build a house.

loans.use: to buy CDs and DVDs for resale

loans.name: Alnie

texts.en:
48-year-old Alnie is a married woman living in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with her family. She has three children aged 23, 21 and 19. Her husband works as a farmer and driver.

Alnie is also a farmer. She helps her husband grow rice crops. Alnie does her best to keep their farm productive.

Alnie's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for her business to be stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn N. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 40 years old. Jocelyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, beverages & biscuits in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia, de 32 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Hubert de 30 años y su mamá Marcelina, ubicada en la localidad de Huayounioc. Los días de Amelia comienzan muy temprano por la mañana, junto a su esposo recorren una hora de caminata, hasta llegar a sus cultivos; donde comienza su labor diaria en el trabajo de la tierra que los vio nacer. Sus cultivos de arveja, papa y zanahoria son de muy buena calidad, motivo por el cual son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y le cansan mucho.  Además menciona que ayuda a su madre a cuidar de sus animales. “Mi mamá es mayor y me gusta apoyarla”, menciona. Por ello en adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción, ya que desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y sobre todo de su made a quien quiere mucho. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Progreso Huayounioc”, y este es el séptimo crédito con  MFP, donde es muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su asociación, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Amelia, con el crédito solicitado comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus sembríos y de esa manera tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en: Amelia, 32, is a hardworking and unassuming woman.   She lives in her parent's house in Huayonioc with her husband Hubert, 30, and her mother, Marcelina.  Amelia's days start very early in the morning, when together with her husband she walks an hour to her fields.  There, she starts her daily work on the land where she was born.  Her cultivations of peas, potatoes and carrots are of very good quality, which is why they are highly sought after in the wholesale market of Tarma.  What she likes most about her work is caring for her crops.  She has been doing this work for 8 years, and what she considers most difficult is transporting her products to Tarma, since the sacks that they carry are very heavy and tiresome to carry.  In addition, she mentions that she helps her mother to care for her animals.  "My mother is older, and I like to help her," she states.  In the future she wants to buy some new lands to increase her production, since she wants to improve her family's quality of life, especially that of her mother, who she loves very much.  Amelia belongs to the communal bank “Progreso Huayounioc”, and this is their 7th loan cycle with MFP.  The people in her communal bank are very punctual with their payments, because they don't want to create problems for the association, with which they feel very content.  With the loan she requests, Amelia will buy a number of sacks of organic fertilizer to sprinkle over her crops, so that in this way she can have a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Xiomara Yeskeli

texts.es:
Xiomara, es madre de tres hijos de 5, 9 y 12 años, vive con su esposo y se dedica a la venta de pupusas, administra una tienda, también vende frutas en una escuela y su esposo es agricultor, actualmente él iniciara la siembra de maíz, para ello necesita comprar abono y fertilizantes.
Xiomara solicita el préstamo que dará uso el esposo comprando los insumos que necesita para el cultivo, pagando mano de obra para preparar la tierra.
El objetivo de ella es tener una fuente de ingreso más por eso apoya a su esposo en el área agrícola, ya que juntos velan por las necesidades de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Xiomara is the mother of three children who are 5, 9 and 12 years old.  She lives with her husband and sells “pupusas” (typical Salvadoran fast food), runs a store and also sells fruit at a school.  Her husband’s a farmer.  He is about to start the new corn planting and needs to buy manure and fertilizer.

Xiomara is asking for the loan that she’ll give to her husband for the necessary supplies he needs for the crops and to pay labor costs to prepare the soil.

Her goal is to have another source of income and that’s why she helps out her husband in the agricultural area because they watch over their children’s needs together.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer and also to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has children. 

Arlene has a shop that sells canned goods, rice per kilogram, breads, and snacks. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, rice, and breads.

Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, rice, and breads.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de URUBAMBA, perteneciente a la provincia de URUBAMBA,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ceviche que es un plato que es a base de pescado con limón y rocoto acompañado de camote, ella vende en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 9:00 a.m hasta a las 4:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ceviche. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar el ceviche como pesacdo, limones, camotes y rocotos.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Julia, 28, is a member of the “Cristo Asención de Rumichaca” communal bank which is located in Urubamba District belonging to Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.

She’s single and has a son.  She alternates her daily chores with selling ceviche, which is a dish made from fish with lemon and peppers served with sweet potato, in Urubamba’s market from 9am until 4pm.  She wants to expand the business and is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to make ceviche like lemons, sweet potatoes and peppers.

She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make ceviche.

loans.name: 11 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vân Anh operates a food stall selling pork pies. She is requesting a loan to purchase pork to make pork pies to sell.

Vân Anh is 26 years old and she is married with no children. Vân Anh is the group leader of the 11 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of eight members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Vân Anh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Vân Anh has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Vân Anh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Vân Anh hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase pork to make pork pies to sell

loans.name: Rheza

texts.en:
Rheza is a 35-year-old married woman living in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has three school-aged children to care for. She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store at home to earn a living. From three years of running the business, she is glad to earn a monthly income of PHP 4,000. 

Owing to a lack of revolving funds, Rheza has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 from GDMPC to purchase grocery items and to buy "tuba" (the villagers' favorite drink derived from coconut sap) to sell in her store. She has been a member of GDMPC for one year. Rheza hopes to manage the store properly and expand the business area to increase her cash inflow.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and  to buy "tuba" (the villagers' favorite drink derived from coconut sap) to sell in her store.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Marichu has a retail shop that sells clothing like t-shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy ready to wear clothing such as t-shirts and blouses.
Marichu is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marichu hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ready to wear clothing such as t-shirts and blouses

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children. Three of them go to school. She also takes care of her sister. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her biggest monthly expense is school fees.

She sells charcoal on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last year. She works seven days a week. Her other source of income is rental houses and Mobile Disco.

She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Rose's business challenges include rainy season, which makes roads impassable, and thieves. Her aspiration is to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Las Positivas Group

texts.es: Guillermina se inicio vendiendo en un puesto  de mercado donde brindando desayuno, almuerzo y cena, la cual llevo varios años trabajando de esa manera, pero con  esfuerzo y   el buen uso que  le dio a sus ingresos pudo invertir y de esa manera iniciar su propio negocio, actualmente ella  cuenta con un pequeño kiosco de golosinas, negocio que le ha permitido apoyar a sus 03 hijos en su educación ya que están en etapa escolar, es por ello que Guillermina tuvo que trabajar arduamente  para sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que nos manifiesta que es madre soltera. A sus 50 años Guillermina se siente con todas las fuerzas de seguir trabajando y de esa manera brindarles  lo mejor a sus hijos ya  que son su motivación para seguir progresando. El deseo más grande de Guillermina es que sus hijos terminen de estudiar. Con el crédito solicitado va invertir en su negocio  comprando de galletas, caramelos, chocolates, entre otros dulces y de esa manera surtir su kiosco. La Alcancía Comunal “Las Positivas” es un grupo conformado por 07 integrantes donde Guillermina es la presidenta del grupo, ellos agradecen el apoyo brindado.En la fotografía podemos apreciar a la sra. Guillermina ella viste un polo rojo.Gerson no pudo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Guillermina started selling in a stand in the market where breakfast, lunch, and dinner were served. She worked there for many years but due to her effort and the good use of her earnings, she was able to invest and in this way start her own business. Currently, she has her own sweets stand which has allowed her to support her 3 children in their education as they are currently in school. This is why Guillermina had to work very hard to be able to have her children get ahead since she has made it known to us that she is a single mother.

In her fifties, Guillermina feels full of strength to keep working and in this way provide the best she can for her children as they are her motivation to keep making progress.

Guillermina's biggest wish is to have her children finish their studies. The loan she requested will be used to invest in her business buying cookies, candies, chocolates, amongst other sweets, and in this way add variety to her stand.  

The Communal Bank "Las Positivas" is a group made up of 7 members of which Guillermina is the president. They are very grateful for the support given to them. In the picture, we can see Guillermina wearing a red shirt. Gerson was not present because of work reasons.

loans.use: to buy cookies, candies, and chocolates.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent bills.

For the past four years, he has operated a cereals selling business, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. In addition, he also operates a charcoal-selling business. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. His major dream is to expand and establish a food-stall business. 

With the KES 40,000 he wants to purchase cereals and charcoal for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase cereals and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Chuma Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from members of Chuma SHG group in Western Kenya! Samwel is the facilitator of the Chuma SHG group. These farmers reside in the Chwele district. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Samwel and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Samwel takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure food security for his family and educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, Samwel improved upon past harvests with a maize yield of seven bags on three quarters of an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Samwel was only able to harvest five bags of maize on that land. 

With income from maize sales, Samwel will invest in building a house, and in livestock. 

In 2012, the members of Chuma SHG group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize.

In the photograph above, Samwel is pictured with his group members with the Field Officer (Bonface) at the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Wazekese Y/g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wazekese Youth Group in Western Kenya! It's headed by David as its facilitator. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

David is a father of four children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, David had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, David was only able to harvest 9 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to David and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, David will save for future use and educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Wazekeze Youth group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

David is pictured with his group members in the photograph above, with their Field Officer Maxwell in Red and Black at the left side.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: Segundina tiene 38 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora. Vive en su casa propia junto a sus tres queridos ya que es padre y madre para ellos. Hace 03 años  abrió una tienda de abarrotes donde vende variedad de productos como: galletas, gaseosas, arroz, fideos, entre otros. Siendo su negocio muy concurrido por vecinos y amistades, que encuentran todo lo que necesita para su casa. Asimismo ello la considera como una madre ejemplar ya que une fuerzas para sostener sola a sus hijos. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es poder estar junto a sus hijos dedicarse constantemente a ellos. Desde que se entero que la institución MFP apoya a los más necesitados no dudo en participar y solicitar su crédito para poder incrementar más productos en su tienda. Este es su sexto crédito  solicitado con MPF, ha sido muy puntual en sus créditos anteriores y trabaja con responsabilidad sin causar problemas en su banco comunal. Con el préstamo solicitado, logrará incrementar más productos para su tienda como: galletas, fideos, azúcar, arroz, entre otros.
texts.en:
Segundina, age 38, is a hardworking woman who lives in her own home with her three beloved children. She already plays the role of both father and mother to them. Three years ago, Segundina opened a grocery store where she sells a variety of products such as cookies, sodas, rice, noodles, and other items. Her business is very busy with neighbors and friends who visit because they can find everything they need for their homes. In addition, Segundina is considered to be an exemplary mother because of the strength she has to support her children by herself. What she enjoys most about her work is being able to stay with her children, so she constantly devotes herself to them. Since joining the MFP organization, Segundina has not been hesitant to request the assistance that she needs. Therefore, she is applying for a loan so that she can increase the amount of products in her store.

This is the sixth loan she has requested from MFP. Segundina has been very punctual with her previous loans because she wants to work responsibly without causing problems for her Communal Bank. The loan she requested will be used to increase the inventory of her store. She will buy cookies, noodles, sugar, rice, and other products.

loans.use: to buy cookies, noodles, sugar, rice, and other products.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantsetseg is 44 years old and lives with her husband, both of her children have moved out. She is a cook and has been working as a cook in some public organizations since 1986. 

Since she married and moved to the new apartment with her family, she has still been using their initial furniture which was made in Russia. The furniture has became very old and is damaged now. Therefore she decided to buy new Korean and Western furniture for her home. It needed over MNT 2,500,000 to purchase. The loan she is taking out will be used to purchase the new furniture to do renovations at her home.

loans.use: To purchase the some new furniture to do renovations at her home.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 23 years old and lives in West Point. She’s single and has two children, nine months and 9 years old. The older one is in school and lives at home. For the past four years she has been selling cold water and soft drinks, She started this business with a small amount of money and she learned it from her mother. What she likes about this business is that it helps her to take care of her children and makes her feel proud of sending her children to school.  She requesting a loan to purchase more water by the sack and soft drinks for her business.  Her future plan is to build her house and get married.

loans.use: to purchase more water by the sack and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Puthea

texts.en: Puthea, 31, is married and resides with his wife in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. Puthea is a blacksmith, and his wife sells desserts at a local market in the city. Putheais is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. By doing so, his family is able to decrease the expenses of public transportation. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Fatimata

texts.fr:
Mme  FATIMATA  est mariée  et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans et le moins âgé a 17ans. Tous  vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes  en charge(ses 04 enfants plus son mari).

Elle vend des pagnes et chaussures  depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché de secteur 10. Ses clients sont  les femmes et hommes.

Elle veut  s’acheter  10 pagnes, 20 chaussures  et 10 complets.

 Avec  ses bénéfices, elle veut  renforcer  son commerce. Elle ambitionne  ouvrir un autre hangar de vente de pagnes.
texts.en: Mme  FATIMATA is married and the mother of 4 children. The eldest is 21 and the youngest 17 years old. They all attend school. She has five dependents (her four children plus her husband). She has been selling 'pagnes' (traditional cloths) and shoes for 6 years. She buys her stock in the 'secteur 10' market. Her customers are male and female. She wants to purchase 10 'pagnes', 20 shoes and 10 suits. With her profits, she wishes to strengthen her business. Her goal is to open another covered stall selling 'pagnes'.

loans.use: to buy 10 wraps ('pagnes'), 20 shoes and 10 suits

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is a 29-year-old married woman who has 3 children. She and her husband have a fishing business in Talibon, Bohol where they also live. This business has been running for 4 years.

Marjorie has requested this loan to repair their fishing boat. This will help Marjorie continue running their fishing business. Marjorie hopes to acquire another fishing boat soon.

loans.use: to repair a fishing boat.

loans.name: Jesugnon 6 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUGNON 6 est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Floride est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Floride est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Sylvain. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et quatre restent à leur charge. Floride vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Floride mène comme activité depuis treize ans environs la vente de divers articles (savons, biscuits) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Floride vend des charbons de bois et de la farine de manioc. Cette activité lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Floride s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Floride sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUGNON 6, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Jesugnon 6 Group consists of three people who live in the same neighbourhood.  This is the fifth time that this group is asking for a loan from Alidé in order to improve the standard of their business.  The representative of the group, Floride, is pictured here with her hand raised.

Floride is 42 years old and is married to a merchant named Sylvain.  The couple has five children, some of whom are in school and four remain dependents.  Floride lives together with her husband and their children.  The various household needs are provided for by the couple.  To meet this end, Floride has run a business for about thirteen years selling various products (soaps, biscuits) from her home.  Secondarily, Floride sells cassava flour and charcoal.

This business has allowed her to contribute to providing for the needs of the family without great difficulty.  Floride buys her stock in a region of Benin.   In order to satisfy her clientele and improve her turnover as well as profits, Floride is asking for her fifth loan from Alidé in conjunction with the other members of the Jesugnon 6 Group.  The four previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: Acheter des produits divers (savons, biscuits, charbon de bois, etc.)

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 24 years old and conducts his farming activities in Kenya’s South Rift Valley.  His farm produces poultry and milk.  He also operates a tea retail business, sourcing tea from other farmers in the area and selling it to the processors and wholesalers in the local market.

Benard has requested a loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow and grow his dairy business.  He previously borrowed a first loan of 30,000 KES, which he promptly repaid.  Benard adds that the loans help him improve his farming business and he expects growth to increase as a result.

He says the major challenge to farmers in the area is the lack of farming skills, which is a necessary requirement for farmers to mitigate the challenges inherent in the business of farming.  He encourages Juhudi Kilimo to intensify its farmer training programs.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lisonia

texts.en: Lisonia, a 49-year-old married woman, lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She used her last loan to purchase farm fertilizers to elevate production, and she is now requesting a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Lisonia expects to earn enough to  eventually purchase more farmland to work.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Sofronio

texts.en:
Sofronio is 60 years old and a widower.  

Sofronio is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Sofronio requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

Sofronio has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. He successfully paid back his previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build his business.

In the future, Sofronio would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Daniel, a farmer from a small village in the Litein area of Kenya, which is scarce of available land. He lives on his farmland with his wife and children. 

Daniel started farming in order to provide food for his family and earn additional income from the farm activities. Today, his primary income sources from the farm are milk, maize, and a variety of food crops. 

Daniel has favored animal keeping since they can provide a regular source of income at a low cost to maintain. He already owns poultry, but he is seeking a small business loan to purchase a dairy cow. The cow will provide milk for both home consumption and for sale. Income from the dairy investment will help him settle other business related expenses such as farm inputs for crop cultivation. 

Daniel stated, "With the money, I will be able to buy another cow and boost my family's income. I will use the income to pay tuition fees for my children without a strain."

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Séverine Justine Antoinette

texts.fr:
Séverine a 41 ans. Son mari, âgé de 31 ans travail au sein d’un organisme malgache. Le couple a 3 enfants Le premier, âgé de 20 est une fille, par son premier mari et qui habite chez lui. Le deuxième, un garçon âgé de 13 ans, encore son enfant avec son premier mari. Et enfin, le petit dernier, âgé de 3 ans, qui est le fruit de l’amour avec son mari actuel.
Elle est dans la vente de poisson de mer maintenant. Et en est à son 2ème prêt. Avant elle s’est concentrée dans la vente de poissons séchés. Son activité se résume par la commande de ces produits pour la livraison vers ses clients gargotes. Notons qu’elle est la seule à faire cette activité car toutes les poissonneries se situant dans sa zone ont tous déjà fermé leurs portes.
Elle a pour objectif de créer sa propre poissonnerie.

loans.use: acheter un congélateur d'occasion

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en: Sokhom is a 44-year-old woman with five children living in Kampong Cham province. She is growing rice and working as a labor for others to get income to support on her family’s living. Sokhom has been with her business for 24 years and she can save from her daily income about 5 USD per day. Because her rice grow not well, so she can sold her rice in lower price than last year. For Sokhom, this is her fifth cycle loan with VisionFund and she has paid back her past loans on time. She can get more income to improve her family’s living with a decent household supplies via her previous loans. In a group of two members, she is the group leader. Sokhom will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay for harvesting fee. She wishes that she can get higher yield than before to upgrade her lifestyle get better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to fullfil her crop to be well growing and increase the yield.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 47 years married with six children.  She is a nutritionist in the village where she lives.  She educates other members within the community of the importance of growing and eating vegetables for a healthy living.

 She started her business in 2003, grows and sells vegetables. Her main customers come from Muranga town who sell the vegetables as far as the city Nairobi. She is assured of the market because of the high quality of her vegetables. She has been receiving loans from the group but the group is unable to handle the demand because of her demand for a bigger loan.

loans.use: The loan applied for will be used to buy pesticides as well as fertilizers to get a high yield on a small piece of land.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en:
Akbar was born in Gubadli region of Azerbaijan. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP). He settled with his family and three children in Sumgait city. Difficulties in life forced them to start a business in order to provide for his family. He started by selling vegetables. By borrowing a loan of $300 he was able to buy a refrigerator and expanded his inventory to include a wide range of fruits. 

Akbar has applied for a loan of $500 so to cintinue to expand his inventory to include other agricultural products.

loans.use: He plans to sell agricultural products

loans.name: Roth

texts.en: Mr. Roth P. is 40 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife, Leng Vichet.  Roth works as a preacher, and earns $12/day.  His wife sells fried bananas and earns $3/day.  They have 3 children that they send to school everyday to learn.  With this loan Roth P. plans on buying a motorbike so he can preach more, and also so he can easily get to the refugee camp near the Thai border where he is planning on working next.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transportation to his new job at a refugee camp

loans.name: Eudocia

texts.es:
Eudocia and her husband have 12 years of experience in the making of paintings. Her husband acquired this skill by working for his father. She saved and decided to set her own framing business. She works everyday from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. In the morning she works on the frames and in the afternoon she goes out on her tricycle to sell her work close to her residency. She began with 10 clients and now has a group of 100 clients to whom she delivers her work.

She will use this loan to buy prime materials needed to make her framed pictures. With this investment she will gain better discounts when purchasing and, therefore, increase her income.

Eudocia is married. She is 44 years old. She has five children who currently study. The older children help her husband make the pictures. Besides helping her husband, she is a teacher. She works in a school near her residency. She also works in the afternoons teaching how to do homework. Their desire is to be able to increase their income in order to purchase a second-hand handcart which would be of great help to transport the framed pictures.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer

Eudocia junto a su esposo tienen ya una experiencia de 12 años con su trabajo de elaborar cuadros. Actividad que la adquirió su esposo trabajando para su padre. Fue ahorrando y como ya tenia el conocimiento decide poner su propio taller de cuadros. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. Los elabora por las mañanas y en las tardes los sale a vender en un triciclo por un sector cerca de su domicilio. Comenzó con 10 clientes. Actualmente tiene una cartera de 100 clientes a los cuales les deja sus trabajos.

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de cuadros. Con esta inversión obtendrán mayores descuentos en sus compras. Por ende sus ingresos van a mejorar.

Eudocia es casada. Tiene 44 años. Cinco hijos los cuales todavía estudian. Los mayores ya le ayudan en la elaboración de los cuadros a su esposo. Además de ayudarle a su esposo Eudocia es profesora. Trabaja en una escuela cercana a su domicilio. Y también por las tardes ella trabaja enseñando tareas. El deseo de ellos es poder mejorar sus ingresos para poder comprarse un carrito usado. El cual le serviría de mucha ayuda para trasladar sus cuadros.

loans.use: Buy wood and other prime materials

loans.name: Dora Maricela

texts.en:
Dora Maricela C. Avila, 20, does what she can do to help out her family. She works along with her mother, sisters and brothers to make ends meet. For the past 20 years the whole family has been making masks and papier-mâché's for the special festivals in the area. (The picture shows the whole family with some of their masks. Dora is the second from the left in the red shirt.) She took out her first loan to buy materials to make more papier-mâché characters and also to stock the little school supply store she has in front of her house. Before she opened the store the children in the neighborhood had to cross the extremely dangerous Pan-American highway to buy school supplies. Now they can stay safe and visit little store.

With this loan, Dora will expand her business into making tortillas. She will buy firewood for cooking, and corn and lime to make the tortillas twice a day.

Dora graduated from high school by working during the day and attending school at night. She wants to continue with schooling to become the equivalent of a registered nurse, but she does not have the money to buy the required equipment and pay the US$30 a month she would need to finish the two years of schooling.

The members of her tightly knit family all pitch in either to work their corn fields (a two hour walk away) or make masks or to make tortillas. Dora's father is seriously ill and can't work so it is even more important for all the others to pull their load. Dora does not hesitate to work to help support the family even if it means she may not be able to realize her own dreams.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase supplies and wood to expand into making tortillas

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es:
Business Description

Franklin has been in business for 10 years. He began selling plastic goods including "laminas educativas" (posters made of plastic that are used as teaching aids). Little by little, he added other products. He works everyday from 7am to 9pm. His wife helps him with the business.

Loan Plans

The loan will be used to supply his business with items like toys, costume jewelry, cosmetics, etc. He's also thinking about selling soft drinks, juices, yogurt, vegetables, etc. to meet the demand coming from people in his neighborhood.

Personal Information

Frankin is 61 years old and has 5 children, all adults who also help him. His small house is of mixed construction. He hopes the business will give him security and that he can complete construction of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Franklin tiene una experiencia de 10 años con su negocio. Se inicio con la venta de láminas educativa y artículos plásticos. Poco a poco fue adquiriendo otra clase de productos para su local. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. Su esposa le ayuda en la atención del negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en surtir su negocio. Con artículos como juguetes, bisutería, cosméticos. Piensa además invertir en víveres, colas, jugos, yogurt, legumbres. Y de esta manera satisfacer la demanda que tiene de gente de su sector.

Información Personal

Franklin tiene 61 años y 5 hijos. Los cuales ya son adultos y le ayudan en sus necesidades. Su casita es de construcción mixta. A futuro espera darle seguridad a su negocio y terminar de construir su casita.

loans.use: Buy new and broader range of goods for resell.

loans.name: César

texts.es:
César is 39 years old, married, and has a 6 year old son. César sells electronic items such as radios, calculators, watches, flashlights, batteries, dvds, in addition to sunglasses, cell phone cases, etc.

César has been selling these items for 10 years, previously he sold his products from a little table on the sidewalk on the city center's streets. Today he has his own shop and tells us he has a very good profit margin.

He wishes to continue to grow and increase his stock, so he is asking for a loan to invest in the wholesale purchase of radios, dvd burners, telivisions, calculators, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Cesar tiene 39 años, el vive en pareja y tiene un hijo de 6 años. César se dedica a la venta de artículos electrónicos como radios, calculadoras, relojes, linternas, pilas, dvd, además de anteojos para sol, estuches para celulares, entre otros.

Cesar se dedica a esto hace ya 10 años, anteriormente vendía sus productos sobre una mesita en la vereda de las calles del centro de la ciudad, actualmente ya cuenta con su propio salón y nos cuenta que posee muy buen margen de ventas.

El desea seguir creciendo y aumentando su stock de mercaderías, para ello solicita el crédito que lo invertirá en la compra al por mayor de radios, reproductores de dvd, televisores, calculadoras, etc.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of radios, dvd burners, calculators, etc.

loans.name: Deicy

texts.es:
Deicy is a mother, separated and 30 years old. Her husband went to Argentina but sends her money for their three school-age children who live with Deicy in a home in the Alto Pagador sector of the city of Cochabamba.

Deicy sells accessories and utensils for the home in bulk or retail, such as: blankets, comforters, kitchen utensils and other home products. She has more than 10 years experience in this type of business, she sells on different market days in various provinces, she also sells in the Cancha sector during the Wednesday and Saturday markets. The competition is high, especially in Cancha, as many people are selling the same products, but Deicy faces this competition by working harder and moving from place to place, she never stays in just one spot.

Deicy buys comforters and blankets from wholesalers in La Paz and sells them for a higher price, either per unit or by quarter- or half-dozen. She also sells pots, pans, spoons, forks and other kitchen utensils, the prices vary and she resells at a higher price since the service she offers is to bring the merchandise practically to someone's door or to where there are no markets.

This request is her seventh with our institution; at the same time she has a loan with another organization but her track record in both financial institutions is good.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Deicy es una madre separada de 30 años de edad, su esposo se fue a la Argentina pero le manda dinero para sus tres hijos que están en edad escolar y viven con Deicy en una casa familiar en el sector de Alto Pagador de la ciudad de Cochabamba.

Deicy se dedica al comercio al por menor y mayor de accesorios y utencilios para el hogar como son; frazadas, edredones, utencilios de cocina y otros del hogar. En este tipo de rubro tiene una experiencia de más de 10 años, vende en diferentes ferias en las distintas provincias, como también ambula en el sector de la CANCHA los días de feria miércoles y sábado. La competencia en este tipo de negocio es elevada y sobre todo en la CANCHA, existe mucha gente que se dedica al comercio de estos productos, pero Deicy hace frente a la misma esforzandose y recorriendo varios lugares, no se queda en un solo lugar.

Deicy compra a los mayoristas paceños los edredones y frazadas y ella vende ya sea por unidades, cuartas o medias docenas a un precio más elevado. También vende ollas, sartenes, cucharas, tenedores y otros artículos de cocina, los precios de los mismos varian de acuerdo al artículo y aumentan ya que ella el servicio que ella ofrece es prácticamente de llevar a domicilio o donde no hay mercados. Esta solicitud es la séptima con nuestra Institución, paralelamente tiene un crédito con otra entidad financiera pero su comportamiento en ambas financieras es bueno.

loans.use: Increase working capital.

loans.name: Darling Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs. Darling L., mother of two school age daughters, started her beverage business with a little wooden table in the la Terminal market of León 3 years ago.

Her greatest efforts to get ahead have caused her business to excel. Early in the morning, she heads out to her business space in the bus station on the outskirts of the market and starts her sales.

Today, her business has improved because she has acquired a small refrigerator in which to put her products. She has also replaced her old table for a better one. All these improvements are due in part to the support she has received from Ceprodel, which has given her 18 loans to date. With these loans, she has been able to purchase her products and at the same time cover her modest household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Con una mesita de madera hace 3 años en el mercado la Terminal de León inició su negocio de venta de agua, gaseosas y jugos la señora Darling L. quien es madre de dos pequeñas niñas en la edad escolar.

Sus grandes esfuerzos por salir adelante la han llevado a sobresalir en su negocio, desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, ella se prepara para comenzar las ventas del día yendo hacia su local en las afueras del mercado la Terminal específicamente en la estación de buses.

Hoy en día, ha mejorado la situación de su negocio debido a que ha adquirido una pequeña refrigeradora donde colocar sus productos, además ha cambiado su antigua mesa y ha colocado una en mejores condiciones donde poner sus productos. Todo este desarrollo de su negocio se debe en parte al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel que le ha otorgado un total de 18 créditos hasta el momento con los cuales ha podido adquirir sus productos y a la vez llevar el sustento a su humilde hogar de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase of water, soft drinks, and juice

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mrs. Cheng Y., 45, is a mother of five children and also owns a stand selling a variety of grocery products. She normally earns on average a profit of $1.5 a day.  Her husband, Mr. Cham Chem, 47, is a wedding chef earning $2 a day of profit. All of their children live away from home. To generate an additional income this couple requests a loan from Kiva of $1000 to purchase a motor-bike to use as a motor-taxi and to buy more grocery products.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products and a motor-bike to be used as a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Mrs. Ou S., age 44, is a mother of seven children and works for a tobacco company. She also owns a plot of farmland growing a variety of vegetables. On average, she earns approximately $1.50 a day. Her husband works as a construction worker building houses and also helps his wife grow vegetables. He also makes $1.50 a day.

One of their children is married and lives away from home, two daughters are employed by a garment factory with a salary $100 each a month and the other children are students and assist their parents.

This couple will use the loan to purchase a cow to help with the farm fields and to purchase pigs to raise for their use.

loans.use: To purchase  a cow and pigs.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Don Juan lives in the district “Hugo Chávez” in Managua, he is 39 years old, married, with two children, 17 and 5 years of age, the older one is studying high school and the younger has just started in school. He is a merchant who owns a small general store with a variety of products. He has had this business for the past 4 years and he has been able to make it grow by means of loans. This activity has allowed Don Juan to support his family and offer them better life standards as well as a house to live in. With the loan don Juan will change the roof of his house and business. His wish is to always generate enough income to support his children and offer them education which he will achieve setting his heart on making his business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Don Juan habita en el barrio Hugo Chávez de Managua, tiene 39 años de edad, es casado, con 2 hijos de 17 y 5 años, ambos se encuentran estudiando, el mayor ya en secundaria, y la menor empezando sus estudios. Es un comerciante que posee una pequeña distribuidora en donde oferta variedad de productos. Tiene 4 años de estar en este negocio, el cual ha podido sacar adelante a través de financiamientos. Esta actividad le ha permitido a Don Juan mantener a su familia y darles mejores condiciones de vida, así como una casa donde habitar. Con el préstamo don Juan cambiará el techo de su casa de habitación y también de su negocio. Espera poder siempre tener un ingreso para mantener a sus hijos y darles educación, lo que logrará poniéndole mucho empeño a su negocio para que siga creciendo

loans.use: Change the roofs of dwelling and general store.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Nhem K. is a farmer in Phnom Penh where she grows rice and some vegetables to support her family. Normally she makes less than one dollar per day. Her husband, Mr. Kart Son, 55, grows mushrooms. Mushrooms are one of the favorite vegetables of the region. Mushrooms sell for good prices at the market. Everyday he brings a new crop and sells it at the market earning approximately $1.30 a day.

To get his crops to grow faster, Mr. Son would like a loan to purchase rice husks, straw and fertilizers. (Pictured: Mrs. Nhem K. is picture because her husband is not available)

loans.use: To purchase rice husks, straw and fertilizers.

loans.name: Song

texts.en: Mrs. Song B. is a 54 year old widow with three children, living in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. One of her children is employed in a garment factory while the others assist her with her poultry and pig breeding businesses. Even though Mrs. Song B. has two business activities, she still cannot sufficiently support her family, therefore she would like to start a cow breeding business in order to improve her family conditions. Mrs. Song B. is asking for a loan to buy a cow. Previously, Mrs. Song B. obtained a loan from AMK to start her pig breeding business.

loans.use: To start a cow breeding business

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Mr. M. advertises by means of a vehicle with loudspeakers, promoting sales and events. He is very grateful for the support he previously received with this first loan from Kiva. With that loan, he was able to give the down payment on his vehicle so that he could use it to promote his products and those of other businesses in the city of Nuevo Laredo. He has already repaid his loan and is requesting another one so that he can purchase a higher capacity sound system, thus increasing both his clientele and his income. His children also work in this business. They are all independent, but the family collaborates in sharing the equipment for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. M. se dedica a la publicidad de otros negocios perifoneando en la ciudad sobre promociones y eventos. El Sr. Pedro está muy agradecido por el apoyo que recibió del primer préstamo de Kiva. Con el préstamo el pudo dar el enganche de su vehiculo para trabajar promocionando sus productos y los de otros negocios en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. El ya pagó este préstamo y está solicitando otro para comprar un sonido de mayor capacidad para su negocio y así tener a más clientes y más ingresos. Sus hijos también se dedican a este negocio del perifoneos. Cado uno es independiente pero la familia colabora en compartir equipos para el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase loudspeakers

loans.name: Catherine

texts.fr: Née en 1956 à Agomé-Tomégbé, Madame Y.  Catherine a abandonné ses études primaires pour faute de moyens. Veuve et mère de deux (02) enfants, elle s’est donnée au commerce de l’alimentation générale qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants car son mari n’a rien laissé comme héritage. Elle sollicite un financement qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce et de facto ses revenus. Ce qui lui permettra alors de subvenir convenablement aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1956 in Agomé-Tomégbé, Mrs. Catherine Y. left elementary school due to a lack of financial means. Widowed and the mother of two children, she became involved in selling groceries, allowing her to pay for the needs of her children because her husband did not leave any inheritance. She is requesting financing that will allow her to increase her business funds and thus her revenue. This will therefore allow her to adequately support her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling groceries

loans.name: Ama Sara

texts.fr:
Née en 1973 à Logopé dans la préfecture de golfe, madame A. Ama Sara est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Son activité consiste à faire la restauration du riz et la pâte d’igname communément appelée foufou dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2006 et accueille beaucoup de clients jusqu’à nos jours. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé.
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 05 sacs de maïs, 60 tubercules d’ignames et 10 sacs de riz.
texts.en:
Born in 1973 in Logopé in the Gulf Prefecture, Mrs. Ama Sara A. is married and the mother of one child. Her business consists in food service: cooked rice and yam porridge, commonly known as foufou, sold in the Agoè neighborhood. She began this business in 2006 and still has lots of customers today. She has already received one loan and correctly reimbursed it.

This second loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy 5 sacks of corn, 60 coco yams, and 10 sacks of rice.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of corn (maize) and coco yams for food service

loans.name: Luz Angela

texts.es:
La Señora Luz Angélica, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas de la Molina II”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo. Se dedica a la confección de ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños. Confecciona y sale a vender en los pueblos cercanos, así como también visita a amigos familiares y vecinos de su barrio, también trabaja en base a pedidos.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 06 meses, mandará arreglar su máquina de coser, así mismo comprará hilos de diferentes colores, telas para la confección de este tipo de prendas de diversos colores, elásticos, blondas y otros accesorios que se requiere en este tipo de trabajo. Quiere contar con lo necesario para realizar su trabajo y cuando le llegan pedidos, porque no siempre le hacen buenos pedidos.

Luz Angélica tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus 02 pequeños hijos que aún dependen de ella. Es una mujer positiva y emprendedora, sueña con implementar su taller de costura porque quiere ser una microempresaria de lencería y de diferentes tipos de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Luz Angélica, Banco Comunal "Las Brisas de la Molina II" partner, lives in San Martín region and province, La Banda de Shilcayo district. She is 31 and lives with her husband and two young dependent children. Luz produces women’s, children’s and men’s underwear and sells it in nearby towns and to friends and neighbours, working on a custom-order basis. With this 1,500 sol loan, which she will repay in six months, Luz will have her sewing machine repaired and buy different colours of thread and material, elastic, lace and other accessories required for this type of work. She wants to have everything she needs to do her work so she is always ready when orders come in. She is an optimistic and industrious woman who dreams of setting up her own garment shop. She would like to be a lingerie/clothing microenterprise owner.

Translated from Spanish by ian harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in maintenance of her sewing machine and buy thread, material, elastic, etc.

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 40 años, convive con su pareja de muchos años, han tenido 4 hijos que viven aun con ellos. Ana es ama de casa, y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, en horas de la tarde le ayuda en sus labores después de llevar el almuerzo, su actividad es de todos los días, desde que empezó a su relación conyugal, y les va muy bien. Ellos siempre han sembrado grandes cantidades de café y cacao, porque cuando tiene buen precio recuperan todo lo invertido, a pesar de pagar peones, es por ello que es fiel ha sembrar café. Su preocupación es que sus plantaciones ahora no están reaccionando como debería ser, considera que necesitan ser abonadas. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Y con el dinero va a comprar abonos para regar en sus plantitas de café, para que el adelante pueda cosechar grandes cantidades, esto le costará un aproximado de S/.920 a más.
texts.en:
Ana is 40 years old and has been living with her partner for many years. They have 4 children who still live with them. She is a homemaker, and her husband works in agriculture. In the afternoon hours, she helps him with his work after taking him his lunch. They work every day, as they have been since they got together, and things have been going well. They have always grown large quantities of coffee and cacao because when they sell at a good price, they recoup all the money that was invested, despite having to pay the farm workers. For this reason, they have been faithful to growing coffee plants. She is worried, however, that her crops are not growing properly, which is why she thinks they need to be fertilized. This is the first time she requests a loan from MFP. With the money, she will purchase fertilizer for her coffee plants so that she can harvest greater quantities from now on. This will cost her about 920.00 PEN or more.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for coffee plants

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Maria Cristina se dedica a la venta de pollo en una colonia localizada en la ciudad de Guatemala, tiene 20 años en el negocio.  Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, y  tiene 4 hijos.  Ha tenido problemas porque hay mucha competencia donde esta su negocio, pero gracias a la forma que ella atiende a sus clientes y la calidad que ofrece ha salido adelante.  Todos los días madruga para preparar su venta y poder terminar temprano, cuenta con la ayuda de una empleada que la apoya para la preparación de su venta...

Con el prestamo ella quiere comprar más pollos y chompipes (pavos) que es lo que se vende en esta época. Doña Cristina desea poder  mejorar  tanto su calidad de vida, como lograr mas facilidades en su negocio,  por ejemplo quiere llegar a tener su carro vehiculo para poder llevar su venta.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina has worked selling chicken for the past 20 years in a small residential area in Guatemala City. She has the support of her husband and four children. She has had some challenges because there is a lot of competition where her business is located, but thanks to the good customer service she provides and the quality she offers, she has been able to keep moving forward. Every day she gets up at dawn in order to prepare her chicken for sale and to be able to finish early. She has one employee who helps her prepare the chicken to sell.
