With this loan, she will buy chickens and turkeys which are sold a lot during this time. Cristina would like to improve her quality of life and grow her business--for example, she would like to eventually purchase a car so that she can more easily carry her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens and turkeys to sell

loans.name: Margarita Asuncion Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Margarita Asunción del Carmen A. F., tiene 37 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Emprendedoras II y vive en el Asentamiento Humano Miguel Grau Mz  C lote 23 del Puerto Marítimo de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa y complementó sus estudios con el aprendizaje de Corte y Confección. Manifiesta que gracias al Movimiento Manuela Ramos aprendió Maquillaje, pedicure y manicure que le enseñaron en un bonito taller.
De su primer compromiso matrimonial tiene 3 hijos, y del segundo compromiso tiene una hija, los cuales todavía son estudiantes.
Margarita atiende un Wawa Wasi y lo hace con mucho cariño y dedicación, pero como es una mujer emprendedora, también se dedica al reciclaje de plástico, lata, papel, bronce, cobre. El Wawa Wasi lo atiende en su casa y el depósito de reciclaje lo tiene en un corralón del costado de su casa.
El primer crédito de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, invirtió 150 soles para reciclaje y con los otros 150 compró pañales para venderlos en el Wawa Wasi a las madres que deseaban.
Con este crédito de 800 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá en reciclaje.
texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita Asunción del Carmen A. F. is 37 years old and belongs to the Communal Bank of Entrepreneurs II (Banco Comunal Las Emprendedoras II). She lives in the Miguel Grau Mz C Settlement, lot 23 of the Maritime Port of Salaverry, Province of Trujillo, District of La Libertad Perú.

She studied secondary education and complimented her studies with an apprenticeship of dressmaking and design. She states that thanks to the Manuela Ramos Movement she learned how to apply make-up and do pedicures and manicures in a beautiful studio.

From her first marriage she has 3 children and a daughter from her second marriage, all of whom are still students.

Margarita oversees a Wawa Wasi (a daycare program for low-income families) and does it with much love and dedication; but as she is an entrepreneurial woman she also recycles plastics, tin, paper, bronze and copper. She tends to the Wawa Wasi in her home and the recycling depository in the small piece of wasteland of her home.

Her first loan of 300 soles was repaid in 4 installments; she invested 150 soles in recycling and with the other 150 soles she bought diapers to sell at the Wawa Wasi to the mothers. This loan of $275 (800 soles) will be repaid in 6 installments and invested in recycling.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invertirá en el reciclaje, she will invest in recycling

loans.name: Corsina

texts.es:
Corcina es agricultora y también se dedica a la producción y venta  D. leche a la Industria PIL (Planta Industrializadora D. Leche), con eso cubre los gastos D. estudio y alimentación D. su familia, tiene tres hijos, vive en casa propia ubicado en comunidad D. Chahuirapampa  sección Achacachi.  


El crédito lo destinara para la compra D. ganado ya que en esta temporada el precio ha rebajado 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Corcina is a farmer, and she also produces and sells milk to "Industria PIL" (an industrial milk processing plant). With the money she earns from this, she covers the expenses of school and food for her family. She has three children and she lives in her own house in the Achacachi section of the Chahuirapampa community. She will use this loan to buy cattle since their price has dropped during this season. This is her first loan with Impro, and a credit evaluation has been conducted which qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina R. runs a business where she sells traditional clothes (Vitenge, Khanga and Wax). Her business is in the Tandika ward in Dar es Salaam.

Safina is an entrepreneur. She is a Tanzanian, married woman with three school children.

In order to supply her business, she purchases the items she sells from Mnazi mmoja wholesale shops. She then sells the goods retail to her customers in the Tandika Market. She uses the income she generates to meet her family's daily needs and to pay her children's school fees.

Safina is requesting a loan of T.shs 1,200,000 to purchase more inventory to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Alicia Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua capital de Nicaragua, la señora Alicia A. se dedica a su negocio de venta de golosinas teniendo su propio establecimiento el cual es abierto todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Actualmente ella ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio y con mucho esfuerzo busca la forma de salira adelante y  por esto es que una vez mas ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las golosinas y así continuar atendiendo su negocio que tanto requiere de su pronta inversión.
texts.en:
In Nicaragua's capital city of Managua, Mrs. Alicia A. has her own establishment where she sells sweets. It's open every day from the early hours of the morning. She has managed to advance her business through much effort. She is looking for a way to advance further, and she has once again looked to Ceprodel for credit to purchase more confections and thereby continue attending to her business, which requires investment.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena es una mujer que ha luchado mucho para sobresalir en la vida, a sus 59 años vive en la casa de su hermana, y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. Cuando Filomena llegó a la ciudad de Puno, hace 40 años, desde su natal Ilave (Distrito de Puno), no se imaginó que se convertiría en una de las distribuidoras de materiales de construcción más importantes de la ciudad. Actualmente trae desde la ciudad de Desaguadero (Distrito de Puno, límite con Bolivia) la mercadería, ya que le sale más barato y la distribuye por las ferreterías de la ciudad a un muy buen precio, lo que hace que tenga mucha demanda.
Filomena disfruta de salir a distribuir los materiales de construcción, ya que le da la libertad de recorrer la ciudad libremente, lleva 14 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para ella es traer la mercadería desde tan lejos, puesto que le resulta cansado. Anhela tener su propia tienda donde pueda vender ella misma los materiales de construcción, ya que desea tener una vejez pacífica y sin necesidades. Es el primer préstamo de Filomena con MFP y se siente muy feliz de la oportunidad, tiene muchas ganas de pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más materiales de construcción para distribuirlos a más ferreterías.
texts.en:
Filomena is a woman who has fought hard to stand out in life. At her age of 59 she lives at the house of her sister, and her biggest wish to have a calm old age. When Filomena came to the city of Puno 40 years ago, from her native Ilave (District of Puno), she never imagined that she become one of most important distributors of construction materials of the city. At present she brings the merchandise from the city of Desaguadero (District of Puno, border with Bolivia), since it is cheaper and then she distributes all the products among the hardware stores of the city at a very good price, for this reason she has great demand. Filomena enjoys going out to distribute the construction materials, since it gives her the freedom of covering the city freely. She has been doing this activity for 14 years and the most difficult thing for her is having to bring the merchandise from that far, because she gets really tired. Her wish is to have her own shop where she could sell the construction materials herself, since she wants to have a calm old age and without needs. It is the Filomena's first loan with MFP (Kiva's partner) and she feels very happy for this opportunity and she wants to repay her quotas on time, since she wants to have access to other loans later. With the requested loan she will buy more construction materials to distribute them to more hardware stores.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Ademir

texts.es: Ademir es una madre muy amorosa, vive un cuarto alquilado junto a su única hija, Nardi de 2 años, y lo que más desea es brindarle buenos estudios. Junto a su inseparable carretilla de helados Ademir pasa sus días, caminando bajo el inclemente sol, recorriendo las calles de la ciudad Juliaca en busca de personas que deseen refrescarse comiendo un delicioso helado, ella es muy alegre, por lo cual sus clientes siempre se acercan a comprarle su producto. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para encargarse de su negocio, así como de las tareas del hogar, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y espera tener más adelante una tienda de helados donde pueda atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Este es el tercer préstamo de Ademir con MFP y espera tener la misma puntualidad que tuvo en sus dos primeros créditos, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y solidaria. Con el dinero que solicita planea incrementar su capital de trabajo para comprar más helados.
texts.en:
Ademir is a loving mother, who lives in a rented apartment with her only child, her 2-year-old daughter Nardi. Her greatest hope is to provide her with a good education. With her ice cream cart always by her side, Ademir spends her days walking under the harsh sun, traveling the streets of the city of Juliaca in search of people who want to refresh themselves with a delicious ice cream. She is a very happy person, which is why her clients always come to buy her product. What she likes most about her job is the freedom it gives her to take care of her business, as well as her household chores. She has spent two years doing this job and hopes in the future to have an ice cream shop where she can provide greater comfort to her clients. This is Ademir's third loan with Kiva partner MFP and she hopes to repay with the same punctuality as her two previous loans. She is a very responsible and supportive member of her village bank. With the money requested, she plans to increase her working capital in order to buy more ice cream.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Korng's Group

texts.en:
Three people are requesting this small loan. They are all residents of Phnom Penh. They have selected Mrs. O. to be the group leader.

Mrs. O. is 50 years old. She is a humble women who earns a living as a local rice farmer. She has been in the farming business for fifteen years and is currently earning around $2 per day. Her husband has had a job as a construction foreman in the village for years. All four of Mrs. O.'s children are working with her husband's business building houses. Mrs. O. is applying for a loan to purchase bananas to sell for additional income, and also to grow rice crops during the rice dry season.

The other two borrowers are Mrs. P. and Mrs. T.. Mrs. P. is 42 years old. She is a farmer who would like a loan to support her farming business. (Mrs. P. was not available to photograph so her husband is in the photo instead.) Mrs. T. is a 58 year old widow who is requesting a loan to begin selling grocery items.

loans.use: To purchase bananas to sell.

loans.name: Fuseini

texts.en:
Fuseini B. is 31 years old married father of three children. All are schooling. Fuseini lives at Dorma in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana with his family. His wife is a petty trader who sells food stuffs on top of a table in the community market.

He is a professional bicycle repairer and he sells bicycle parts. Fuseini has been in this business for two years through which he obtains daily income to support his family.

He travels to Kumasi which is a nearby town to purchase his bicycle parts. He wants the loan to buy more bicycle parts to restock his inventory to avoid everyday traveling. With the loan he believes he can provide a quality education for his kids and grow his business growth. Fuseini would be grateful for your support. He belongs to the village bank called ‘Gyedie mu Aba’.

loans.use: Buy more bicycle parts for servicing.

loans.name: Sumacclla Llamkasum Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Sumacclla Llamkasum está ubicado en el Departamento D. Huancavelica, los habitantes D. la Comunidad D. Huancavelica se dedican  al Comercio y otros poco a la Agricultura y Ganadería fuera D. la ciudad.

Raquel es casada tiene 10 hijos, se dedica a la confección y venta D. ropas, mandiles y frazadas, Raquel inició su negocio desD. que recibió los prestamos D. FINCA Perú, así fue incrementando sus ventas, solicita un préstamo D. 1000 soles para la compra D. materiales D. confección D. mandiles. Su sueño es abrir una distribuidora, le gusta ahorrar pues sabe que tendrá un dinerito extra en caso D. alguna emergencia.

Susan es casada, tiene 3 hijos D. 22, 17 y 9 años, se dedica a la venta D. verduras en un puesto en el mercado modelo D. la ciudad, pero ahora se dedica a la venta D. carne junto a su esposo. Solicita un préstamo D. 600 soles para la compra D. ganados, su sueño es tener un puesto en el mercado asi tendría un lugar fijo para la venta.

Victoria es viuda, tiene 4 hijos D. 21, 18, 16y 12 años, se dedica a la venta D. verduras, tiene que salir fuera D. la ciudad para comprar las verduras al por mayor. Solicita un préstamo D. 500 soles que utilizará en la compra D. verduras por costales, así poder cumplir su sueño D. tener su puesto con mucha mercadería.
texts.en:
The Sumacclla Llamkasum Community Bank is located in the Huancavelica department. The inhabitants of the Huancavelica community work in commerce. A few others work in agriculture and farming outsiD. of the city. Raquel is married and has ten children. She makes and sells clothes, aprons, and blankets. Raquel started this business when she received loans from Finca Perú. Her sales have been increasing. She is asking for a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy materials to make aprons. Her dream is to become a distributor. She likes to save because she knows she will have a little extra money in case of an emergency. Susan is married. She has three children ages 22, 17, and 9. She sold vegetables in the city’s Mercado Modelo (market). She now sells meat together with her husband. She is asking for a loan for 600 PEN to buy livestock. Her dream is to have a stand in the market. Then she would have a fixed place to make her sales. Victoria is a widow. She has four children ages 21, 18, 16, and 12. She sells vegetables. She needs to go outsiD. the city to buy vegetables wholesale. She is asking for a loan for 500 PEN to buy bags of vegetables. That way she could make her dream, having her stand stocked with lots of merchandise, come true.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for their businesses

loans.name: Malaefilogia

texts.en: Malaefilogia A., 57, is married with 2 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business.  She sells to the villagers and the public 3 days per week.  She has no previous loans with SPBD.  Malaefilogia expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~ 110USD).  SPBD loans are Malaefilogia’s only access to capital because sheis not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase knapsack sprayer, knives, chemicals, fertilizer and a wheel barrow.

loans.name: Đặng Thị
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mr. Ream Phurn Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fifteen people living in Kampong Trea village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purpose. Mr. Ream P. is a 34- year-old village bank president. He is employed in a garment factory. He has four children, three of whom are attending the local school and the youngest is too young to work or study. His wife, Mrs. Choek Roung, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In the vegetable growing, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough seeds to grow onions on the field. In order to deal with this problem, Mr. Ream P. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to grow onion on the field.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Jesús J.  vive en casa de renta ya que es solo, el desea tener ya su propia casa, por eso que está solicitando una vivienda por medio de Infonavit pero le está haciendo tiene una diferencia que tiene que pagar, en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero para la diferencia que le están solicitando. 
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para pagar la diferencia y así le puedan entregar su casa. 
Don Jesús trabaja como guardia de seguridad de su centro comercial, esté es el ingreso que tiene y con el cual una parte será para pagar el préstamo.

loans.use: Diferencia de enganche para una vivienda por medio de Infonavit

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en: Celsa B. is from the village of Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 53 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Celsa owns and operates a sari-sari or general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 1,600 PHP a month. In 2007, Celsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Celsa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina said that managing such business needed enough patience and hard works to achieve success in life. She is happily married to Samuel S. who is tricycle driver. The couple strives for their best to earn money for their three children. As of now, her three children are studying and they are in their different level of education. Cristina and Samuel hopes that their three children will someday finish their schooling through sufficient financial support coming from their tricycle transport daily income. 

In this regard, Cristina is requesting to avail the amount of PHP4, 000 as capital for the maintenance of their motor vehicle for transport. She also would like to venture in vending to further help her husband earn for their daily living. Despite of the difficulties in their lives, this couple is doing their best to sustain the needs of their family particularly their children’s educational needs.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been in the motorcycle transport business in Naivasha town for three years now. He is 31 years old, married to Florence Wangari, and they have three school-age children. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan with KADET. With this loan, Peter plans to start a poultry rearing business and sell eggs and meat in the nearby market. His future dream is to continue in the transport business, upgrading from a motorbike to a taxi, as well as to be active in the poultry business.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To start a poultry rearing business

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette P. is from the village of Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga. She is 39 years old. Bernadette is married and has one infant. To make a living, Bernadette raises cattle for sale. Bernadette is just starting this business.

In 2009, Bernadette joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadette has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Bernadette is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional animals. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Bernadette from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites J. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old. Marites is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a  specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fish in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for more than 9 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for selling a variety of fish.

In 2009, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Marites is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan is the first that Marites has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and serves low-income households in Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sandra Hovana

texts.es:
Nuestra socia SANDRA tiene 43 años, es casada, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO” de la Asociación Arariwa. La socia tiene tres hijos de los cuales los mayores son casados y el menor se llama Anderson y tiene tres años.
 
La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de cristales de lentes. La socia tiene una tienda de óptica “Krytalline” donde vende monturas y cristales para lentes y hace el servicio de medición de vista. Ya son 8 a 12 años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar más monturas de lentes para vender en estas fiestas navideñas.             
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Sandra is 43 years old, married, and was born in Cusco. She belongs to the Ricchary Cusco Community Bank, a part of the Arariwa Association. Sandra has three children, the older two are married, and the youngest, Anderson, is three years old. As well as taking care of the home, Sandra sells lenses for spectacles. She has an eyeglass business called ‘Krytalline’ where she sells frames and lenses and tests people’s vision. She’s had this business for 8 to 12 years and it has done well, thanks to all her hard work. Sandra is hardworking, enterprising, and is raising her family well. She needs a loan to invest in her business and buy more eyeglass frames to sell during the Christmas holidays. Sandra is grateful for the opportunity to obtain a loan and promises to make repayments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more eyeglass frames etc. to sell during the Christmas holidays

loans.name: Maria Genara

texts.es:
La Sra. María Genara J. se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida en el Mercado Mayoreo de la Ciudad de Managua, donde ella tiene un menú variado de comidas para el gusto del cliente.  El Crédito que ella solicita en Ceprodel es para la compra de productos varios tales como carne de res y de pollo, carbón, platos desechables, etc. 
Este Negocio inicia en este mismo sitio hace veinte años, era un local rustico de laminas de Zinc y madera siempre en la misma actividad de venta de comidas, esta clienta adquirió esta habilidad e idea ya que antes de dedicarse a este negocio ella trabajaba en una comideria. 
La Sra. María J. es madre soltera con tres hijos a su cargo de los cuales dos están en edad escolar los cuales debe mantener, cabe señalar que esta clienta posee en record crediticio muy bueno con un total de catorce créditos en un periodo de tres años.
Es importante señalar que además tiene otros ingresos como es la venta de Cosméticos con el fin de tener mas ingresos y sustentar su núcleo familiar con mejor nivel de vida
texts.en:
Mrs. María Genara J. works preparing and selling meals in the Mayoreo Market in the city of Managua. She has a varied menu of meals for clients tastes. The loan she requests from Ceprodel is for the purchase of various products such as beef, chicken, coal and disposable plates etc. The business was started in the same location 30 years ago as a rustic place of tin and wood. It has always been a business which sold meals. When she acquired the place she already had the talent and idea of serving meals since she had previous worked in that capacity. Mrs. María J. is a single mother with three children under her care, two of which are school age. It is worth noting that this client posses a very good credit record with a total of 14 loans in a period of three years. It is also important to note that she has other earnings from selling cosmetics with the idea to have more income in order to support her nuclear family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loan is to buy coal, beef, chicken and disposable plates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Shirin

texts.ru: Тагирова Ширин проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 50 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Тагирова Ширин торговлей занимается более 12 лет. Она покупает и продает детскую одежду. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Shirin T. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. She is 50 years old, married and has 5 children. Shirin has been involved in retail sales for over 12 years. She buys and sells children's clothing. She is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Elisa Davalos

texts.en:
Elisa is 62 years old and married to Juan F., who is 65 years old.  The couple has four kids who are married.  Elisa owns a food stall, which she inherited from her mother in 1990.  She now has a significant client base, thanks to the good service she provides.  Elisa's husband helps her run the business.

At the moment, Elisa is trying to expand her business to offer more products to her clients. This is why she requested the loan.

loans.use: Purchase food to sell in her food stand

loans.name: Ndanou

texts.fr: Monsieur Ndanou D. est âgé de 53 ans et habite à Yoff. C’est un père de famille avec une femme et 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 5 et 7 ans. Il  évolué  depuis 1990 dans le transport, activite qu’il a choisi pour gagner sa vie et vivre décemment  avec sa famille. Ce qui l’y intéresse  le plus ce sont les profits relises Il sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs dans l’intention de renouveler la boite a vitesse de son taxi qui est défectueuse. Son crédit lui permettra de mieux rentabiliser son véhicule  et aussi d’améliorer  sa situation sociale.
texts.en:
Mr. Ndanou D. is 53 years old and lives in Yoff. He's married and the father of two children, age 5 and 7. Since 1990, he's been working in transport, a business he chose to make a living and provide decent support to his family. He's especially interested in the realized profits. He's seeking a loan XOF 250'000 in order to replace the defective transmission of his taxi. This loan will enable him to make his vehicle more profitable and to improve his social condition.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace the defective transmission of his taxi

loans.name: Kanvenkoto Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
W. Justine is a 39-year-old married female with four children, all going to school. She has been in the retail business for the last nine years in Gwafu cell, Mukono.

In doing this business, Justine has to grapple with a number of challenges including a limited capital flow. However, with her good customer care skills she has been able to discern some small improvements. For example, she says she usually makes almost 40,000 UGX a week.

Justine is optimistic she will be able to open up a boutique and provide for all her children’s education needs under the auspices of this loan system.

Justine appears at the top left in the small photo and also in the group photo.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, cooking oil and other items for her shop

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
With pig farming and rice farming, Evelyn’s family is sustained. She is 45 years old from Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. In 1986 she started these farming businesses. Today she manages 1 hectare rice field and a piggery with 4 pigs.

She joins Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to back up her business with additional capital. She requested 8,000 Php to buy farm supplies and feeds.

loans.use: feeds and farm supplies

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es:
Martha es madre de tres hermosos hijos,  vive en el barrio La Fuente, de edad de 33 años, junto con su esposo venden cerdo el cual llevan varios años de vender, lo que ah aumentado a sus ventas hoy en día es la venta de granos básicos en donde desea invertir para mejorar las ganancias, ya que para muchas familias el arroz, frijoles son los alimentos principal. 
Su meta es lograr poco a poco ir aumentando de inventario y lograr a si una pequeña pulpería. De esta manera la venta y compra de cerdos, como su pulpería enfocada a su crecimiento. Con el objetivo de poder dar a sus pequeños lo necesario en educación pero hay que apoyarlos mucho ya que todo esta caro, pues estudian en colegio publico, pero los gastos de vestimenta, zapatos, útiles escolares ha incrementado. Por tal razón quiere aumentar las ventas a si como mejorar la infraestructura de su casa ya que parte es de madera ya vieja, falta repellar paredes, embaldosar todo lo desea hacer para mejor seguridad e higiene de su familia.
texts.en:
Martha is 33 years old and the mother of three beautiful children. She lives in the neighborhood of La Fuente. Martha and her husband have been selling pork for several years. Now she wants to increase her sales by selling dry goods. Since many families eat rice and beans as the main component of their meals, she believes selling these products will improve her income.

Her goal is to gradually increase her inventory until she is able to establish a small grocery store. Martha will continue to buy and sells pigs, but she will also focus on the growth of her store. With this goal in mind, she wants to provide her young children what they need to obtain an education because everything is expensive. They attend a public school, but the cost of uniforms, shoes, and school supplies have increased. For this reason, she needs to increase her sales and improve the infrastructure of her home because the wood is aging and the walls need repairs. She also wants to tile all the floors so that they will be safer and cleaner for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beans, rice, oil, and pigs to butcher

loans.name: Idayat

texts.en: Idayat has a hair dressing salon where she makes lovely hair styles for her customers.  She also sells hair extensions at retail prices to her customers. She is 40 years old, married with 3 children. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Rosa Gonzaga Group

texts.en:
Rosa G. is from the village of Mamanga Daku. She is 51 years old and the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosa is married and has 4 adult-aged children. She owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily snacks and other delicacies, in the local community. Rosa has been involved in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2004, Rosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Rosa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina B.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 56 years old, married and has two grown-up children. She is from the village of Potol. Marcelina has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Marcelina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marcelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase inventory and for working capital. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to meet the daily needs of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence has been operating her business of selling secondhand clothes door to door for the last two years. She is happily married with one child who attends school. Her spouse is a taxi driver and helps support his family financially. With this loan of Kshs 20,000 she wants to buy secondhand clothes for adults and children to sell to potential customers in the neighboring community.

She faces the challenge of seasonality, as she has low sales during rainy seasons when she is unable to sell door to door. Florence hopes that one day she will expand her business and open a shop in future. She decided to join Yehu in order to get financial assistance to boost her business. She rents a house with electricity but no piped water, citing food as her greatest monthly expense.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes for adults and children

loans.name: Pet's Group

texts.en:
Eight people make up this village loan and they live in Samraong Mreah village, Takeo province. Mrs. Pet C. is the village bank president having been selected by its eight members. Each member of this village loan will use it to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Pet C. and her husband, Mr. Sroy Bun, are farmers who own a plot of land they use to cultivate rice and they work very hard with their farm to support their four children. Aside from farming, Mr. Sroy Bun is also a construction worker who is able to earn a small income to improve his family living.

For this farm, Mrs. Pet C. will use the loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to cultivate rice.

This couple has four children: one is laborer in an ice factory while the other three are students and also support their parents businesses. Mrs. Sok Soy, Mrs. Mao Lach and Mrs. Chinda Choun, who are group guarantors, are also shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline to cultivate rice

loans.name: Jessica Maria

texts.es: La Señora Jessica Maria tiene 23 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, hace mas de 2 años, que tiene esta actividad por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes por lo que siempre se preocupa por mantenerlos al ofrecerles productos como perfumes, cremas, ropa en general, sabanas, toallas, tratamientos y calzado. Para el futuro le gustaría ampliar su negocio y captar más clientes para así aumentar sus ventas para ella sería un buen beneficio. Es por eso que está muy contenta al solicitar este crédito pues es la primera vez así comprara la materia prima para su actividad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jessica María is 23 years old, and for the past two years she has worked selling merchandise of all kinds. She has many clients that she provides with a variety of products like perfume, creams, clothing, linens, towels, and shoes. In the future she would like to grow her business and gain more clients in order to increase her sales. She is very content to be applying for her first loan because it will allow her to buy the necessary materials for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general merchandise

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios B. is from the village of Caban. She is 55 years old. Remedios is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Remedios owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Remedios joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Remedios from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Pnpov

texts.en: Pnpov C., 29, is married and lives with her husband and two young children in Takeo province. She raises chickens and also works as a hairdresser from home. On average, she is able to make US$5 in profit a day. Her husband is a staff-person from CEDAC organization. His salary is US$5 per day. Pnpov C. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase hair dressing tools.

loans.use: To purchase hair dressing tools.

loans.name: Djifa

texts.fr: A. exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle fait ce commerce depuis  2000, le stock dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients.elle sollicite donc de WAGES un crédit qui lui permettra de rehausser son stock avec 4 pièces de pagnes de qualité phoénix, 3 pièces de pagnes de qualité hitarget et divers. elle est mariée et a une personne à sa charge.
texts.en:
Mrs.A. is a retailer of « pagnes », she has been in this business since 2000. Her current stock does not allow her to satisfy her customers needs, so she requests a loan from WAGES, in order to increase her stock with 4 pieces of Phoenix "pagnes", 3 pieces of Hitarget "pagnes" and others. She is married and has one dependent person.

Translated from French by viviane reignier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing "pagnes"

loans.name: Askia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe ASKIA est constitué  de 4 femmes mariées  et 3 célibataires  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et ont en moyenne  2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU  I, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de tissus, de pagnes, de bazin avec  ADISSA T., de charbon de bois, de bois de chauffe, de céréales etc.
ADISSA T. compte acheter avec son  prêt, 50 mètres de bazin au  grand marché, auprès des grossistes.
Les tissus sont vendus au  grand marché de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The Askia group is made up of four married women and three single women, who average 33 years of age and have on average three children each. They live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou 1, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (Mali's third administrative region). They are collaborating for the first time with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the goal of satisfying their customers. This group of women trades in materials, "pagnes" (highly decorative West African fabric) and, in the case of Adissa T., damask fabric; they also trade in charcoal, firewood, cereals, etc. With her loan, Adissa T. is planning to buy 50 meters of damask fabric from wholesalers at the large market. The materials are sold for cash at the large market in Sikasso and within her family, to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 27.000FCFA, of which part will be used to help her husband with the daily expenses and the remainder invested in her business. She would like to increase her turnover in order satisfy customer demand better.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy damask fabric

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in Pakpattan, a small city in Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 15 years.  She has 2 sons who have not started attending school yet.

Razia is an embroidery artist by profession. She crafts beautiful embroidery designs onto dresses.  The attraction of her work is that she never use any embroidery machines; she relies only on her hands to make her beautiful designs. She sells her work primarily to her neighbors. She has a good reputation among her clients and earns good income every month from her work. 

Razia is married to T. H., a milk seller by profession. T. has some buffalos at home which provide milk. His clients, including various milk shop owners, are from surrounding areas. He sells milk to them to generate income for the family. 

Razia is a regular client of Asasah, a Kiva partner. She has proved herself to be a dependable client, and has never missed a meeting. She is making her 2nd loan application for a loan for her husband’s business.  He will use the money to buy another buffalo and increase his milk supply, which will increase his income as well. She is hopeful that her husband will make good use of his 10 years of experience in the dairy business to get maximum output from this investment. She also hopes that she will be able to send her children to school soon with the increased income generated by the loan. 

Note: In the photo, Razia is holding a blue book.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for her husband's dairy business

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga O. is a widow. Her husband died seven months ago from pneumonia. Olga has a grown son, Sergey, and two teenage daughters. She is a small town farmer from Kamenka. Olga grows early spring vegetables such as tomatoes and radishes for further retail sale in her region. Olga owns two arch greenhouses. She started this business 25 years ago. She has already invested about 30000 UAH in her enterprise. She spends about 5000 to 7000 UAH on seeds and film every year. 

Olga is requesting a loan of 10000 UAH to construct a greenhouse and purchase polyethylene film for it. The additional greenhouse will provide an opportunity to grow more tomatoes, sell them and receive additional income as a result. After the tragic loss of her husband, Olga was forced to find ways to provide for her family on her own. Lending assistance will be a timely support for this needy family at this challenging period in their lives.

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse and purchase polyethylene film

loans.name: Araba Fynjoyce

texts.en: Araba Fynjoyce S. sells tomatoes and plastic bowls at Elmina. Araba has no educational background. She is divorced and has four children. She has been in this trade for seven years now. She ensures the well-being of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more plastic bowls and containers to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more plastic bowls and containers to sell.

loans.name: Gabiro Group

texts.fr:
Emelyne H. est une commerçante âgée de 25 ans qui habite la Commune Rugombo en Province Cibitoke à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de boissons il ya de cela 10ans. Elle n’a  pas fréquenté l’école. Elle est mariée a Jean-Marie  Mvuyekure qui fait lui aussi le commerce de boissons. Ils ont 3 enfants dont 1 étudie. Elle arrive au 3e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités de  boisson à revendre aux clients et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Elle espère qu’avec les économies réalisées avec ce credit, elle pourra acheter une parcelle pour construire leur propre maison et  assurer les besoins élémentaires familiaux et payer la scolarité de ses enfants.  

Il  est la présidente  du groupe  communautaire« Gabiro».
texts.en:
Emelyne H. is a 25 year old business woman who lives in the commune Rugombo, in the Cibitoke Province, western Burundi. She has been in the beverage business for 10 years ago. She did not attend school. She is married to Jean-Marie Mvuyekure, who is also in the beverage business. They have three children, and one of them is attending school. She is in her third credit cycle with the Community by Turama credit.
She requested the Kiva loan to improve her stock by purchasing a large quantity of soft drinks to resell as well as to increase her funds. She hopes to save enough to buy a plot to build her own house, provide for the basic needs of her family and pay the school tuition for her children.
She is also the president of the community group Gabiro.

loans.use: To improve stock by purchasing a large quantity of soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is an active member and secretary of Ngeet Group in Kitale town, western Kenya, which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last four years. His farm produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables which he sells locally. He is also a matatu (public service vehicle) driver.

He has requested this loan of 62,400KES through Juhudi to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him take care of his family and also invest in other income-generating ventures. He hopes that his milk productivity will double in the next five years and that he will start zero grazing. His major challenges have been high cost of dairy feed and the low price of milk.

Peter is 25 years old and married with two children aged two months and four years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from the village of Panghiawan, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 59 years old. Gloria is widowed and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods & canned goods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Gloria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods & canned goods

loans.name: Rosa Marlene

texts.en:
Rosa Marlene is a 50-year-old entrepreneur. She lives in Playas Canton, one of the tourist destinations of Ecuador, which is known for its large variety of seafood. Her children are grown and moved out already but they help her with her expenses.

Rosa Marlene started selling clothes and make-up 20 years ago. Many years later she started selling sausage stew at her house. Little by little she built her businesses, and now she sells the sausage stew during the weekends at her own restaurant and continues selling clothes and make-up. During the week her clients come to her house to buy the products, and sometimes she goes out and visits clients as well.

She does not face any difficulties in her business at the moment, although she is dealing with some health problems lately. With her $1,000 loan she plans to buy more clothes and make-up to sell. In the future she hopes to improve her business by increasing her sales. She also hopes to improve her restaurant and expand her house.

loans.use: To buy clothes and make-up to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy eggs for resale

loans.name: Duk

texts.en:
Mrs. Duk S. is a 31-year-old married woman, and she is a villager who lives in Peam Reang Leu village in Kandal province. 
She and her husband, Mr. Soun Sun, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to grow vegetables and rice to support their family. Besides farming, Mr. Soun Sun also earns his living by selling water.

This couple has three children. Two are attending the local school and the youngest one is a year old.

In order to support their businesses, Mrs. Duk S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water pump to water the rice plants. She will use the rest of the loan to buy a trailer and a small container to support her husband's other business. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a water pump

loans.name: Carmen Aurora

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora, dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, ella tiene  65 años de edad, está casada y  fruto de  esta relación tiene once hijos todos mayores e independientes, la mayoría viven en otras ciudades solo dos de ellos viven en la localidad. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella tiene una tienda en la que vende dulces y caramelos de todas las formas y sabores, además de helados y sodas, trabaja todos los días desde las 9am hasta las 16h00 y a veces hasta más tarde ya que su negocio lo tiene en su casa, los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo y a veces también va hasta Guayaquil a comprar mayor variedad de sus caramelos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su negocio para comprar caramelos, helados, sodas entre otras cosas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta porque ha hecho muchas amigas en el grupo. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in La Sequita parish which is part of Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí which is filled with hard working, dedicated people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who only know how to work and devote themselves to their families.

We met Carmen, 65, here.  She’s married and had 11 children, all of whom are independent adults.  Most live in other cities; only two still live in this location.  Her husband is a farmer.

She has a store selling all kinds of candy and sweets in a variety of shapes and flavors; she also sells ice cream and soft drinks.  She works daily from 9am until 4pm and sometimes even later since the business is located in her home.  She buys all her products in downtown Portoviejo and sometimes goes as far as Guayaquil in order to get a wider variety of candies.

She will use this loan to better stock her store buying candy, ice cream and soft drinks, among other things.

She’s been in the communal bank for five years and likes it because she’s made many friendships in the group.  Her goal is to stay in business and enjoy good health.

loans.use: To buy ice cream, candy, sweets, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Verónica Del Carmen

texts.es: Verónica del Carmen G. M., reside en Ilopango, junto a su único hijo de 7 años de edad, quien se dedica a estudiar, así mismo vive junto a su esposo. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos comestibles y de primera necesidad para el hogar. Desde ya hace varios años que cuenta con este negocio el cual le permite contar con todo lo necesario para el hogar, así como para poder pagar la mensualidad de su casa. Verónica solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para surtir aún más en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de productos que ya posee y  agregando otros los cuales sus clientes solicitan. Para Verónica es de mucha importancia mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y así mismo sus ganancias ya que es ella es una persona muy responsable que vela por el bienestar de su hogar y el de su hijo, a quien con muchos esfuerzos está logrando darle todo lo necesario.
texts.en: Verónica del Carmen G. M. lives in Ilopango with her husband and their 7 year old son who is a student.  She has a store where she sells groceries and basic items for the home.  She started this business many years ago and it has provided for their needs at home and in paying the monthly rent for their house.  Verónica is asking for a loan to stock even more products in her store, buying a larger quantity of products she already has and adding those that her customers have requested.  It is very important to her that she improve her business and increase her earnings.  She is a very responsible person and watches over the well-being of her home and her son.  With a lot of hard work she is able to give him everything he needs.

loans.use: stock more items in her store

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok R. is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. Sok sells groceries and vegetables, earning an income of 5 USD per day. Her husband sells palm sugar, earning an income of 6 USD per day. Each month the family has to spend 66 USD on food and 55 USD on other necessary expenses.

Sok is requesting a loan of 700 USD. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. She would like to purchase more groceries to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Solidario Flor De Pascua Group

texts.es:
Solidario Flor D. Pascua: Este grupo esta conformado por tres señoras las cuales son Doña Sara C., Milva Alicia,y Doña Albertina C., las tres estan casadas viven con su esposo y sus hijos dos D. ellas tienen venta D. ropa,y la otra venta D. tortillas.
Milva Alicia nos cuenta que a mejorado desD. que le dieron su credito y que a tenido mejores ganancias y que por la gracia D. Dios no a tenido ningun problema con su negocio y que se siente una mujer realizada ya que es un gran apoyo para su familia y que eta muy agradecida con fape por el apoyo que le brindo con dicho credito el sueño mas granD. para ella es agrandar mas su negocio y que sus hijos tengan lo nesesario para estudiar y que sean personas D. bien.
Doña sara nececita su credito para la compra D. ropa tipica  por mayor.
Doña Milva alicia nececita su credito para la compra D. ropa bariada por mayor.
Doña Albertina nececita su credito para la compra D. maiz y leña para elavorar tortillas.
texts.en:
Flor D. Pascua (Poinsettia) Community Bank

This group is maD. up of three ladies: Sara C., Milva Alicia and Albertina C..  They are all married and live with their husbands and children.  Two of the women sell clothes and the other sells tortillas.

Milva Alicia tells us that her business has improved since she was given her loan and that she has maD. better profits.  She says, thanks to God, she hasn't had any problems with her business and she feels fulfilled because it is a great support for her family.  She is very grateful to FAPE for the support that they gave her with the loan.  Milva Alicia's biggest dreams are to make her business even larger and to ensure that her children have everything they need in order to study and become upstanding citizens.

Sara needs her loan to buy traditional clothes wholesale.
Milva Alicia needs her loan to buy a range of clothes wholesale.
Albertina needs her loan to buy corn and firewood for making tortillas.

loans.use: to buy clothes wholesale, to buy traditional clothes wholesale and to buy corn and firewood for making tortillas

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a resident of Muranga in Central Kenya and has been in farming for over 20 years. His farm produces pigs and pork for the local market. He is married with 7 children, all adults.

Peter has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase piglets and their feed. He says his large-scale poultry business will have a big boost and improve his income a great deal for the family good.

Peter says the cost of feed has gone up, posing a challenge to the business. He adds that Juhudi loans have made farming easier for farmers.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Abakundisuka Group

texts.fr: Albert S. est agriculteur du riz dans le secteur du Ruhuha, membre du groupe Abakundisuka, et client d’ACB depuis 2009.  Il a 31 ans, il est marié, et il a 3 enfants entre 2 ans et 8 ans.  Un de ses enfants va à l’école.  Il est né a Bugesera, au Rwanda, et il a une éducation d’école primaire.  Ce crédit est son troisième cycle avec ACB, et il a une très bonne histoire de remboursement.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des fertilisants, et le paiement de main d’œuvre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est l’unité des membres, et vivre dans une même agglomération, la lutte contre la pauvreté en travaillant sans chercher le repos, et la valorisation de la culture de riz dans sa région.  Il voudrait avoir les machines pour lui aider avec son activité, et avoir une vache au moins pour chaque membre du groupe.  Pour sa famille et lui-même, il voudrait avoir une vache pour donner le lait aux membres de la famille, scolariser ses enfants, et nourrir la famille convenablement.
texts.en:
Albert S. is a rice cultivator in Ruhuha sector, a member of Abakundisuka group, and has been a customer of Kiva's partner, ACB, since 2009. He's 31 years old, married, and has three children, aged 2 to 8. One of them attends school.

Albert was born in Bugesera, in Rwanda, and attended elementary school. He is seeking his third loan from ACB, and his repayment history is very good. He will use his loan to buy fertilizers, and to pay for labor.

His strategy for growing the group's business is its members' unity, living in the same agglomeration, fighting poverty by working restlessly, and valorizing rice cultivation in his region.

He would like to own machines to help him with his activity, and at least one cow for each member of the group. For his family and himself, he would like to have a cow to provide milk to the family members, send his children to school, and feed his family in a decent manner.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labour

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es:
El Sr. Ceferino tiene 50 años de edad, está casado, tiene un hijo a su cargo, ya que  todavía está estudiando en la secundaria.
El señor Ceferino se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi en su comunidad, tiene una antigüedad en esta profesión de 4 años, anteriormente era empleado de una empresa, luego con un ahorro adquirió su primer móvil y actualmente posee dos vehículos, de los cuales uno de ellos es su fuente de trabajo.
Solicita el crédito para la reparación y mantenimiento de dicho rodado, pues es su única herramienta laboral y no podría generar ingresos a su canasta familiar de otro modo.
texts.en:
Sr. Ceferino, 50, is married and has one high-school-aged son living at home.  
Sr. Ceferino operates a taxi business.  He has a 4-year old vehicle that is, by the standards of the taxi business, an antique.  Before he started his own business, he worked for another company.  He saved his money and now he owns two vehicles, one of which is his main source of income. 
Sr. Ceferino is applying for a loan to repair and maintain the vehicle.  The business is his only means of supporting his family and without it he wouldn't be able to pay the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to repair and maintain a vehicle for his taxi business.

loans.name: Sandra Yaneth

texts.es:
Sandra, vive con su esposo y un hijo, ella venD. poleada y en donD. vive realiza costuras, ella sale a vender a las calles D. la ciudad D. las 7:00am en delante, también en sus momentos realiza costuras.

Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra D. ollas para el negocio y reparación del carretón donD. venD. las poleadas, con esta ayuda mejorara su actividad ya que con ollas nuevas podrá aumentar la producción y mejorar la calidad.

El objetivo D. ella  es construir su propia casa ya que actualmente está pagando cuotas D. un lote, donD. piensa en un futuro construir la vivienda.
texts.en:
Sandra lives with her husband and son and works selling ‘poleada’ (vanilla custard) and also sews at her house.  She goes out to the city streets to sell starting at 7am and she also sews in her spare time.  

She currently needs a loan to buy pots for her business and to repair the cart from which she sells the poleadas.  With this support, she will improve her business as the new pots will help her to increase production and improve the quality of her food.

Her goal is to build her own house, as she is currently making payments for a lot where she plans to build it in the future.

loans.use: to buy pots for her business and to repair the cart she uses to sell custard.

loans.name: Gulzamira's Group

texts.en:
Gulzamira, 54, is the leader of this group. She is a widow with a grown-up child and resides in the town of Tashkomur. Gulzamira’s business is livestock breeding and reselling. She has been doing this since 1984, when she and her husband bought four sheep and five goats. Since then she has made a monthly income of 6,000 KGS, which has helped to finish the construction of her kitchen. Her initial capital was only 900 KGS. The purpose of this loan is to purchase feed for livestock and two more goats.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase goats and feed for livestock.

loans.name: Narayani

texts.en:
Narayani is 48 years old. She is married and has 4 children, ages 29, 27, 25 and 22. In 2000, she established her business raising cows. Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase a cow.  

In the future, Narayani plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc is a 39-year-old married woman with 2 children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Her husband is a driver. She has been selling beverages and beer in front of her house for 4 years. Their daily income is used to meet their family's basic needs. She needs a loan to provide her with capital to open a stall so that she can sell more beverages and beer for more customers.

loans.use: to have enough capital to open a stall where she can sell more beverages and beer

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Thelma has a retail shop that sells snacks, detergents & noodles. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Thelma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Thelma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has operated his carpentry shop in Ndunyu njeru town for the last seven years. He is 33 years old, married to Elizabeth and they have four children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy timber and more raw materials for his workshop. 

In the future, Peter hopes to grow his workshop and open a bigger showroom.

loans.use: To buy timber and other raw materials

loans.name: Buena Fe Group

texts.es:
El comité Buena Fe nace hace más de tres años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este comité es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, en estos más de dos años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La señora Alva se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, comenta que tiene muchos clientes ya que siempre tiene muchas variedades, este trabajo le genera buenos ingresos, los cuales la ayudan en la manutención de la casa. Dice que todo trabajo es poco para darle a su familia todo lo que ella merece. Uno de sus sueños es abrir una tienda para poder exhibir mejor sus productos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de estación, como ser camperas, poleras, y guantes, lo cual le servirá para poder abastecer su stock de mercaderías. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The “Buena Fe” (Good Faith) committee was born over three years ago thanks to the initiative and support of another committee that was working in that place.  This committee is from the city of San Lorenzo.  In these more than two years of intensive work they have grown both socially and economically.  They are well known in the place for being very hardworking women.

Alva sells all sorts of clothes.  She comments that she has many customers because she always has a lot of variety.  This work generates good income which helps her support her household.  She says that all her hard work is the least she can do to give her family everything they deserve.  One of her dreams is to open a store to display her products better.

She is asking for the loan to buy seasonal items like jackets, t-shirts and gloves which will help her stock up on merchandise.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it gives her.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes for resale.

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es:
En  la ciudad de Managua el  señor francisco jose se dedica  a laborar como albañil  en una empresa de esta cuidad  dedicándose  a esta labor desde hace 05 años, su núcleo familiar es de 3 personas a las que tiene que brindarle mejores  condiciones de vida. 
Una de las necesidades que el señor atraviesa hoy en día es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones por lo que ha tomado la sabia decisión  de iniciar la obra de mejora . es por este motivo que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, perlines .para iniciar la  mejora de la vivienda realizando el cambio de  ,techo por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos y esposa .
Es importante destacar que el señor agrádese a ceprodel por este crédito que se le otorgo porque gracia a este financiamiento va a poder realizar esta obra y proporcionarle a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Señor Francisco José works in construction for a local business.  He has been doing this work for the last five years.  His nuclear family consists of three people, for whom he wants to provide better living conditions.

One of the Señor's current needs is that he must improve the conditions of his home, as it's in bad condition.  This is why he has made the wise decision to start the improvement work, and its for this reason that he came to Ceprodel to request a loan to buy construction materials such as zinc roofing sheets and roofing beams.  He will begin improving his home by replacing the roof; by means of this work he will be able to provide better conditions for his children and wife.

It is important to highlight that the Señor is grateful to Ceprodel for offering him this loan, because thanks to this financing he will be able to undertake this work and provide his family with a decent roof and good conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married to a taxi driver. She has two daughters and two sons. The daughters are married and the sons are at school. In order to earn money for their livelihood, she sells vegetables, potatoes, onions, carrot and oil. She has been in this business for twenty years; with the profits gained from the trade she repaired the house, purchased household furniture, etc. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more vegetables to sell. In the future Gulnara wishes to improve the family’s welfare and to build a house for their sons. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a hardworking businessman aged 58. He is married and blessed with four children. For the last 11 years, he has been managing a retail shop to make a living. He works hard in his business so as to provide for his family, including educating his children.  

In the next five years, he wants to manage a wholesale business. With the loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings, he wants to buy soda, maize flour, soap and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy soda, maize flour, soap and cooking fat.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with no children.
 
Rogelia is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase pigs for her farm.
 
Rogelia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her farm and become a supplier of pork in the province.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for her pig farm.

loans.name: Filipenses 4:13 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Felipenses 4:13 está integrado por tres per personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. El coordinador del grupo es José Antonio de 25 años quien tiene un negocio variado desde la venta de fruta, sopa y comida con unos ahorros. Él está casado y tiene una bebe de 5 meses.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Rosa Ramona quien vende ropa usada desde los 14 años se dedica a este negocio y Rosa Argentina de 47años se dedica al comercio de golosinas y jugos.
texts.en:
The "Filipenses 4:13" ("Philippians 4:13") is made up of three hard-working and enterprising individuals.  The coordinator of the group is José Antonio, aged 25, who has some savings from his business selling a variety of things such as fruit, soup and food.  He is married and has a 5 month old baby.
