The other members of the group are Rosa Ramona who has been selling second-hand clothing for the last 14 years, and Rosa Argentina, aged 47, who works selling candy and juice.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, meat, cheese, chicken, basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Ukulima Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ukulima Group in Western Kenya! Everlyne being their facilitator, Ukulima group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Everlyne is a mother of one child. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and grow enough to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Everlyne had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Everlyne was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Everlyne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Everlyne will save for future use and buy sheet iron for her house.

In 2012, the members of Ukulima group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Everlyne is pictured with her group members in the photograph, with their Field Officer on the far left in the white shirt.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 48 years old and lives in the West Point. She’s single and has six children, aged 12 to 29 years old. Two are presently in school and live at home, while the others are working and live on their own.

For the past three years Annie has been selling rice and fish in the market. She started this business with a small amount of money that she received from her friend, and she learned it from her mother. What she likes about this business is that it helps her to pay her children's school fees on time. She requesting a loan to purchase more rice and  "bonnie" fish for her business.  Her future plan is to save money and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and  "bonnie" fish for her business.

loans.name: Chanra

texts.en:
Chanra is 52 years old and her husband, Sarin, is 54 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1980 and have three sons and two daughters. One is married, one is a hairdresser, another is a construction worker, and the other two are in school.

Chanra sells groceries at home, while her husband is a farmer. She is asking for a loan of $500 to make a new door for her house because the door is old and broken. She will use part of the loan to help with her daughter’s hairdressing business by buying materials such as a blow dryer, rollers, and so on.

loans.use: To make a new door for her house and buy materials for her daughter’s hairdressing business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a 33-year-old married woman with five children. The oldest child is 14 years old.

Rosa and her husband run a fishing business in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells her husband's catch at the market. Rosa and her husband work together to improve their business and provide for their needs.

Rosa has requested a loan to purchase a fishing boat and nets. Rosa plans to pay for her children's tuition fees with her profit.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat and nets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothes such as dresses, ,jeans, and footwear.

loans.name: Jehová Jiré Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Jehová Jiré” está conformado por 19 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran pastelería, productos de amasandería, venta de ropa y la confección de cortinas para camiones. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de San Vicente de Tagua-Tagua.
Rosa delegada de educación del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila de pié, ubicada en el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, vistiendo una polera color negro, su cabello es corto (melena).
Se dedica al rubro de la peluquería, desde hace 10 años. Trabaja desde su casa, ahí habilitó una pequeña pieza, para utilizarla como peluquería. Preferentemente los servicios que entrega desde su casa son cortar el cabello. Y depilación la realiza en los domicilios de sus clientes particulares.
Su horario es relativo, debido a la demanda de sus clientes por lo que tiene disponibilidad para atenderlos cualquier día y en cualquier horario. Comenta que recibe mucha demanda de trabajo, situación favorable para su negocio. 
Los productos que necesita para su negocio los compra en diferentes distribuidoras y casas comerciales cosmetológicas. Además comenta que recibe beneficios y descuentos por compra debido a la antigüedad como clienta frecuente.
Una de sus metas para su negocio, son ampliar el espacio físico de su taller, para esto debe ampliar su casa, lo cual le facilitará su negocio en comodidad.
Con el crédito comprará artículos y materiales para construir su nuevo taller. 
Rosa vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos. Todos ellos estudian en diferentes niveles educacionales, entre universidad, educación media y básica.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo comenta que ha sido muy buena la convivencia con los demás emprendedores. 
San Vicente de Tagua Tagua es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, perteneciente a la región del Libertador General Bernardo O´Higgins, emplazada a orillas del río Estero Zamorano. Su principal fuente económica se basa en la producción de limones, naranjas y paltas. La ciudad ha sido destino de muchos inmigrantes que fueron acogidos y se desarrollaron en ella, principalmente de las colonias palestina, española (especialmente Asturiana) e italiana, que han dejado su legado en la comuna, Casa García, Tienda España, El Portalón, ferretería Covadonga, población Bathich y el reloj ubicado en la plaza de armas son una muestra de los proyectos desarrollados.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Jehová Jiré.  It is comprised of 19 enterprising members who devote themselves to different types of work.  Among them you will find a pastry shop, a bakery, clothing sales, and making upholstery for trucks.  All of them live in the city of San Vicente de Tagua-Tagua.

Rosa is the education delegate of the communal bank.  She is standing in the second row, and she is the second one going from right to left.  She is wearing a black top, and she has short hair.

She has been a hairdresser for ten years.  She works at home; this is where she set up a small area to use as a beauty shop.  The service she chooses to provide at her house is cutting hair.  She provides the service of depilation in the homes of her private customers.

Her schedule is flexible according to her customers’ demand.  She has to be available to provide them with her services at any hour on any day.  She says that there is a lot of demand for her work, which is a favorable situation for her business.

She buys the products that she needs for her business from different distributors and from cosmetic commercial houses.  She also says that she gets benefits and discounts when she buys because she is a frequent and longtime customer. 

One of her goals for her business is to expand the physical space of her shop.  In order to do so she needs to expand her house.  That will make her business setting comfortable.

She will use the loan to buy articles and materials to build her new shop.

Rosa lives with her husband and their three children.  All of them go to different levels of school; the university, high school, and elementary school.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that the Fondo Esperanza has given her to invest in her business.  In regards to the group, she says that it has been very good to be with the other enterprising members.

San Vicente de Tagua Tagua is a city in the central area of Chile in the Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins region on the banks of the river Estero Zamorano. The area's main source of income is the production of lemons, oranges and avocados.  The city has been the destination of many immigrants who have been welcomed and established  themselves there.  They have come from the settlements in Palestine, Spain (especially Asturian), and Italy.  They have left their legacy in the commune; Casa García, Tienda España, El Portalón, Covadonga hardware, the Bathich population, and the clock in the Plaza de Armas are examples of the pojects they have developed.

loans.use: to buy items and materials to build a new shop.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 32 years old and owns a cereals store. She has been in business for the past four years. She describes her business environment as steady, as her customers are regulars.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income. She has applied for a 60,000 KES loan to buy pishori (basmati) rice and beans to sell.

She hopes to grow into a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to buy pishori rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is 57 years old and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City. She is married and has five children. Mila has a snack-vending business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients for her snack-vending business. Mila has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Sok Rorn

texts.en: Sok Rorn, 49, is married, resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been growing rice and employed in garment factory for over two years, earning approximately USD 10 per day. Two of her children are employed in garment factory as well. Approximately, they earn USD 6 per day. In order to improve her agricultural business, Sok Rorn is requesting for a loan of USD 1000 to purchase cattle to use in her farming work. In the future, she would like to purchase timbers to cover her house’s wall and help her children get bachelor degree.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use in her farming work

loans.name: Djekafo Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe DJEKAFO IV sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Zanfina, un des villages de la commune de Konobougou,  préfecture de Barouéli, région de Ségou, 4ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil, l’arachide et le fonio. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KADIA personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,75 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 125.000F CFA environs par campagne.

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Sahie Solomon

texts.en: This is 45-year-old Sahie. He is married and has three children who are 24, 9 and 5 years old. He has four additional dependents who live with him for schooling.  In 2010, Sahid established his Drinks (Bar) business. He began his business because he wanted to become self employed. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Sahid requires a loan in order to buy more drinks of different kinds for resale. In the future, Sahid plans to build a bigger entertainment center and educate his children up to the university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for resale.

loans.name: Koushalya's Group

texts.en:
Koushalya,standing to the right hand side of the photograph is a physically challenged lady living with her husband, two daughters and a son. She is engaged in the activity of weaving handkerchiefs, her younger daughter helps her in weaving it. Her elder daughter works as a tailor in her village. Financial condition of her family is not good because her husband is also a physically challenged person and he is not able to do any kind of work. She brings raw materials like cotton, thread and colors from a dealer and gives back the finished goods to him and in return she gets only the labor cost, which is very less.

Koushalya has a plan to bring raw material directly from the market and sell back the finished product in the market, doing so will increase her income.Koushalya along with her group member has requested for a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum.She will use her portion of the loan amount for purchasing raw materials for weaving handkerchiefs. 

She has a dream that her daughters get married in a good well settled house and save some money for her family’s future.Koushalya is eagerly awaiting for your kind help.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for weaving handkerchiefs

loans.name: Boris

texts.en: Boris P. is a 39 year old computer technician in Guayaquil. At his shop he repairs computers with hardware and software issues and sells computer accessories. He also helps his clients get connected online and shows them how to use the power of the Internet to their advantage. This in itself is a valuable service to the community as he is helping to bridge the technology gap and break paradigms in computer literacy.  Currently he counts on the help of two employees who all help him run his shop from 8 AM until 10 PM. He intends to use the loan to add another employee, buy accessories in bulk and buy newer tools for computer repair.

loans.use: Buy computer accessories and tools for repair

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: At any given time, most any Moldovan farmer knows the local market price for different types of livestock. A chicken is usually sold for about 35lei ($3), a piglet for 300lei ($20-25) a rabbit for 130lei ($10), etc. Farmers talk to each other and buyers often to stay informed about prices and base their business decisions on expected profitability. Similar to any market for goods around the world, Moldova’s animal and produce market sees price fluctuations at different times of the year. Eugenia C. is from the village of Pruteni and always knows the best time to sell her livestock at the market. At 37 years old, she has three main occupations. The first is taking care of the family farm, the second is managing the village’s salon (and also working as a hair stylist) and the third is directing the village’s local animal, fruit and vegetable market. She is able to have both jobs outside her house because the local market and the salon are next to one another and the market is only open for 2-4 days out of the week depending on the weather. Eugenia always notices the current prices of animals and knows the best time to sell her own. She would like a loan to purchase a couple piglets, and a calf to begin raising now and to sell when prices are good.

loans.use: Livestock Purchase

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large market centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Madame D. is a resident of this town and sells plastic and metal containers. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation, and is seeking a Kiva loan of $750.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Magaly

texts.en:
Magaly sells clothes in her local community. This type of activity allows her the flexibility to bring in a stable source of income while also giving her time to spend with her children. While she is out selling, her mother takes care of her youngest one while the others are at school. She began in this line of work with only $15 in investment capital.

Magaly is now requesting her second loan with Mifex and Kiva. With her first loan, she invested in buying clothing in bulk in order to increase variety and lower prices. This investment was successful as she was able to attract more clients. Also, to provide incentive she allowed her clients to make payments plans on certain items and she also had sales every so often. All of this helped Magaly gain popularity in the sector and increase her customer base. She is requesting a new loan in order to buy a glass case for her products and fix her home up as a store.

Magaly is 29 years old and has 4 small children. She feels proud to be able to help her family with the extra money she makes. She is very grateful of the help her mother provides, without her she would not be able to run this business and care for her children.

loans.use: She wants to buy a new glass case for her products

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Ms. Margaret N. is an enterprising lady who has struggled to earn a living for herself and her four children since the death of her husband in 1996. Her children are between ages 17 and 21 years old. Her eldest child who is 21 years old is at the university, while the youngest is in Senior Two.

At the age of 50, Margaret has been operating a food vending business for the past two years.
Following the death of her husband, Margaret worked as a casual laborer in people’s gardens and also made bricks which she used to build a small house on the plot that her late husband had bought.  After completion of the house, she continued making bricks from which she saved some money that she used to start her current business at Kampala veterinary development market. 
She employees two people who she pays on a daily basis.

She now wants to borrow $610 which will allow her to purchase a hinge making machine. This will enable her to increase her earnings. She also says she will be creating job opportunities for her children.

loans.use: Purchasing a hinge making machine

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es:
Bacilia es una señora mayor D. 50 años D. edad, actualmente no tiene dependientes a su cargo, ya que sus tres hijos son mayores y viven D. manera independiente. Bacilia vive en casa propia que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Bacilia se dedica al comercio D. ropa nueva en el mercado VILLA VERD. D. Montero donD. tiene dos casetas propias, el negocio consiste en comprar ropa nueva al por mayor en la feria D. Santa Cruz D. la Sierra, para después comercializar esta mercadería en Montero al por menor. Bacilia tiene experiencia en el rubro D. 18 años, tiempo en el cuál demostró siempre traer mercadería surtida y D. buena calidad. Existe bastante competencia en este tipo D. negocio, sin embargo el éxito se concentra en la consolidación del negocio y la ubicación que tienen las casetas en el mercado. Por otra parte también existe bastante demanda por este tipo D. artículos en especial los fines D. semana. Con la presente solicitud Bacilia adquirirá ropa D. niños, adultos, ropa interior a percios por docena para después comercializar por unidad. La presente solicitud es su quinta secuencia con la Institución con un buen comportamiento D. las cuotas correspondientes, cabe recalcar que estos créditos también fueron otorgados para la compra D. un surtido D. mercadería.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Bacilia is a woman over 50 years of age, who currently does not support any dependents, since her three children are grown and live independently. She lives in her own home that she provides with all her basic needs. She works in the retail business selling clothes in the store Villa VerD., in Montero where she has two booths of her own. The business consists of selling new clothing mostly in the Santa Cruz D. la Sierra market, and later she began also doing some business in Montero. Bacilia has 18 years of experience in this role, and over time has always maintained the quality and amount of the products she sells. There is a big need for this type of business. However, her success is due mostly to the consolidation of her business and the great locations that she has in the markets. There is also a great demand for her products, especially on the weekends. WIth this current loan, Bacilia will buy clothing for children and adults, as well as undergarments, which she will buy at per-dozen prices and sell at single-unit prices. This is her fifth loan with Agrocapital and she has a great history of paying off the loans she used to increase her stock of clothing.

loans.use: Funds to purchase new clothing to sell

loans.name: Gentcho

texts.en: Gentcho R. and his wife used to work in the capital city of Sofia but after one of their children began to suffer from a disease they returned to their native village. Gentcho works on a big farm in the village but also breeds 10 sheep. His wife works as a cleaner in the village school. They want to buy 10 more sheep and request $750.

loans.use: To buy 10 more sheep

loans.name: Scovia's Group

texts.en:
Scovia N. looks after 6 children and needs a loan to increase her clothing inventory. With additional inventory, Scovia hopes to increase her sales and profits.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothing

loans.name: Vincente

texts.en:
Vicente A. is a father of three children, the youngest whom he still cares for at home. His two oldest children have married and live with their families outside of the house. After years of hard work, Vicente was able to buy his own house, the same house in which he raised his three children. Over time, he also bought his own truck which he now uses as a transportation service, working with items like seed, crops, and other large articles. He makes a good living from his service and advertises his service to various farms and neighborhoods. Vicente has since gained a good reputation among the people in the area.

In order to continue running smoothly and efficiently, he needs to buy new parts and additions for his truck. These improvements will allow him to transport more goods at a time and in a shorter amount of time and gain more clientele.

loans.use: To buy car parts.

loans.name: Tith

texts.en: Mrs. Tith C., 26, is a mother of two. She stays at home looking after the children and cooking food for her family. She earns about $2 daily by growing and selling vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Yuk Roth, 27, supplements her income by working as a motor-taxi driver, normally earning $5 daily. As their house is run down, they are requesting about $650 from Kiva to renovate the house.

loans.use: This couple hopes to use this loan to renovate their house.

loans.name: Thea

texts.en: Mrs. Thea L., 37 years old from Dam Dek Commune, Siem Reap Province, earns $5 per day making rice wine and raising pigs from her home. Her husband, Mr. Sorn Sima, is 35 years old and earns $4 per day selling rice from home. They have three children, all of whom are students. In order to sustain their business and earn more, they need to expand, so they are requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more pigs and more raw rice to refine and sell. They hope this loan will help them achieve their goal.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs and more raw rice to refine and sell

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Mrs. A. is 48 years old and has two teenage children, both of whom are students. Rosa Emilia is a hard-working woman and very conscientious in her work. She is a farmer who worries constantly that her land will produce well, as this is how she earns income to support herself and her children.

She combines her farming work with selling fruit, and thinks that selling her own product enables her to obtain a better profit. She needs a loan to invest in agricultural supplies that will help her increase the yields she obtains from her land parcels.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. A. es una mujer de 48 años, tiene dos hijos que están en la etapa de la adolescencia y ambos están estudiando. Doña Rosa Emilia es una mujer luchadora y muy cuidadosa de su trabajo, es una agricultora que se preocupa por que su tierra este siempre produciendo ya que es la manera en que ella obtiene sus ingresos para ella y sus hijos. Combina su trabajo de agricultora con la comercialización de frutas, cree que vendiendo ella directamente sus productos podrá obtener mejores ganancias, y eso le ayudará a aumentar sus utilidades. Necesita el préstamo. necesita para invertirlos en insumos agrícolas que ayudaran a incrementar la producción en sus parcelas de tierra.

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies to increase production.

loans.name: Mamadou Cisse

texts.fr:
Currently a merchant, Mr. N. was an employee of the Senegalese administration, which he left six years ago to devote himself to private business. He sells hardware in one of his stores where his lives. He is married and the father of five children, whom he feeds with the gains from his commerce.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Commerçant de son état actuel ,mr N. fut un employé de l'administration sénégalaise qu'il a quitté depuis 6 années pour se consacrer à ses propres affaires .il fait de la quincaillerie dans un ses magasins chez lui.il est marié et père de cinq enfants qu'il nourrit avec les produits de son commerce .

loans.use: achat et vente de matériaux de construction

loans.name: Chhoin

texts.en: Chhoin K. Soy, 54, works selling VCD, music Discs and tapes from herhome. She sells many kind of VCD and many people always come to buy the Discs from her home. Her husband has been a carpenter since 1991. He makes many kinds of chairs, tables and beds. On average, he earns $10/day. They have four children, two of who are married and live away from home. The business of selling VCD, music Discs and tapes is doing well so they request a loan in order to purchase more inventory for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more VCD, music Discs and tapes.

loans.name: Kattia

texts.es:
Katia had many intentions of being in business, year after year selling clothing door-to-door which unfortunately often did not allow her to spend time with her three children. For this reason, she made the steadfast decision to save money and establish her own store in her home. It’s been a month now since she first opened, and she is proud of her accomplishment. However she has a goal to attract more customers toward which she is putting all her efforts. Her constant motivation is her small children who are of school age. She is a big help with regard to the family’s economic situation, given that her husband’s income often is not enough to cover their living expenses. One of her goals is to improve her store, all while continuing to work buying merchandise. It’s for this reason that she seeks a loan so she can purchase products of a greater variety and that will appeal to her customers. Please help be an integral part of Katia obtaining her loan so she can continue to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Katia tuvo muchos intentos de hacer negocio, año tras año estuvo vendiendo prendas de vestir de manera ambulante y muchas veces esto no le permitía estar tiempo con sus 3 hijos, por ello que tomo la firme decisión de ahorrar dinero y establecer una tienda en su propia casa. Ha pasado recién un mes de haberla abierto y ella se siente feliz de haberlo logrado, pero tiene otro reto, la de adquirir clientes, para la cual está poniendo todo su empeño, su motivación constante son sus pequeños que están en edad escolar y ser un poyo muy importante en la economía de su hogar ya que muchas veces el sueldo de su esposo no alcanza. Una de sus metas es poder ampliar su tienda, mientras tanto sigue trabajando en la compra de mercadería, por ello es que solicita un préstamo para adquirir productos variados y atractivos. Sé parte solidaria en el préstamo de Katia para seguir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock her store with a variety of products.

loans.name: Mawutodji Ben

texts.fr:
Monsieur A. Mawutodji Ben est marié et a en charge cinq enfants tous scolarisés. Très douée dans l’identification et dans l’analyse des opportunité d’affaire, il investi son économie issue du commerce et agriculture dans la construction d’un local pour l’implantation d’un moulin  à maïs qui est quasi inexistant dans sa localité.

Devant ses moyens insuffisants, monsieur A. Mawutodji Ben sollicite un crédit qui va lui permettre de réaliser ce projet. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaire et ses revenus afin de couvrir les besoins scolaires et sociaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mawutodji Ben A. is married and has 5 children that all go to school. He is very talented in identifying business opportunities. He has decided to invest the money he has saved through his business and farming into the construction of a cornmill, a luxury that does not yet exist in his region. Because the money he has saved is insufficient to achieve his goal, Mawutodji is seeking to obtain a loan that will help him bring this project to fruition. This will provide him with additional income that will help him provide for his children so that they do well both in school and in their social life.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a cornmill

loans.name: Georgina Imelda

texts.es:
La señora Georgina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aves Fénix”, ubicado en Jr. Eduardo del Águila Nº 796, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de 2 pequeñas menores de edad, que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como Auxiliar Contable. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en la costura.

En la actualidad, Georgina cuenta con la venta de bebidas naturales como cebada, chicha de maíz, néctar y también cuenta con otra mercadería para vender, ropa.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,300, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de 3 kilos de cebada, 4 kilos de maíz morado y luego comprará ropa para niños. 
   
Georgina manifiesta que recibe un apoyo de Manuela Ramos y está muy agradecida y contenta por pertenecer al banquito “Las Aves Fénix”.
texts.en:
Señora Georgina belongs to the "Phoenix Birds" Community Bank located in Jr. Eduardo del Águila Nº 796 in the district of Callería and the department of Ucayali. She is 35 years old and the mother of two small children who are still dependent on her. She is also married, and her husband works as an Accounting Assistant. With the first S/.300 loan that Georgina received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in crafts. At present, Georgina sells natural drinks like cebada (made from barley), chicha de maíz (a corn-based fermented drink), juices and other merchandise such as clothing. With this loan of S/.1,300 ($450), which will be termed in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of 3 kilos of barley and 4 kilos of black maize. Later, she will purchase clothing for her children . Georgina expresses her gratitude in receiving the help of Manuela Ramos, and is happy to belong to the "Phoenix Birds" community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invertirá en la compra de cebada, maíz morado y ropa para niños.

loans.name: Maksuda

texts.en: U. Maksuda, a seller of children’s wear imported from China, lives in the Spiotamen region where she is married and has two children. U. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2008, her first loan having helped her to establish the business. The stable income generated by her clothing sales enabled her to repay the loan promptly, and she is now applying for a four-month loan from Kiva in order to import new clothing and expand her enterprise.  U. is confident that her good taste in clothing and wide selection of products will allow her business to continue to grow.

loans.use: To purchase new goods and expand the business

loans.name: Iram

texts.es: Iram tiene 24 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres de tercera edad, se dedica al cuidado de ellos.  Iram tiene la gran responsabilidad de la alimentación de sus padres y de su bienestar. Desde sus 15 años ya sembraba en grandes cantidades 2 a 4 hectáreas de café de manera alternada, la herencia del trabajo lo recibió de su padre. A el agrada mucho sembrar, sobre todo café, mas que los cítricos, porque los cítricos  tiene buen precio en cierta temporada, en cambio el café aunque baje no se cotiza en precios muy bajos, solo que para la cosecha se requiere de mucha gente y ahí es donde tiene dificultades, al no hallar mano de obra, nos dice que a su chacra de café le falta el abonado para que explote mejor la tierra y coseche en grandes cantidades. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. El dinero solicitado será usado en la compra de abono para su chacra de café para luego proceder a trabajar, porque el café se trabaja cada tres meses, en esto gastará todo el préstamo.
texts.en:
Iram is 24 years old and single. He lives with his aging parents and has the great responsibility to provide food and care for his parents well being. From the time he was 15, Iram has planted large quantities, 2 - 4 hectares, of coffee, alternating the crops. This is a business he inherited from his father. He prefers growing coffee over citrus fruits for example, because the citrus fruits only have a good price during certain times of the year, while coffee, although the price goes down a little, doesn't have such big drops. However, the harvest requires a lot of people and this is where it gets difficult. He doesn't have enough fertilizer to fully work the land and produce big harvests. This is his first loan with MFP. He will use the money to purchase fertilizer for his coffee crop, and later, as they harvest every three months, he will be able to pay back the loan in full.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for his small coffee plantation

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Apolinar L. le está haciendo falta poner el vitropiso; pero por el momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para esta mejora.
El no pagara mano de obra, porque también sabe de construcción y colocaría el vitropiso en horas adicionales a su trabajo. 
El señor Apolinar L. trabaja en una compañía como chofer de trasportes esté es el ingreso familiar ya que tiene un hijo de pocos meses de nacido y quiere lo mejor para el.
El está solicitando un préstamo  para la compra del material y así poder ponerle el vitropiso a su casa.
texts.en:
Apolinar L. has not been able to install floor tiles in his home because he does not have the money necessary to do so. He is requesting a loan to purchase materials to tile the floors. He is skilled in construction, so he will be able to do the installation in his free time and therefore avoid paying labor costs.

Apolinar L. works as a bus driver and is the sole breadwinner in his family. He has a newborn son and wants the best for him.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to tile floors

loans.name: Mónica Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Mónica Elizabeth M. C. tiene 34 años, es fiscal en el Banco Comunal Las Emprendedoras II  y vive en la Avenida La Marina Mz C lote 4 del Puerto Marítimo  de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Empezaba a estudiar Contabilidad, cuando se casó a los 20 años, ahora tiene 4 hijos que son estudiantes.
Mónica, trabaja en áreas verdes en la municipalidad, los sábados y domingos hace tamales para vender, también vende cerveza según la ocasión, dicha actividad la realiza en su casa.
El primer crédito fue de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió e la compra de productos de limpieza que en ese tiempo vendía.
Con este crédito de 1200 que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá en insumos para tamales y cerveza.
Mónica sueña con mantener a sus hijos sin que pasen necesidades.
texts.en:
Mónica Elizabeth M. C. is 34 years old is a member of the “Enterprising Women II” cooperative bank, and lives in the Trujillo province located in La Libertad, Perú. She was starting to study Accounting when she married at 20 years of age, and she now has four children who are students. Mónica works in green areas of the municipality, and on Saturdays and Sundays makes tamales to sell. She also sells beer based on the occasion, activities she realizes from her home. Her first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles was canceled in four installments, and she used it to invest in the purchase of cleaning products which she sold at that time. With this loan of 1,200.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in 6 installments, she will invest in ingredients for her tamales and in beer. Mónica dreams of supporting her children so they are not lacking anything.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making tamales, and beer.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
A single and a hardworking mother, that is Elmira C.,  26 years of age, residing at barangay Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Elmira is determined to earn money for her only child. While her child is still young, she looks forward to a simple life with enough resources for living and surviving. 


Elmira has been into several micro-businesses before, like garland-making and hog-raising, selling her goods to her neighbors and residents in the  the neighboring village. But as she could see around her community, she realized that fishing is still the most profitable business. So, she decided to switch to fishing   hoping to earn more than the usual income that she gets in garland-making and hog-raising. 


For Elmira able to realize her plan,  she needs PHP 15,000. WIth that amount, Elmira can purchase materials needed for fishing. Being such a hardworking person she would believe that she can make it with a little help from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.

loans.use: purchase needed materials for fishing

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El señor Oscar de 45 años acompañado con la señora Severiana de 41 años, cuentan con 4 hijos.
El señor Oscar es de profesión agricultor el cual le fue heredado de su padre.

Posee 1ha. de tierra fértil en el cual cultiva sus hortalizas como: lechuga, acelga, perejil y tomates. 
Comenta además que sus hijos trabajan con él en su huerta y que gracias a ésto pueden costear sus estudios.

La venta al por mayor de sus productos lo realiza en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Itá y expresa que cuenta con gran cantidad de pedidos.

El crédito obtenido lo invirtió en la compra de abonos y semillas.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar is 45-years old and lives with his companion Ms. Severiana who is 41-years old. They have four children. Oscar is an agricultural professional which is a skill that has been passed down from his father. He own 1-hectare of fertile land which he cultivates for his vegetables: lettuce, kale, parsley and tomatoes. Also, his children work with him in the orchard and he is thankful he is able to fund their studies.

He sells the best products in the municipal market place in the city of Ita and has a large number of orders. The loan will be used to invest in the purchase of fertilizer and seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es: Rocío, junto a su esposo, vela siempre por el bienestar de sus dos hijos, a quienes logró brindarles una casa donde puedan crecer  libremente. La paciencia, arte y creatividad que posee le dieron la oportunidad de dedicarse a la elaboración de collares y pulseras que aprendió a realizar desde soltera, ahora que se casó trata de ayudar a su esposo realizando este trabajo. Es por eso que sale todas las tardes rumbo a su taller que se encuentra a unas cuadras de su casa, donde diseña sus collares y demás accesorios, pues todos los fines de semana, sale a vender y distribuir en las tiendas que se encuentran en el centro de la ciudad. Estos pendientes han tenido gran acogida y cada fin de semana las damas de la ciudad visitan las tiendas con el fin de encontrar modelos nuevos para su colección, lo que incrementa los pedidos de Rocío. Ahora ella desea especializarse y estudiar  para mejorar sus diseños y poner una tienda donde pueda vender directamente según las exigencias y pedidos que le hagan. Este es su noveno préstamo con MFP y desea seguir trabajando con el mismo compromiso  dentro de su banco comunal, pues acceder a los servicios que le brinda la institución le ayudó a mejorar su negocio. Los 2000 soles que solicita es para adquirir grandes cantidades de materia prima para su producción con cuyas ganancias espera instalar posteriormente, su tienda en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Rocio and her husband always pray for the well-being of their two children, whom they are able to provide with a home where they can grow freely. Being patient, creative and artistic gave her the opportunity to dedicate herself to making necklaces and bracelets that she learned how to make when she was single. Now that she is married she helps her husband by doing this activity. Every afternoon she goes to her workshop that is located a few blocks from her house, where she designs her necklaces and other accessories. On the weekends, she goes out to sell and distribute her products at the stores downtown. Her jewelry has been well-accepted and the ladies of the city visit the stores where her jewelry is sold to find the newest pieces of her collection. This increases Rocio’s orders. Now she would like to study and specialize in order to improve her designs and start a store where she can sell her jewelry directly according to the orders her customers make. This is her 9th loan with MFP and she hopes to continue working with the same commitment with her community bank. Having access to these services has helped her improve her business. The 2000 soles she is asking for are to buy large quantities of materials for her jewelry production. She will use the earnings to open her own store in the downtown area.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials for jewelry making

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 28 años, es natural D. L. ciudad D. Huánuco, vive con Patricia, su esposa y su hija Stefany D. 9 años D. edad, en su casa propia. Él es chofer D. un minibús, en el cual su esposa es L. cobradora, trabajan juntos desD. hace 9 años, estando muy contentos, ya que pueden estar juntos a lo largo del día y generar los ingresos necesarios para los gastos D. su hogar y L. educación D. su pequeña Stefany. DesD. que era muy niño siempre le han gustado los carros, es por eso que está ahorrando para en un futuro pueda comprar su minibús propio y trabajar con su esposa, para no tener que pagar un porcentaje D. ganancias al dueño D. L. movilidad. Jorge espera hacer D. sus sueños una pronta realidad, ya que le gusta mucho su trabajo, aunque muchas veces el tráfico y el movimiento suelen ser muy estresantes, pero aún así, piensa trabajar mucho más en beneficio D. su familia, a quienes espera brindarles lo mejor. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita realizará una revisión técnica del carro para brindar un mejor servicio a los pasajeros.
texts.en:
Jorge is 28 years old, from the city of Huánuco. He lives in his own house with his wife Patricia and their 9-year-old daughter Stefany. He drives a minibus which his wife conducts; they have been working together for nine years. They are very happy together since they can spend most of the day together and earn the money needed for household expenses and Stefany's education. Jorge has always loved cars since he was a child and is saving money so that in future he can buy his own minibus and work with his wife without having to pay a percentage of his earnings to the bus' owner. He wants to make his dreams a reality soon, as he enjoys his work (though the traffic can be stressful) he wants to work more to proviD. the best for his family. This is his first loan with MFP, and he plans to pay it back on time. With this loan he will be able to get an auto inspection and proviD. better service to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Service and inspection for the minibus he drives

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarswati B., 40, is a tailor in the town of Tangal in Patan. She opened her tailoring shop more than 10 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like kurta sulwar, blouses, long dresses, makhshi and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs. Majarcharya took a six-month training course in tailoring.

She plans to use the Rs 20000.00 loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to add to her family's income and support her children's education.

Her husband's name is Dinesh B. and he makes brass religious statues. She has three daughters studying in grades 9, 5 and 1.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Salomadjon

texts.en:
H. Salomadjon is 51 years old and is married. She lives with her four children in her own house, which is stocked with basic necessities. Salomadjon has owned a small general store for more than 12 years. She sells foodstuff for everyday use such as sweets, flour, macaroni, sugar, preserved food, soft drinks, etc. Salomadjon runs her business from her home and her children help her. The motive for requesting a loan is to be able to purchase more merchandise to stock the business. More stock of goods will attract more clients and generate good monthly income to help her family. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working! 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ROSMERY, VIVE EN VILLA SEBASTIAN PAGADOR, ZONA SUR DE LA CIUDAD, SE TRASLADA TODOS LOS DÍAS AL MERCADO LA PAMPA, DONDE TIENE SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE LIBROS NUEVOS Y USADOS, DESARROLLA ESTA ACTIVIDAD JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO, QUIEN EN OCASIONES TAMBIEN REALIZA TRABAJOS DE MECÁNICA AUTOMOTRIZ. TIENEN 2 HIJOS PEQUEÑOS. POR EL ESFUERZO LA PAREJA LOGRO TENER CASETA PROPIA EN EL MERCADO, LO QUE ES MUY IMPORTANTE PARA ELLOS PORQUE ES SU MEDIO DE GENERAR INGRESOS.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosmery lives in Sebastian Pagador, in the south zone of the city. Everyday, she travels to the La Pampa market, where she sells both new and used books. Rosmery does this work with her husband, and they sometimes do automotive repair work as well. They have 2 small children. Due to their hard work, the couple has their own stand at the market, which is very important for them, as this is their primary source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase books

loans.name: Las Pagadoras Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Pagadoras” esta conformado por 12 integrantes y representados por la señora Verónica. En general los miembros del grupo se dedican a la venta D. cosméticos por catálogos, venta D. comida rápida, D. licores artesanales, al servicio D. limpieza y a la confección D. prendas D. vestir. Dentro del marco competitivo los socios del grupo no tienen mayor problema ya que cuentan con experiencia y años D. trabajo. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. materiales, mercadería insumos y herramientas que ayuden a mejorar a mejor su producto y a incrementar sus ingresos mejorando así la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. El grupo va cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y honestidad en el cumplimiento D. sus obligaciones
texts.en:
Twelve members make up the Las Pagadoras group, which is represented by Verónica. Most of the members sell cosmetics by catalog, sell fast food, sell homemaD. liqueurs, offer cleaning services, or make clothing. The members do not have a big problem with the competitive field because they have years of working experience. The loan is to buy materials, merchandise, supplies, and tools to help them improve their products and increase their income. This, in turn, will improve their families’ quality of life. The group is in its second loan cycle. They demonstrate responsibility and honesty by meeting their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ndack

texts.fr:
SA/326
Ndack  F.  vend des fruits et des légumes  au marché de Sandiara village situé à plus de 25 km de Mbour  ville côtière. Elle   exerce ce métier depuis plus de cinq (5) ans. Les revenus tirés de cette activité lui permettent de contribuer aux  quotidiennes du manage au même titre que son mari. Le prêt sollicité lui permettra de renforcer ses activités  et de maintenir sa clientèle par la qualité de ses produits.
texts.en:
Ndack F. sells fruit and vegetables in the market of Sandiara village, situated more than 25 km from Mbour, a coastal town. She has been in this business for more than 5 years. The income from this business allows her to contribute to the daily expenses of her household just as her husband does. The requested loan will allow her to bolster her business and keep her clientele coming back due to the quality of her products. SA/326

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of merchandise for re-sale

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 20-year-old single man living with his parents. In 2008, he decided to open his own barber shop.

Today, Khaled is requesting to borrow $800 to buy new tools to better satisfy the needs of his clients.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his barber shop

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: La señora Lucia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Maria Auxiliadora”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 44 años, es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella.Lucia, lleva años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo así implementar su taller de confección de vestidos y como tenia la habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicado en su misma casa.Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus costuras, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. A quienes les  atiende  con la amabilidad y el carisma  que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. Lucia, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Lucia belongs to the "Maria Auxiliadora" community bank in the Tarapoto district in the San Martin province and department. She is married, is 44 years old and is mother to three children, all of whom still depend on her. For years, Lucia has been dedicated to making clothing. Gradually, she has been generating her own income and saving money with the desire to start her own seamstress shop. Since she has the ability to sew, she didn't doubt that she could succeed and, with the support of the Manuela Ramos Movement, she decided to start her own business located in her own home. She tells us that she is doing well with her sewing work. She works on orders that her customers make in advance and to whom she attends with the friendliness and charisma that she is known for. With this loan of S. 800, she will purchase different types and colors of fabric in metres, tools that she uses like scissors, thread in large reels and of various colors, sewing needles and sewing machine needles, pins and buttons. Today, Lucia feels like an accomplished woman, with greater desire to succeed and realize the rest of her dreams. She is thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business, as well as many other women who desire to grow business-wise.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase different types of fabric.

loans.name: Manolita

texts.en:
Manolita Q. is from the village of Dullan. She is 65 years old. Manolita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Manolita makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Manolita has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Manolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Manolita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Manolita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food items for sale. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Manolita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food items for sale

loans.name: Idermunkh

texts.en: Idermunkh is 35 years old and lives with his wife and nine-year-old son in the Uyurkhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Idermunkh’s wife operates a mobile retail clothing business while Idermunkh owns and manages his housing and furniture business.  He began his business in 2003 by making only the wooden walls for gers. He soon partnered with his friend, Ganzorig, and they expanded the product line to include furniture as well.  The business has been so successful that Idermunkh purchased a truck which allows him to deliver his products to his customers. Idermunkh would one day like to open a small factory in which he can produce even more products with ease.  He is requesting a 1,800,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase more wood and supplies in order to expand his business and keep up with his customers’ orders.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and supplies

loans.name: Thanks You Allah Group

texts.en:
Thank You Allah is a group of 5 borrowers led by Hawa S., 37 years old. Hawa is married with 2 children, aged 16 in 9th grade and 18 years old, a high school graduate. She is illiterate herself, due to poverty.
She and her family live in Molton Corner but she works in Dualla Market, the biggest food market north of the capital, Monrovia,Liberia .

Hawa's business is selling food from rural Liberia. She buys food like cassava beans, oil and plantain from farmers and she sells retail in the Dualla market, north of the capital, Monrovia,Liberia. She has been running this business for 11 years. Hawa hopes to grow her business to the level where she can have a shop and sell general goods, in the future.
Hawa talks to her customers in a good manner and offers them good prices in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. She needs this loan in order to purchase more goods like Cassava oil, farina and etc.
Hawaa dreams of improving the standard of living for her family by educating her children and building a house for the family.

loans.use: She needs this loan in order to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Eudisa

texts.en:
Eudisa B. together with her husband and children hope that their fishing and wholesale fish selling business will grow and become sustainable. Aside from Eudisa’s dream of helping her three unemployed children have their own source of income, she also wants her business to generate employment outside of family members. Above all this, she wants her youngest daughter to graduate from high school and college to be able to find herself a better paying and stable job in the future. 

Eudisa believes that her dreams will forever be just a vision without access to a loan. Therefore, through her membership in ASHI, she is requesting a much larger amount to finance the growth of her business, and her profits will be used to improving their standard of living as well as to help people in need of job.

loans.use: To increase the volume of fish she buys and sells and to finance her fishing business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 56-year-old married mother of eight children, some of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. Kade is a commercial town. However, the majority of the inhabitants practice farming as a major occupation alongside other trading activities. 

Janet is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice with stew. She sells by the roadside in the mornings. Janet buys her food ingredients from nearby big towns. She has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Mrs. Chatha Nat Village Bank Group

texts.en:
A village bank loan which consists of nineteen people is located in Pou Thum village in Kandal province.  All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Chatha N. is the village bank president. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store in the local village.

Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more general products to resell to earn more income and improve her business. Her husband, Mr. Hoem Sokha, helps her with the business. Mrs. Chatha N. is 31 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy general products to resell to earn more income and improve her business.

loans.name: Shirley Wilma

texts.es: SHIRLEY VIVE EN LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ, EXACTAMENTE EN LA CASA DE SUS PADRES EN LA CALLE PEDRO DE LA GAZCA. ES COMERCIANTE DE PLÁSTICOS Y CRISTALERIA, TIENE EN MENTE LA EXPANSIÓN DE SU NEGOCIO POR LO QUE SOLICITA UN CREDITO PARA INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE TRABAJO. NUESTRA EVALUACIÓN INDICA QUE ESTA EN CONDICIONES DE RECIBIR UN CRÉDITO.
texts.en:
Shirley lives in the city of La Paz, specifically in the house of her parents on Pedro de la Gazca Street. She is a vendor who sells plastics and glassware. Shirley wants to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan for additional working capital. Our evaluation indicates she meets the conditions to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” desde hace 6 años atrás, del distrito de Santa Rosa, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudió hasta segundo de secundaria, tiene su tienda de abarrotes y también se dedica a la venta de tejidos (en sus ratos libres).

Elsa nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  arroz,  azúcar, fideos, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda grande y que sus hijos sean profesionales. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las facilidad de pago de los préstamo.
texts.en:
Elsa, 28, has been a member of “Generación 2000” communal bank, which is in Santa Rosa district, El Collao province, Puno department, for the past 6 years now. She lives with her life partner and has 3 children. She finished 8th grade and has a grocery store; she also sells woven cloth in her spare time. She tells us that she used her first, 300 new sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her capital. She now needs 2000 new soles to buy rice, sugar, pasta, etc. Her dream for the future is to have a large store and that her children become professionals. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings and the comfortable payment plan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, pasta.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for resale

loans.name: Sophie

texts.fr:
Madame Sophie D. est une dame de 46 ans qui a adhéré a la caisse de l’U-IMCEC de Ouakam il y’a un an. Elle a déjà bénéficie de deux prêts antérieurs. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants.
Pendant la période de chaleur madame D. s’adonne a la vente de glace et de jus et ceci depuis 1982. Elle vend aussi devant chez elle ou a l’école qui se trouve non loin de chez elle des fruits saisonniers pour enfants tels que les oranges, des bonbons, des biscuits et divers autres. C’est l’évolution de son commerce de jus qui l’a beaucoup motive a vouloir progresser dans son activité commerciale. Ainsi elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs pour acheter un stock de produits qui va lui faciliter la préparation de petit déjeuner .Les différents prêts qui lui ont permis d’augmenter son capital ont été pour elle l’occasion d’accroitre ses revenus et d’acquérir de nouveaux matériels et en même temps d’équiper petit a petit sa maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sophie D., 46, has been a member of U-IMCEC Ouakam for one year. She has already received two loans. She is married and the mother of 6 children.

During the hot season, Mrs. D. sells ice and juice, something she has been doing since 1982. She also sells, in front of her house or at the school located near her, seasonal fruit for children such as oranges, as well as candy, cookies, and various other items. The evolution of her juice business is really motivating her to expand her enterprise. Thus, she is requesting a loan of 250,000 frs to buy a stock of ingredients that will let her prepare breakfasts. The previous loans that have allowed her to grow her working capital have led to increased income and permitted her to acquire new materials as well as equipping her house, little by little.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana G. is 53 years old and is the single mother of four children, who are now grown up.

Juana began making clothes in 1981 with her aunts, saving all of her income so that she could purchase a sewing machine and begin to work on her own. Now, she has four sewing machines, and her daughters work with her from her home.

Juana will use the loan to purchase fabric, thread and other materials to make dresses which she will both rent and sell.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and thread and other materials

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia M. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 42 years old. Lydia is married and has five adult-age children. To make a living, Lydia owns a sari-sari (variety) retail store which primarily sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lydia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Lydia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Folake

texts.en:
41-year-old Falake is a trader; she sells foodstuffs like yams, garri (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava), eggs, etc. She has been in this trade for over eight years and she likes doing this business. She hopes to expand her business by purchasing more foodstuffs to sell.

Falake is asking for loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs, e.g. tomatoes, pepper, onions, etc. In combination with what she has in her shop, this will improve her sales and attract more customers to her shop.

Falake is married and has four children. Her youngest child is 8 years old and they are doing fine in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Falake is a member of LAPO micro-finance with a good repayment record. She promises to repay her loan on its due dates. She thanks LAPO micro-finance and Kiva for this initiative.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Hongorzul

texts.en:
Hongorzul is 34 years old and lives with her husband and son in Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a "ger". They have been living together in their current home for eight years. 

Hongorzul and her husband sell motorcycle parts at a local market called Uv-Tehnik (Inheritance-Technics). They sell a variety of Chinese and Russian motorcycle parts, repair equipment, and painting supplies. They purchase their products once or twice a month in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Her working capital now exceeds 2,520,000 tugrugs (~ $1775 USD) and her average monthly sales revenue exceeds 800,000 tugrugs (~ $562 USD). Hongorzul's monthly profit is 215,000 tugrugs (~ $150 USD). She now operates her business in a shipping container that she owns. In the future, she plans to purchase a tire repair center, expand her production line, and increase the quantity of products that she sells. 

Hongorzul is a very enthusiastic and hard-working person. She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrugs (~ $700 USD) loan to purchase tire repair equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase tire repair equipment

loans.name: Nueva Ilusion Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión inicia su quinto ciclo con 17 socias. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, ropa, artesanía, alfalfa, chatarra y comida. 
Como es el caso D. la Señora Rosa que es presidenta del Banco Comunal, Rosa es casada, tiene 49 años y 3 hijos, Rosa compra y venD. artesanías ayacuchanas en las ferias artesanales D. la ciudad D. Huancayo, y tiene proyectado participar en las ferias D. la ciudad D. Lima, Además Rosa realiza tejidos D. bufandas, gorros que también venD. en las ferias. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. lana D. diversos colores. Los sueños D. Rosa son ampliar su negocio, vender sus productos en el extranjero, aprender a realizar tejidos en telar y tener una polleria.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 750 soles haciendo un total D. 10,300 soles.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nueva Ilusion is starting its fifth loan cycle with 17 members. The members operate various businesses, in which they sell groceries, clothing, handicrafts, alfalfa, cheap goods, and food. Such is the case of Rosa, who is the president of the communal bank. She is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children. She buys and sells handicrafts at fairs in the city of Huancayo, and she also plans to participate in the fairs in Lima. Furthermore, Rosa knits scarves and hats that she also sells at the fairs. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of various colors of wool. Her dreams are to expand her business, sell her products abroad, learn to weave using a loom, and to have a poultry store. The members are requesting different sums of money, such as 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, and 750 soles, adding up to a total of 10,300 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various colors of wool

loans.name: Hanh's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people located in Moeung Prachen village in Takeo province. Mrs. Hanh V. is the leader of the group, selected by its members. Each member of the group will use the loan to support her own purposes.

Mrs. Hanh V. is 59 years old and a widow who lives with two adopted children. She is a pig breeder who earns a small income to support herself and her adopted children. She decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets to enlarge her business activities.

loans.use: To buy more piglets.

loans.name: Ek

texts.en:
Ek S., 45, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, known as the most populated city in the country. He is a police officer and earns an income of about 15 USD per day. His wife is a grocery seller at home, earning an income of 5 USD per day to help cover the family expenses.  

S. has requested a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for his wife to transport groceries from the market. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to make repairs to his house. This is his third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport groceries

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia A. is from the village of Lumbayao. She is 60 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Emilia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling coconuts in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month. In 1999, Emilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Emilia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to redeem her pawned coconut land. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To redeem her pawned coconut land

loans.name: Ivanna

texts.en:
Ivanna is married with a 3-year-old son and a 7-year-old daughter. She is a market vendor in Ivano-Frankivsk. Ivanna sells retail children's clothing items in the central city marketplace. Her vending kiosks are well-known among parents as they always boast the best assortment of merchandise for babies and toddlers at affordable prices. Ivanna launched this business 5 years ago on the advice of her mother-in-law. Presently, she has about 5,000 Grivnyas in income every month.  

Ivanna is requesting a 7,500 Grivnya loan to purchase 100 underpads, 100 baby crawler pants, 100 matinee coats and 50 pajamas. Ivanna seeks to see her business grow and develop. She has a hired employee which is one more reason for her to keep her enterprise sustainable and running efficiently. Ivanna likes the idea of providing one more family with stable income and tries to ensure competitive pay for her employee. Ivanna is hoping to invest her  income in the remodeling of her house which is in its final stages.

loans.use: to purchase additional children's clothing merchandise

loans.name: Nhy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhy T. is 45 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its thirteen members who are located in Pou Khvet village, Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use it to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Nhy T. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, she is also a fruit seller in the local market and is able to earn a small profit to support her family.

For her fruit-selling business, Mrs. Nhy T. will use the loan to buy more fruits to sell. With the rest of the loan she wants to buy fertilizer for her rice cultivation.

Mrs. Nhy T. is a widow with two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the other is a student who also supports its mother’s businesses.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell plus fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Ingris Mercedes

texts.es:
Ingris Mercedes M. es una joven de  23 años, que  vive en el barrio la Esperanza de Malambo con su  hijo de 5 años, que depende totalmente de ella, porque  quedó sin su cónyuge y le tocó asumir la responsabilidad de su hogar.

Desde que su esposo enfermó se dedicó al negocio de distribuir conservas de leche, plátano y guayaba, consiguió un crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual compró varias vitrinas pequeñas las ubicó en diversas tiendas y las surtió de su exquisitos dulces de leche, plátano y guayaba que ella misma reempaca y exhibe en estos puntos comerciales. Este es su segundo crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de 100 cajas de conservas, 100 potes de arequipe, 200 cajas de gelatina y empaques, para distribuirlas como siempre lo hace en diferentes tiendas del municipio de Malambo, donde los transporta en una moto de su propiedad y que la adquirió como resultado de sus utilidades ahorradas; así ha facilitado su trabajo y ahora tiene mayores ingresos,  pues   antes  debía sacar dinero  para alquilarla. 

Ingris Mercedes conoció de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por su cuñada que la recomendó a esta organización,  siendo una cliente asidua de de la Fundación. Desde hace más de 5 años empezó este negocio su cónyuge, hoy fallecido después de una penosa enfermedad; con él ha logrado sostener su hogar y como ha invertido su    créditos en el negocio, este ha crecido hasta permitirle aumentar sus ingresos por concepto de  ventas  y así mismo sus utilidades,  con las que logró comprarse la actual motocicleta, para seguir abriendo mercados mas distantes de su vivienda y adquirir un lote donde construir su casita.
 
Su mayor desafío es aumentar constantemente sus ventas pues cuando éstas se disminuyen, sobre todo en la época de lluvias,  por eso empezó enviando  también sus productos a Sabanagrande, Santo Tomás y algunos municipios del departamento de Bolívar y esto le ha permitido conseguir más de 800 clientes fijos, facilitándole su trabajo y generando así un nuevo empleo. Uno de los desafíos mas grande que afrontó hace 5 meses, fue la perdida de su cónyuge, situación que la obligo a asumir la jefatura de su hogar.
