Mrs. Sem E., age 30, has been selected to be group leader by the other members. She is married but has no children. Her husband is Sokhom, age 41, who works as a military policeman.

Mrs. E. currently sells groceries out of her home. As another income source, she provides small loans with specific terms to the villagers. Because the business of selling groceries is an important source of the family's income, E. is requesting a loan in order to increase the inventory.

The other two borrowers are: S., a widow who works as a garment worker. She is requesting a loan to buy fruit to sell. K., who sells cakes in her home and needs a loan to purchase ingredients and some groceries to sell.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her grocery  busines

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en:
By her own initiative, when Adolat was 23 she learned how to make traditional dresses using a sewing machine. This activity has made it possible for her to contribute to her family's income and satisfactorily meet the most urgent needs of her two small children. Every item of clothing Adolat produces is superior, and due to this her orders have markedly increased. She has some very large orders that would be impossible to fulfill if she didn't have an assistant. Her incredible energy, fortitude, and commitment to her clients drives her to offer them new and improved service. To this end, Adolat wants to speed up her dress production by purchasing more fabrics. To accomplish her objective, she is asking for a $500 USD loan to buy new modern fabrics and she promises to repay the loan in 12 months. With your help, you can make her dream come true. Adolat thanks you for your generous contribution.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics for sewing traditional dresses.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar es casado de 25 años de edad, trabajador de la Fundacion Jose Niebororswki, con 5 años de servicio como auxiliar de Auditoria Interna, su esposa trabaja en BANCENTRO, ella es acompañada por una prima que vive con ellos, como el trabajo de Julio es lo realiza a nivel de la region, solo se encuentra el dia domingo, ya que los sabados el estudia en Managua para enriquecer su curriculum y desarrollarse mejor como Contador Publico.  Esta solicitando su 1er credito para utilizarlo en la ampliacion del techo y embaldozado de 24 mts cuadrados, esto lo hara con la intencion de dar comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 25 year old and married. He has worked for the Fundación José Nieborowski for five years as an assistant for Internal Audits. His wife works for Bancentro (the Credit Bank of Central America). She is accompanied by a cousin who lives with them. As Julio's work is performed according to regional standards, you can only find him on Sunday now that he is studying on Saturdays in Managua in order to enrich his curriculum and develop himself as a Public Accountant. He is requesting his first loan which will be used to extend his roof by 24 square meters (260 square feet), and then tile it. His intention in doing this is to make things more comfortable for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To extend and put tile on the roof.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Don Julio Cesar es soltero, de 42 años de edad, con 4 hijos (2 en la universidad, 2 estudiando la primaria) con 5 años de servicio en la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como ayudante de maquinaria pesada, con horario de 7am. a 5 pm. de lunes a viernes, el fin de semana lo tiene libre, ademas del salario de la Alcaldia, cuenta con una pension del INSS, su compañera de vida trabaja y tiene un ingreso mensual con el que aporta a los gastos del hogar.  Esta solicitando su 1er credito para compra de zin, madera y cemento, cambiara el techo de su casa, ya que con el invierno su familia se esta mojando y quiere componer un poco el techo y sentirse mas seguro evitando el riesgo de enfermarse.  Manifiesta que no tiene credito en ninguna institucion financiera y se ha acercado a AFODENIC por recomendaciones de sus compaleros de labores, que consideran que los intereses y la atencion de sus funcionarios es excelente.
texts.en:
Don Julio Cesar is single, aged 42 with four children (two at university, two studying in primary school) and has spent five years working for the mayoralty of Juigalpa, working with heavy machinery from 7am to 5pm Monday to Friday. He has the weekends off, and in addition to the salary from the Alcaldia, he draws a social security pension and his partner works and has a monthly income which helps with the household expenses. He is asking for his first loan in order to buy zinc, wood and cement. He will change the roof of his house, as in the winter his family is getting wet and he wants to repair the roof a little and make it more secure in order to avoid the risk of them falling ill. He has demonstrated that he doesn't have a loan at any other financial institution and he approached AFODENIC because of his work colleagues' recommendations who consider that the interest and attention shown by its workers are excellent.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Vineta

texts.en: Vineta B., 53, is married with six children.  She has had two years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the village people and the public, five days per week. She has not had any previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~75 USD). SPBD loans are Vineta’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase wires, seeds, picky, spades, fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Consuelo es soltera, tiene 28 años y vive con sus padres, Consuelo tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres en donde vende abarrotes en general, algunos artículos de librería, servicio telefónico, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hermana.
Consuelo necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Consuelo son construir su casa en el terreno que compro y surtir con mas productos su negocio.
texts.en:
Consuelo is a member of the Manantial Community bank. She is 28, single, and she lives with her parents. Consuelo has a store in her parents’ house where she sells general groceries, some bookstore items, and telephone services. She does this with her sister’s help. Consuelo needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy rice and sugar. Consuelo’s dreams are to build a house on the land that she bought and to stock her store with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Bolale

texts.en:
Bolale is happily married with four children and she is 40 years old. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past twenty years.

Bolale is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Dulmira

texts.es: La señora Dulmira, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de Guadalupe II”, Distrito de Bagua Grande, Provincia Utcubamba, Departamento de Amazonas. Es separada, tiene 39 años tiene 01 hija mujer que esta en estudios superiores.Su espíritu alegre y su anhelo de ver profesional a su hija, le motivó a buscar alternativas de generar fuentes de ingresos y gracias a su cualidad de hacer amigos fácilmente le ayudaron a iniciarse en la venta de cosméticos a través de catálogos, le esta yendo muy bien poco a poco ha ido ganando clientes. En la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que le compran de manera constante por que encuentran de todo y sobretodo son atendidos con amabilidad que es lo que a ella le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00, comprará productos de belleza como colonias, esmaltes, bijuoteria  como aretes, collares y anillos, así como perfumes para varón que salen en ofertas, quiere tener surtido su negocio y dar una buena  atención a sus clientes para que ellos encuentren lo que necesiten. Dulmira, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.

loans.use: Comprará mas productos, para aumentar sus productos.

loans.name: La

texts.en:
Mrs. La B., age 30, and her husband, Mr. Soksan Mork, age 30, were married in 2003 and have a three-year-old son. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

The main source of income is from her husband’s work as a security guard. La used to be a garment factory worker, but she now stays at home to take care of her son. La’s husband hopes to supplement his existing business by driving a motor taxi. With this new business he will be able to generate additional income to support his family. La is applying for her first loan of $400 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband.

Shown in the photo is La in her house and is anticipating that her loan will be granted so she can purchase a motorcycle for her husband to start a motor taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to start a motor taxi business

loans.name: Vilginie

texts.en:
Vilginie U. is 27 years old and is married with three children aged between 9 and 4. She lives in Musanze District, Ruhengeli Province, where she has sold clothes in the market since 1997. Vilginie operates her business every day from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

Vilginie is requesting her second loan from Vision Finance Company in order to earn more profit; after earning more profit she will be able to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida U. is 29 years old, married with 3 children ages 6,8 and 12.  Farida lives in the Musanze district of Ruhengeli in a northern province of Rwanda.  Here, she owns a shop selling small fish (called “Indagara”) from Lake Kivu which is in the western part of Rwanda.  She has worked in this business since 1999 and she employs four people from her community. Her business is open from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening seven days per week.

Farida is requesting her seventh loan from Vision Finance Company so that she can continue to access credit in order to increase her business through buying more Indagara/fish.

loans.use: For purchasing more small fish

loans.name: Nafissatou

texts.fr: Nafissatou B. est une femme de 55 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE depuis 6 ans et demi et y a eu de belles performances. Avec son crédit elle développe une activité de vente de poisson frais. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge quotidienne de la famille.
texts.en:
Nafissatou B. is a 55-year old woman, she is married and she is the mother of 4 children who are all still in her care. She has been a member of the Yamatogne village bank for the past 6 and a half years and she has had successful experiences. With her loan she will invest in her business selling fresh fish. Her earnings allow her the ability to contribute to the daily needs of her family.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es: Mario Antonio A. C. de 41 años de edad, reside en Ilopango municipio del departamento de San Salvador junto a su numerosa  familia que la compone sus seis hijos todos menores de edad 13, 11, 9,7,5 y 2 años de edad la mas pequeñita de la familia, también vive con ellos su esposa doña Irma quien es ama de casa y se mantiene pendiente de los cuidos y necesidades que demandan sus hijos. Mario trabaja muy duro en su negocio, ya que se encuentra bajo su entera responsabilidad los gastos del hogar siendo el  único proveedor económico, en el negocio de Mario se repara o vende todo tipo de baterías para automóviles, pero en ahora el solicita de este crédito para compara mayor cantidad de baterías para comercializar y así logar aumentar sus ganancias y poder seguir fortaleciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Mario Antonio A. C. is 41 years old and lives in the town of Ilopango in the department of San Salvador. His large family consists of six children who range in age from 2 to 13. His wife Doña Irma is a housewife and in charge of looking after the needs of the children. Mario works very hard since he is responsible for the household expenses and the sole financial provider. At his business, he repairs and sells all types of automobile batteries. He is currently requesting a loan so that he can buy a large quantity of batteries to sell. This will enable him to increase his earnings and continue strengthening his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase automobile batteries

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita M. is a 41-year-old married woman who lives in Purok Paraiso, Baranggay 2, Taloc, Bago City, Negros Occidental. Her husband, Emmanuel, is a small sugar farmer. They have three young children who are between 4 and 9 years old. The older kids are presently attending elementary school. Merlita works hard to help her husband provide for their children’s future because she does not want them to go through the same hardships she had while she was growing: needing to have a paying job just to help her parents support their family. Her most cherished dream is for her children to finish their studies and get a stable job or have an established livelihood. Merlita met her husband in Manila many years ago when she worked as a factory worker just to help her parents support their family. When they got married, they decided to go home to Negros where Emmanuel had a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farmland that he could plant with sugarcane. Merlita had to adjust to living in a new place and she also realized that she needed to have her own source of income so that she could help her husband support their family. When Merlita gave birth to their oldest child, she decided to put up a general store adjacent to their house. She thought that this would serve two purposes: she could take care of her child and their household while selling basic goods to her neighbors and earn a supplemental income for their family. But in spite of her best efforts, she could not sustain the required inventory level that was needed and she sometimes did not have enough stock to sell. She almost decided to close down her store. It was serendipity that a friend introduced Merlita to NWTF-Project Dungganon, and when she became a member in 2002, she was able to access the much-needed capital to support the capital requirements of her store. She was even able to expand her product offerings. As her business grew, Merlita started selling rice to her neighbors, and also raised pigs in her backyard. Now she earns a minimum of PHP 10,000 per month from her business activities. She is currently saving money for the education of her children and also so that she can buy a motorcycle which they will use as another source of income. Merlita’s previous loan of PHP 22,500 was utilized as revolving working capital for her businesses. Having paid that in due course, Merlita is borrowing PHP 25,000 this time around so that she can continue sustaining the capital requirements of her businesses. She hopes that all her efforts will bear fruit in the fulfillment of all her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Bolivianita Group

texts.es: El grupo “La Bolivianita” esta representado por la señora Martha Carola y conformado por14 miembros los cuales una gran mayoría se dedica a la venta D. productos como comida rápida al paso dulces, abarrotes en tienda D. barrio, llantas, frutas, refrescos y al transporte publico D. pasajeros. Dentro del ámbito competitivo se pueD. mencionar que si bien esta presenta la demanda D. sus productos es mayor obteniendo ingresos acorD. a sus necesidades, Desean Ampliar sus negocios con la compra D. mercadería, insumos y materiales que ayuden a generar mejores ingresos para poder brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. A pesar D. ser su primer ciclo dentro D. la Institución ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidaR. gracias a créditos en otras instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital por lo que están contentos por el apoyo económico brindado.
texts.en:
The La Bolivianita group is represented by Martha Carola. It is comprised of 14 members. The majority of them sell products like fast food, sweets, groceries in neighborhood stores, tires, fruit, and soft drinks. Some work in public transportation of passengers. As far as competition goes, it does exist. The demand for their products is greater, and they get income according to their needs. They want to expand their businesses by purchasing merchandise, supplies, and materials that help them generate greater income in order to give their families a better quality of life. In spite of this being their first cycle with the Institution, they do have experience with communal bank thanks to loans from institutions similar to the Agrocapital Foundation. They are very happy with the economic support given by the Agrocapital Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La señora Delia es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” desde hace 3 años atrás, del distrito de Santa Rosa, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene 05 hijos. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de carne.  Paralelamente se dedica a la crianza de animales como cerdos.

Delia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital y comprar más carne.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar carne de alpaca, cordero, chancho, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su empresa de carne. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Sra. Delia became a member of the Generation 2000 Communal Bank three months ago. She lives in the District of Santa Rosa, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. Delia is 48 years old, married, and has five children. She has an elementary school education and makes a living buying and selling meat. At the same time, she raises animals such as pigs.

Delia tells us that that the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos was for 500 soles and used to increase her capital so that she could buy more meat. She will request a new loan of 2000 soles so that she can buy alpaca, lamb, pork, and other types of meats. Her dream for the future is to open a butcher shop. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank is the savings account.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase alpaca, lamb, pork, and other types of meats

loans.name: Artush

texts.en: Artush G., 37, lives in Tsovagyugh village, Sevan area with his wife and school age children.  He has a son and two daughters.  Artush has a private mini shop where he trades in miscellaneous goods. He is also engaged in cattle-breeding. Now Artush needs a loan to increase the assortment of goods he sells in his shop: coffee, tea, candy and household goods. His wife doesn’t work and helps her husband in his business and cattle-breeding.

loans.use: To buy coffee, tea, candy and household goods for his shop

loans.name: Costa

texts.en:
Costa is 43 years of age and married with seven children between the ages of 4 and 17. All her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a five-roomed house, where she stays with six people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses includes paying utility bills, school fees for her children and medication.

Costa owns a stall selling all types of snacks, ranging from samosas chapatti to pancakes. She works seven days a week. She receives an average of 30 customers a day. She has done this business for over 10 years. Her main challenges are transportation of baking flour and an inadequate market for eatables plus defaulters. She sells both on a retail and wholesale basis. She has been with MCDT for nine years, servicing her 20th loan and working all this long with the same group mates. 

She wants to use this loan to buy more cartons of baking flour, cooking oil and cowpeas for samosas, plus bunches of yellow bananas for pancakes. She is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and to own a bigger bakery.
.

loans.use: To buy cartons of baking flour, jerrycans of cooking oil, cowpeas for samosas and bunches of bananas for pancakes

loans.name: Sara Maria Santacruz

texts.en:
Sara is a 23-year-old, single woman. To earn a living, she works as a seamstress. She specializes in high-fashion clothing, such as shirts, blouses, and sportswear. Sara's sister, who a 32-year-old teacher, helped her open her workshop. The two sisters began working together 7 years ago, but Sara now works alone.

The workshop is equipped with two industrial sewing machines and hemming machines. Equipped with these machines, she makes various articles of clothing. Sara also fills wholesale orders for retail shops in the Villarrica area. She is now seeking a loan to purchase additional fabric because she has orders from the Don Bosco school and needs to supply her clients with their clothing.

loans.use: To meet customer demand by purchasing additional fabric

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann L. is from the village of Mamajaov, Camiguin Province. She is twenty-seven years old. Ann is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Ann owns and operates a specialized retail store in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp in the local community. Ann has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP each month for these activities. (This photo was taken of Ann with with their pump boat, which she uses for fishing.)

In 2009, Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. She used her previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Ann is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which she will use to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be Ann's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Gisèle

texts.fr: Née en 1971 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, B. Gisèle vit depuis 19 ans environs à Cadjèhoun, un quartier de Cotonou. Gisèle est mariée à AMINOU Charles un photographe, et est mère de cinq enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Gisèle vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Gisèle n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Gisèle vend divers produits de toilette à la devanture de sa maison. Gisèle s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Gisèle exerce cette activité depuis 8 ans et a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé. Gisèle rembourse bien ses crédits. Gisèle voudrait renforcer son capital en vue d'agrandir et de diversifier son activité. Mais compte tenu du peu de ressources financières dont elle dispose, Gisèle sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un quatrième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Cotonou, the financial capital of Benin, Gisèle B. has lived in Cadjèhoun, a neighborhood of Cotonou, for the past 19 years. Gisèle is married to Charles Aminou, a photographer. She is the mother of five children, all of whom attend school. Gisèle lives with her children and her husband. The couple takes care of the family's needs together. Gisèle did not attend school. In order to take care of the family's needs, Gisèle sells a variety of toiletries from her home. Gisèle supplies herself in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Gisèle has had this business for the past 8 years and she has received three loans from ALIDé. She has fully repaid all of her loans. Gisèle would like to strengthen her financial capital in order to grow and diversify her business. Due to the small financial resources at her disposal, Gisèle is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase toiletries for resale

loans.name: Buke

texts.en:
Buke is 32 years old, married to Galmo Ali, and they have two school-going children.  He has operated his retail shop in Olkalou for the last five years selling things like bedding (mattresses), clay pottery ovens, blankets, buckets and others.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to add more retail stock to sell, such as more mattresses, basins and buckets for household use which are in demand.

He plans to upgrade his retail shop to a mini-supermarket in the near future and also ensure sustainability of his family with basic needed items.

loans.use: To buy mattresses, basins and buckets to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a hard working and friendly man. He loves his business because of the opportunity to interact with his customers. He sells medicines at retail prices to his customers. He is 43 years old, married with children.  He is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more medicines to sell.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn V. is from the village of Brgy. Lantap, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 36 years old. Roselyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Roselyn owns and operates a business raising poultry and selling poultry eggs. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chicken layers to produce and sells eggs. Roselyn has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Roselyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roselyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding poultry. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Roselyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase breeding poultry

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita C. is thankful for the support that she got from Kiva lenders for her variety store venture in her previous loan. She prays they all be blessed. Now she is proposing another Kiva loan of 20,000 Php to continue to support the maintenance of her variety store. She has been able to improve her business due to her access to bigger loans from Kiva lenders. She is also happy because she is well able to supply and support the needs of her family. Teresita’s business has been very helpful in achieving her family dreams. Her greatest aspiration is that her children will be able to have a decent life. Her long-term goals are to help support her grandchildren's education, invest in and build a better house for the family, and to have a full-fledged mini-grocery store. Teresita now feels very happy with the service of ASHI and Kiva. It gives her family a big option to pursue their dreams. She hopes that ASHI and Kiva continue to provide the service for a long time and help many families who want to get ahead and move away from the twist of poverty.

loans.use: To continue to support the maintenance of her store

loans.name: Las Nubecitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama las Nubecitas y se forma de tres mujeres, Urema, Bellarmina y Teresa.
Doña Teresa, vive en la ribera “Julian Grajales” municipio de Copainala, Chiapas. La comunidad es conocida como “San Antonio”. Ella está casada con el señor Oscar desde hace 14 años, con quien  procreo un hijo que cursa el segundo grado de primaria. Ella está feliz y contenta por tener una buena familia.
La razón por la cual solicita el préstamo es para poner su tienda de abarrotes y  comprar mercancía como son: frijol, azúcar, aceite, huevo, harina, galletas, leche,  jabón entre otros. Así poder trabajar y apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa ya que trabaja fuera de la localidad como radio técnico.
Las otras dos integrantes más utilizan su préstamo en otra actividad como doña Bellarmina en la compra de marranos, y Urema también en su tienda de abarrotes.
Su mayor anhelo de la señora teresa es que su negocio crezca día a día en donde pueda trabajar y ser dependiente de la misma. Como también ver a su hijo crecer con buenos principios de educación y buen futuro.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Nubecitas" (The Little Clouds), and is made up of three women, Urema, Bellarmina and Teresa. Doña Teresa lives on the “Julian Grajales” shore in the municipality of Copainala, Chiapas. The community is known as “San Antonio”. Doña Teresa has been married to Sr. Oscar for 14 years; together they have one son, who is in 2nd grade. She is happy and pleased to have a good family. She is requesting the loan in order to open a grocery store and purchase merchandise, such as: beans, sugar, oil, eggs, flour, cookies, milk, soap and other items. In this way, she will be able to work and to help her husband with the household expenses. He works outside their neighborhood as a radio electronics technician. The other two members use their loans in other businesses. Doña Bellarmina uses hers to purchase pigs, and Urema also uses hers for a grocery store. Sra. Teresa's greatest wish is that her business grows each day and be a place where she can work as the clerk. She also wants to see her son grow with a good start to his education and a have good future.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise: sugar, beans, oils, eggs, milk, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mrs .Van K. has spent her entire life cultivating crops. It is a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young. She is now married and has three school-aged kids: one is married and the remaining two are single. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual operation with which she has had great success. She has been following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for growing, but, Van K. doesn’t have enough capital yet to use on her farm. So, Van K. is asking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For planting 3.5 acres of corn and buying two calves

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn D. has been able to sustain her fishing business through the previous loan she received from ASHI. She has repaid the whole amount of the loan she received, and the small profit she earned has been added to her husband’s income from being a fisherman. With that, she has been able to pay for the education of her only son as well as for their other basic needs, allowing them to enjoy life in a simple way.

Ginalyn would like to request a larger loan for the sustainability and growth of her previous business as well as for her new venture -- buying and selling fish. 

Ginalyn is determined to improve her business as well as the life of her family. Knowing that she can access financial support through loans has given her courage and faith that someday, her child will graduate from college and be ready to face his own life.

Ginalyn’s business has been very helpful in achieving her family's dreams. Her greatest hope is that her family will be able to have a decent way of life. Her long-term goals are to invest and build a better house for the family and to have full-fledged fish farm someday.

loans.use: For sustainability and growth of her fishing business and support her secondary business of buying and selling of fish

loans.name: Kymbat's Group

texts.en:
Kymbat M. is the leader of the group. He is 59 and married. He has raised four sons and three daughters. Most of the children are married and live separately with their families, except the youngest daughter, who studies at university. Kymbat and his wife are farmers. They have been breeding livestock since 1990 and with money received from the loan Kymbat wants to purchase a sheep to increase the number of livestock.
 
Anara A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 36 and married. She has two newborn babies. Ten years ago, Anara and her husband started to breed livestock. Selling some animals after fattening makes them enough money to cover their expenditures. Her husband also works as a taxi driver. Anara hopes to obtain the loan, because she needs money to purchase a sheep to increase the number of livestock.

Iskender A., 31, is married. He has a daughter and a son, the daughter is at school and the son is not yet. Iskender and his wife are farmers, and they have been breeding livestock for five years. Selling some farm animals after fattening provides them with 5000 soms per month. That money has made it possible for them to save some money and purchase a vehicle. Iskender hopes to obtain the loan because he needs money to purchase one farm animal to increase the number of livestock, and some portion he will use to cover family expenses.

Nurzat S. is 29 and married. She has two sons, both of them are preschool age (under 7). In order to make money, Nurzat and her husband after their marriage, started to breed livestock. Her husband also works as a taxi driver. With money received from the loan Nurzat wants to purchase a sheep to increase the number of livestock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a sheep.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 58 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo Aedo de 59 años, pues sus 3 hijos ya no viven con ellos porque tienen sus propias familias. sta trabajadora mujer, ha pesar de sacar adelante a sus hijos, ya mayores, lo hace hasta ahora con mucho trabajo, pues junto a su esposo luchan para salir adelante; es por eso que hace algunos años decidieron comprar un auto, en el que su esposo ofrece el servicio de taxi, negocio que le esta yendo muy bien. De esta manera, él conduce el auto durante el día,  mientras que Juana administra las ganancias que recibe. Ahora están ahorrando ya que desean comprarse un auto más para poder alquilarlo. Esta emprendedora mujer tiene muchos planes por concretar y espera lograrlos con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas pues desea seguir trabajando, además esta muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su grupo pues esta compuesto por personas responsables y solidarias. Juana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de 4 llantas nuevas para cambiar las que tiene en su auto, para que así pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio de taxi.
texts.en:
Juana is 58 years old, and she lives with her husband Aedo, aged 59, in a house that belongs to them. Her 3 children do not live with them, as they all have families of their own. On top of having provided and keep providing for her grown-up children with great dedication, this hard-working woman strives together with her husband to make ends meet; this is why a few years ago they decided to buy a car her husband works with as a taxi driver, and the activity is going very well. This is how they work: Aedo drives the car every day, while Juana administrates the incomes. They are now saving in order to buy another car that they will then rent out. There are many plans that this resourceful woman wants to accomplish, and she hopes to realize them thanks to her great effort and dedication. This is the second loan she is asking to MFP, and she is really satisfied with the work done by her group, being it composed of caring and responsible people. To improve her taxi and offer a better service, Juana plans to invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of 4 new tires to replace the old ones on her car.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 tires to replace the old ones on her car.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy D. is a 43-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: fish vending, direct selling of personal products and selling ready-to-wear clothes. She lives in Brgy. Tuyom, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her three businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 8,400 Philippine pesos (PHP). Daisy is now borrowing 10,000 PHP so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 8,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Daisy aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") way. The accompanying photo of Daisy was taken after she attended the weekly NWTF-Project Dungganon Center Meeting that all group-based clients must attend. The meetings give each borrower the chance to share ideas with their group, learn new business skills and pay back their weekly installments. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Maharamhon's Group

texts.en:
Maharamhon A. is the leader of the group. She is 40, and married. She has 4 children: the son earns money by working as a butcher, the daughter studies tailoring, the other 2 are students. The head of the family makes his income by cattle breeding. Currently he is fattening 4 cows. For the past 20 years he has been selling meat. Out of the business profits the family was able to make house repairs. This loan purpose is to purchase golden accessories for their daughter, due to her wedding. In the future Maharamhon is planning to arrange her daughter’s wedding and to purchase more cattle for fattening. 

Mubarak A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 36, and married. She has to bring up 3 children alone because of husband is currently working in Russia. The family gets profits from cattle breeding. Currently they have 2 cows. Out of their earnings it was possible to build a five-room house. In order to obtain a calf, Mubarak wants to get a loan. In future she is planning to give her children a university education and to increase cattle stock.

Dilfuzahon M., 36, is married. Together with her husband, a farmer, she has 3 children. The eldest daughter helps her parents, and younger two are students. The family has their own business of cultivating (on the area of 0,25 hectares) and selling onions. Out of profits they have managed to obtain furniture. The loan purpose is to purchase a washing-machine. In the future Dilfuzahon is aiming to arrange her daughter’s wedding, to give her children a university education and to buy a car. 

Karimberdi K., 42, is married. He and his wife, a farmer, are raising three children, two of them are students. The family is engaged in cattle breeding. They are currently fattening a cow and a calf. Out of their earnings they have managed to purchase a TV-set. The loan purpose is to obtain sheep for further fattening and breeding. In the future Karimberdi hopes to increase his cattle stock and then to purchase a car.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase golden accessories for the daughter due to her wedding.

loans.name: Suzi

texts.en: Suzi D. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to stock more brewing materials.  Suzi is 24 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has 3 children and only one goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

loans.use: Stock more brewing materials

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.es: Anatolia, de 41 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Benjamín de 46 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Las chacras de Anatolia son las mejores cuidadas de su poblado, todas las mañanas, trabaja desde muy temprano en sus tierras, ya que sabe que de esta actividad dependen los ingresos de su familia, ella siembra cacao, café y hojas de coca, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para pasear por los verdes campos de su poblado, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus tierras de las plaga de insectos que perjudican sus plantaciones. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el décimo tercer crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de café y cacao, también invertirá en abono y fertilizantes naturales para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Anatolia, 41, is a very unassuming, hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Benjamín, 46, and their three beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better future.

Anatolia’s fields are the best cared for in her town.  Every morning she works them from very early in the morning because she knows that her family’s income depends on this activity.  She plants cocoa beans, coffee and coca leaves which she then takes to the city of San Francisco to sell.

What she enjoys most about the work is the freedom it gives her to work in her town’s the green fields.  She has been in this line of work for 15 years and considers the most difficult part of it to be keeping her crops safe from insect infestations that damage them.  In time, she’d like to buy more land to increase production.

This is her 13th loan with MFP and she expects to be very punctual with her repayments because she does not want to create problems for her communal bank in which she is very happy.

She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy coffee and cocoa bean seeds as well as manure and natural fertilizers for her crops.

loans.use: To buy coffee and cocoa bean seeds and sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.en:
The rice farming business of Maria Rosa is improving with the financial help offered by microfinance institutions. She was able to finance her business with a small interest charge.

Now she has requested a loan of 4,000 Php to continually support her rice field. She is glad that her daily needs are met by the income she receives.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Glorius

texts.en:
Glorius M. is a 30-year-old married lady with two children. She operates a food kiosk which has been in existence for the past two years now. The business is situated at Shella in Malindi town. Glorius was introduced to KADET Ltd by another client who is already registered with KADET and this is her third loan from KADET. The loan amounts to Kshs. 80,000 and M. is planning to use it to add stock for her kiosk as well as repair the business structure. 

Glorius wishes to use the anticipated profit from the business to plough back into the business to grow it,  so as to be able to start up a greengrocer business. Also her deeper desire is to see her family healthy and give the best education to her children.

loans.use: buy foodstuffs like rice and wheat flour and repair the business premises

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline L. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 55 years old. Evangeline is widowed and has five grown children. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and snack foods. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and snack foods. This loan will be the first loan Evangeline has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like snack foods and canned goods.

loans.name: Yefferson Stalin

texts.es:
Yefferson de 33 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

El heredo una vulcanizadora (un taller pequeño que le dejo su papa para arreglar autos) ya que desde pequeño le enseño esta actividad para que se defienda en la vida. En la actualidad tiene 11 años con su vulcanizadora y ha trabajado durante estos años hasta ahora desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm. El cobra el cambio de llantas $ 5.00, el parche a $ 3.00, cambio de aceite a $ 20.00 etc. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para el futuro por eso quiere el préstamo para seguir trabajando y comprar llantas, tobos entre otros. En el futuro quiere tener un negocio grande en mantenimientos de vehículos.
texts.en: Yefferson, age 33, lives in a canton called Playas, one of Ecuador's tourist locations which has diverse marine life. Yefferson inherited a tire repair shop (a small workshop for repairing cars that his father left him), as he learned this work from a very young age to make his living. He has worked in his repair shop for eleven years, and has always worked from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm. He charges $5.00 for tire changes, $3.00 for a patch, $20.00 for an oil change, etc. He has many hopes for the future, and so he wants this loan in order to keep working and buy tires and tubes, among other items. In the future he wants to have a large vehicle maintenance business.

loans.use: tires, tubes

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es:
La señora Roberta S. R. tiene la edad de 34 años, ella solo inicio a estudiar la preparatoria perro no la termino por fata de recursos económicos, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de los cuales tres son mujer de nombres Alma Karina de 17 años de edad que estudia la preparatoria , Daniela de 11 años de edad y Maria de Jesus de 7 años que asisten a la primaria y un hombre de nombre Casiano de 13 años que asiste a la secundaria de su comunidad, ellos viven en la Colonia Jalapilla en la comunidad de Acatlan de Perez Figueroa en el estado de Oaxaca.

Doña Roberta nos platica que ella trabaja en una casa de cocinera y por las tardes y en sus tiempos libres elabora manualidades las cuales vende con sus amigas y vecinos, ella decidió iniciar a trabajar porque es madre soltera y tenia que buscar la manera de salir adelante con sus hijos, pero como lo que gana es muy poco inicio a vender manualidades para tener mas recursos económicos. ella nos platica que elabora tapetes para baño, servilletas bordadas, arreglos para fiestas y también hace pinturas en manta y cristal con las cuales elabora recuerdos, porta retratos y bolsas para dama, ella necesita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pinturas, manta, telas, listones, hilos, brochas, agujas y encajes para elaborar sus manualidades. Ella espera que este préstamo le de la oportunidad de que su negocio cresca. Doña Roberta desea que sus productos sean conocidos por mas personas para tener mas venta y que sus ganancias aumenten. Ella se encuentra agradecida con la Fundación por la confianza que le esta otorgando al brindarle este crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Roberta Sánchez R. is 34 years old.  She started high school but did not finish due to lack of economic resources.  She is a single mother of four children: three girls, Alma Karina, 17 who is in high school, Daniela, 11 and María de Jesús, 7, who are in elementary school, and one boy, Casiano, 13, who is in the local middle school.  They live in the Jalapilla neighborhood in Acatlan de Pérez Figueroa in the state of Oaxaca.

Roberta tells us that she works as a cook in a private home and during the afternoons and in her free time she makes crafts that she sells among her friends and neighbors.  She decided to start working because she’s a single mother and had to find the way to support her children.  Because her salary is low she started selling crafts to earn extra income.  She relates that she makes bath mats, embroidered napkins, and party decorations.  She also paints pictures on cloth and makes crystal keepsakes, picture frames and women’s purses.

She needs this financing to invest in paints, cloths, fabric, ribbon, thread, brushes, needles and lace to make the crafts.  She hopes the loan will provide her with the opportunity for her business to grow.
‘
Roberta hopes that her products will be known by more people in order to have higher sales and that her profits increase.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the trust placed in her by granting this loan.

loans.use: For arts and crafts sales.

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of 17 members who are located in Srei Snam village in Kandal province.  Mrs. Phan A. is 46 years old, married, and has six children, three of whom attend school.  She was selected to be the president of the village bank by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Sorn Sae, earn a living with their rice mill machine. Since this business is doing well, Mrs. Phan A. is requesting a loan to purchase more rice to mill in order to expand her business. In addition to this business, she also breeds pigs. With both of these businesses, they are able to  to support their family.

loans.use: To purchase more rice to mill

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn E. is from the village of Guinabot Sapang Dalaga, Misamis, Occidental. She is 35 years old. Marilyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. Marilyn owns & operates a store selling daily use products, such as canned goods, noodles, shampoo, soap & toothpaste, in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Marilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ronald Ryan

texts.en:
Ronald Ryan D. is from the village of Polo. He is 29 years old. Ronald Ryan is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ronald Ryan owns & operates a food stall where he sells soft drinks and other food products in the local community. Ronald Ryan has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Ronald Ryan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronald Ryan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ronald Ryan is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Ronald Ryan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business and to pay for the education of his children.

loans.use: purchase additional inventory for his food stall

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a married woman who lives in Victorias, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a fishing/fish vending business. Her husband Francisco, who is 57 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living. They have four children who are between 12 and 26 years old. Cecilia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cecilia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000 to purchase a fishing boat so that she can continue to save up for the future, to improve business and for her children's education. Cecilia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 54 años, es separada D. su esposo y vive con el menor D. sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 8 años venD. productos alimenticios en su tienda, negocio que atienD. desD. la mañana hasta el medio día, asimismo tiene un kiosco D. venta D. golosinas en el interior D. un colegio, que se encuentra cerca D. su casa, en ese mismo lugar aprovecha para expender comida a los docente y alumnos D. dicho centro educativo. D. esta manera su economía se ha estabilizado. Por otra parte su hijo la ayuda en el negocio, ya que además cuenta con una persona que contrata pero a veces no se da abasto. Considera que su negocio es estable porque tiene clientela fija y sus ventas son aseguradas por lo que tiene muchos deseos D. seguir creciendo. Es su crédito número 10 que esta solicitando con MFP, se siente muy feliz D. ser parte D. su banco comunal que en su localidad es un ejemplo D. solidaridad y D. la que aprendió bastante para su vida, y en esta oportunidad seguirá comprometiéndose en ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería en dulces y abarrotes para ambos negocios que tiene.
texts.en: Julia is 54, separated, and lives with the youngest of her three children in her own home. Eight years ago she stared selling food products in her own store, from morning until noon. She also runs a small snack shop within a school complex that is close to her home, and sells to the students and staff of the school. This is how she maintains a stable income. Her son helps with the business and sometimes she has one other person part time. Julia feels that her business is growing and her clientele is stable. This is her tenth credit with her community lender, which has maD. such a difference in the community. She is committed to prompt repayment of the loan, which she will use to buy inventory to supply food and snack items for her businesses.

loans.use: To buy basic ingredients for food preparation and snacks for resale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane P. is 30 years old. She is married to a farmer. They have three children, one of whom goes to school. 

Jane currently runs a business selling food at market. Her goal is to take good care of her children's future.

loans.use: stock more food to sell at market.

loans.name: Lazeri

texts.en: Lazeri, 37, is a married woman with seven children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She and the husband equally contribute to their family's welfare and their dream is to have self-sustaining children. She has been dealing in clothes for fifteen years. Having started with 800,000 shillings of capital, she now has three million. Despite the hardship of limited capital, her dream is to own a boutique. Lazeri will use the loan facility to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Maxima nació en la ciudad de Calca departamento Cusco, Perú. Ella tiene 42 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive con su esposa y en su propia casa junto con sus tres hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.  

Los verdes campos de la comunidad de Arin, ubicado en la Valle Sagrado de los Incas donde actualmente vive, han sido en la vida de Maxima un lugar muy agradable para trabajar. Desde muy niña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la agricultura y también le enseñaron a elaborar chicha de jora. Ella tiene una pequeña picantería en su domicilio donde sirve la rica chicha de jora. 

Maxima solicita el préstamo para realizar unos de sus planes, que es incrementar producción. Ella tiene la obligación de pagar sus aportes puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo si desea acceder a otro crédito. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con los 800 nuevos soles, comprará maíz para hacer chicha.
texts.en:
Maxima was born in the city of Calca, in Cusco department.  She is 42 years old and a cheerful and hard-working woman.  She lives with her husband and three children in her own home.  Her children are the motivation behind all her efforts.

The green fields of Arin community (which is located in the Sacred Valley of the Incas and is where Maxima currently lives) have been a very pleasant place for Maxima to work over the years.  Her parents taught her to farm when she was very young and also taught her to make 'chicha de jora' (a corn-based drink).  She has a small restaurant in her home where she serves her delicious 'chicha de jora'.

Maxima is requesting a loan to carry out one of her plans: to increase her production.  She must make her repayments on time and she is prepared to do this as she would like to access future loans.  She is grateful to the institution for granting her this loan.  She will use the 800 Peruvian soles to buy corn to make chicha.

loans.use: to buy corn to make chicha

loans.name: Eutropia

texts.en:
Eutropia is 61 years old and married with 11 children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for 3 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Eutropia is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more livestock and fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream- to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more livestock, and fertilizers for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Mededjigbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MEDEDJIGBE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Laetitia  est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Laetitia  est née le 03 Novembre 1973 dans une ville du Sud du Bénin. Laetitia  est mariée à un imprimeur du nom de Victorin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un reste à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble et le couple se partage les diverses charges de la maison. Laetitia  a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Afin de s’impliquer activement dans les charges du ménage, Laetitia achète des sous-vêtements qu’elle revend dans une ville du Bénin. Laetitia  exerce cette activité depuis quatre ans. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Laetitia  sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MEDEDJIGBE, un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
The MEDEDJIGBE group is composed of three persons who reside in the same neighborhood in Bénin. This is the third time that this group is requesting financial aid from ALIDé, so as to raise the level of their activities. The representative of the group, Laetitia, is the one raising her hand in the photo. 

Laetitia  was born on November 3, 1973 in a town in the south of Bénin. She is married to a printer, Victorin. The couple have three children, all enrolled in school; only one is still under their roof. The family live together and the couple share in supporting the household. 

Laetitia left school at the secondary level. In order to play an active role in supporting the household, she  buys underwear which she resells in a town in Bénin. Laetitia has been in this business for four years. Wishing to satisfy her clientele and grow her turnover and thus her income, Laetitia  is requesting, together with the other members of her group MEDEDJIGBE, a third loan.

loans.use: to buy underwear for resale.

loans.name: Eusebio Antonino

texts.es: El señor Eusebio tiene 60 años de edad es casado tiene hijos los cuales son mayores de e independientes, eusebio se dedica a, manejar su moto taxi, la cual es propia anteriormente eusebio trabajaba como obrero de campo, con el tiempo logro ahorrar y compro la moto taxi que ahora es su herramienta de trabajo, la esposa de eusebio se dedica a la preparación de postres que vende en las afueras de su casa, y con ello ayuda a su esposo en los ingresos familiares,eusebio esta solicitando el crédito para darle mantenimiento a su moto taxi, cambio de aceite algunas reparaciones al motor entre otros , eusebio tiene muchos sueños uno de ellos es comprar otra moto taxi para darla en alquiler y así le genere mas ingresos por mejorar su calidad de vida, eusebio esta muy agradecido con la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Sr. Eusebio is 60 years old, married, and has grown children who are independent. He drives a motorcycle taxi that he owns. Eusebio previously worked as a field laborer. Over time, he was able to save enough money to buy his motorcycle taxi which he uses for work. His wife prepares desserts and sells them outside of their home in order to generate income for the family.

Eusebio is requesting a loan to maintain his motorcycle taxi, change the oil, make a few engine repairs, and perform other needed services. He has many dreams. One of them is to buy another motorcycle taxi that he can rent out in order to generate more income. This will allow him to improve his quality of life. Eusebio is extremely grateful for the trust that has been demonstrated to him.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance, an oil change, engine repairs, and other services for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is a talented lady. She stitches hand bags for a home business. She collects order from different stores in the market and fulfills them on time to earn an income. She also sells bed sheets in her community. 

Her husband lives abroad and works there. Zahida has given birth to five children. Three of them work, while the others are students at a local school. 

Zahida has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for the further expansion of her bed sheet business. With the loan, she will buy bed sheets in larger numbers to sell. She has been operating this business for the past 20 years and is confident that after the loan investment her business will be further improved and her income will increase. She is very hopeful that she will be able to repay the loan easily after successfully improving her business. 

In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Zahida.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim is 41 years old, married, and has a three-month-old child. For the past six years he has run a spare parts shop in the Mombasa region from which he sells parts for motorcycles. He also has a boda boda (motorcycle taxi) business and sells charcoal. He describes himself as caring, understanding and down to earth.

This will be Kassim’s fourth loan with SMEP. He is a good client who repays his loans well. He intends to use this loan to expand his business by buying more spare parts to sell.

Kassim plans to use the anticipated profits to restock his shop and take care of his family’s expenses. In the future, Kassim hopes to be an importer of spare parts for motorcycles and cars.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has practiced farming for the last four years. He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers. This will be John's third loan. He plans to use it to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mobile phone cases, chargers, and protective gear.

loans.name: María

texts.es: Este cliente es trabajador activo de la alcaldía municipal desempeñándose como secretaria, es soltera, viven en casa de sus padres, el dinero lo solicita para la compra de materiales de construcción como arena, piedra y cemento para hacer un cuarto, es el segundo crédito que se ha financiado se siente muy bien ya que le ha ayudado de mucho estos crédito.
texts.en:
This client is an active municipal employee who currently works as a secretary. She is single and lives at the home of her parents. The money she is requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as sand, stone, and cement for building a room.

This is the second time her loan will be funded. She feels that the loans have been a great help.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building a room.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 63 years old, married, and has eight children.  To earn a living, he practices dairy farming.  He has been in the business for twenty years.    He also does horticultural farming to supplement his income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to improve his business with his previous loans.

George hopes to become a large-scale farmer in the future.  He has requested 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a 32-year-old young woman who is married, has five sons and one daughter, and whose husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with decent salary. 

Eman has a grocery store and wants to purchase more groceries to have a better collection for sale and increase her income. She doesn't have enough cash to pay for this, so she needs to take out a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Eman gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase more groceries and have a better collection for sale. In this way she will increase her income and provide a better standard of living to her family. 

Eman is a conservative woman, so her husband Ahmad is photographed in her place.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a 32-year-old married mother of one child. She runs a cosmetics shop in Mombasa and she has been in this business for the last five years. Thus far, she has seen a lot of gains and is happy with the progress. 

Annah was recently introduced to KADET and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase a variety of body lotions, hair food, beauty creams and hair extensions, thus offering a wide variety of products for her customers to choose. The anticipated profits will be plowed back into her business and used for the repayment of the loan. Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of body lotions, hair food, beauty creams and hair extensions

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Lucila tiene 51 años de edad y vive en Gracias, Lempira, uno de los departamentos más pobre de Honduras. Tiene cuatro hijos de 20, 21, 29 y 35 años de edad. Actualmente vive con los dos menores. Lucila es madre soltera y muy trabajadora. Siempre ha tratado de sacar a su familia adelante. 

Hace dos años y medio,  Lucila comenzó su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz. Viendo que no había tortillería en la comunidad, ella aprovechó para abrir una. Solicitó un préstamo  de L 5,000 con ODEF para empezar la tortillería. La señora manejó bien los pagos  de su primer préstamo y luego solicitó dos prestamos siguientes. Ahora está solicitando su cuarto préstamo con ODEF para la compra de maíz, el ingrediente principal en la elaboración de las tortillas. 

Lucila trabaja duro 12 horas al día haciendo tortillas para satisfacer la demanda de su clientela. Ella espera que su negocio siga creciendo para poder invertir las ganancias en la educación de sus hijos menores.
texts.en:
Lucila, age 51, lives in Gracias, Lempira.  It is one of the poorest departments in Honduras.  She has four children, ages 20, 21, 29, and 35.  She now lives with the two youngest.  Lucila is a single mother and a very hard-worker.  She has always tried to get her family ahead.

Two and a half years ago Lucila started her business of making and selling corn tortillas.  Seeing that there was no tortilla business in the community, she took advantage of that fact to start one.  She requested a loan for 5,000 lempiras from ODEF in order to start her tortilla business.

She managed her payments for her first loan well.  Then she requested two more loans.  Now she is requesting her fourth loan with ODEF to buy corn.  It is the main ingredient she uses to make the tortillas.

Lucila works hard for 12 hours a day making tortillas to satisfy her customers’ demand.  She hopes that her business continues growing in order to be able to invest her earnings in her minor children’s education.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Ousama

texts.en:
Ousama is a 39-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children. He’s the main source of income for his family and has been working as a taxi driver for the past 20 years. Ousama is a hard worker and always seeks a better life. 

Ousama is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy a new car. This will help him carry on his work properly and avoid mechanical problems. He is very optimistic and ambitious to achieve the best in his life.

loans.use: to buy a new car

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina forma parte del Banco comunal “Fuerza de Mujer” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 5 años, comenzó vendiendo lencería, en la actualidad se dedica a vender ropa nueva para adultos y niños además de accesorios.
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago en el barrio Meiggs y patronato al por mayor.
Comenta que mantiene clientela fija y también nueva que se va sumando.
Con el crédito comprará ropa para abastecer su negocio.
Sus metas en el negocio son tener un local establecido para ofrecer y vender su ropa. 
Cristina vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos de 11, 4 y 2 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son prosperar en su negocio, que le pueda brindar utilidades para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, junto con esto un buen nivel educacional. 
Otro de sus sueños es obtener su casa propia para esto se encuentra ahorrando para postular al subsidio habitacional.
Cristina está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio, además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, ya que son muy unidos y responsables.  
En cuanto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones del Banco comunal, estas le han permitido distribuir de mejor manera sus ganancias.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
