Jopeth Jay has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jopeth Jay is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) which will be used to purchase farm supplies, four piglets, and to repair his pig pen. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase four piglets and repair his pig pen

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 42 years old, married with four children who are between 9 and 21 years old.  Bernard is commonly known in the business of selling foodstuffs mainly beans and some other goods.  Bernard has been in this business for about six years.  The business hours are from 7 am to 10 pm every day.

Although Bernard has been in this business for about 6 years, his capital is still too low to expand meaningfully.  To end this, he needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, he will expand his business through purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs such as rice, peas, wheat, etc.  With these additional foodstuffs for sale, he will hopefully earn more profits than previously and these profits will allow him to keep reinvesting for a better financial stability.

loans.use: a large quantity of foodstuffs

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: Fortunata, de 41 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Edgar de 40 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que Fortunata se dedica, es el cultivo de cacao, café y hoja de coca. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en sus cultivos, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga de la venta de su cosecha en la ciudad de San Francisco, dependerá mucho de la calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras. En adelante, espera sembrar todas sus tierras, pata obtener mejores ingresos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará insumos para proteger sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos.
texts.en: Fortunata is 41 years old.  She is a very humble and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her 40 year-old husband Edgar and her 3 beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.  Fortuna works growing cacao, coffee and coca leaf.  Every day she gets up very early in the morning and tends to her crops since she knows that the money she gets from the sale of her harvest in the city of San Francisco will depend to a large extent on the quality of her produce.  What she likes most about her work is harvesting her land since this makes her feel that the months of work have borne fruit.  She has been in this business for 16 years and she considers that the most difficult thing about her work is spraying her land.  In the future, she hopes to sow all her land to obtain better profits.  This is her third loan from MFP.  She tells us that this support will help her a lot in making progress in her work.  She will use the 3,000 nuevos soles requested to buy supplies to protect her crops from insect infestations.

loans.use: To buy supplies to protect her crops from insect infestations

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 40-year-old, married man living in his own house with 9 children in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to have a minimum income and savings for the family on a daily basis. For three years he has been selling clothes. The business has helped him pay rent and school fees for his children. He wishes to own a boutique in future. Joseph intends to use his loan to buy clothes to sell as the festive season nears.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 30 years old and married with 7 children. Five of her children are currently attending school.

Florence is a farmer from Kisii town, in western Kenya, where she has been farming for eight years. Her farm produces maize, milk, tea, coffee and sugarcane, which she sells locally. She depends mainly on the income from her farm to meet her family’s needs. 

She has requested this loan of 40,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve her family’s living conditions and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she aspires to increase her number of dairy cows from the current 2 to 5, and to start a posho mill business. However, she faces the challenge of lack of financing to buy farm implements like fertilizers, which affects her production.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: El Cubulero Group

texts.es:
las integrantes del grupo el cubulero son mujeres muy trabajadoras y se conocen muy bien, son vecinas desde hace muchos años. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:
 
la señora Evelyn Elizeth J. B. se dedica a la venta de golosinas, tiene muchos clientes, en su negocio fabrica golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas, tortillas con quesillo, catrachas, burras, baleadas, carne con chismol.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las golosinas.
sus deseos es que en esta navidad reine la paz en todos los hogares del mundo.

   La señora Maria Rosalia B. G. se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva en los sectores foraneos de la aldea el cubulero.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa nueva, tiene muchos pedidos por ser la epoca de navidad.

  La señora Maria de Jesus A. se dedica a la venta de pescado blanco, pescado rojo y camaron.el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mariscos y materiales para la fabricacion de una ataraya para pezca.

todas ellas son mujeres con muchos deseos de salir adelante.
texts.en:
The members of the El Cubulero group are very hardworking women who know each other very well and have been neighbors for many years.  The different activities they engage in are described below.

Evelyn Elizeth J. B. sells snacks and has many customers.  She makes snacks such as tacos, enchiladas, tortillas with cheese, catrachas (fried tortillas with fried beans and cheese), burras, baleadas, and meat with chismol (Honduran salsa).

She will use the loan to buy supplies to make the snacks.  Her wish is that peace reign in all homes throughout the world this Christmas.

Maria Rosalia B. G. sells new clothing in the outskirts of the town of El Cubulero.  She will use the loan to buy new clothing.  She has many orders, since it's the Christmas season.

Maria de Jesus A. sells whitefish, redfish, and shrimp.  She will use the loan to purchase seafood and to buy materials to make a fishnet.

They are all women with a great desire to move forward.

loans.use: Purchase of beef, pork, and chicken, corn, oil, lard, soft drinks, fish, new clothing, materials for making fishnets

loans.name: Sop Serigne Mansour Sy Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité SOP SERIGNE MANSOUR SY a été formé le 14 mai 2010. C'est un groupe de 11 femmes. Elles sont toutes issues du même village. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de GABAR 

Madame ROKHAYA F. debout à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. 

Elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Elle fait aussi un petit commerce de semences d'arachides.

Avec son second crédit avec CAURIE-MF elle pourra mieux développer ses activés

Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne. Elle soutien aussi son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille
texts.en:
The Sop Serigne Mansour Sy solidarity group has been created on May 14, 2010. The group consist of 11 women from the same village. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Gabar.

Mrs. Rokhaya F., standing to the right in the photo, is the group leader. She raises sheep. She also retails peanut seeds. With her second Caurie-MF loan, she will be able to better grow her business. Her goal is to build up her savings. She also helps her husband provide for the family needs.

loans.use: Purchasing sheep

loans.name: Nab

texts.en: Nab S., 43, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia – an area known for Angkorean temples. S. sells Cambodian noodles, earning $10 US per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning $12 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $75 US on food and $15 US on other expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for the family. In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly S. was born in 1979; she is a married woman and blessed with three children. All three of the children are students in the local public school. Her husband's name is Ling Lin, 35, and he works as a building worker in the mobile place, Kompong Tom province. Ly S. has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Ly S. and her family, Ly S. has requested a loan in order to buy additional piglets to rise for sale.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets to rise for sale.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn D. is from the village of Dagohoy, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 43 years old. Jocelyn is separated from her spouse and has four adult children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from dealing in coffee & food supplement products from HERBALIFE in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like food supplements and multivitamins. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like food supplements and multivitamins

loans.name: Marasua Ole

texts.en:
Marasua ole K. is 67 years old and married to Nolari, who is a housewife. He is the father of 12 children.

Marasua is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last 20 years. His farm has been doing well due to a good management effort.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, with which he  plans to prepare his farm and buy farm inputs such as fertilizer. 

He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and to educate his children.

His hope is to buy a bigger piece of land and become a large-scale farmer. Marasua is an industrious man, and despite his age, he can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and prepare his farm

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
From the Kompong Tom province, Ouk T., 45 years old, is a single mother of four children. All of them are employed as domestic construction workers and provide their income to support the family. 

Ouk T. has spent most of her life in the farming business and she has a plot of farmland to cultivate a rice crop. 

Before, Ouk T. has always hired the neighbor’s cow in order to alleviate the chore of plowing the farmland. Right now, she hopes to buy her own cow and that is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva. This will provide her with an additional fixed asset.

loans.use: to buy a cow to help with plowing

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal”MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dionicia; la socia tiene 55 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de carpintería ella realiza las maderitas para los sellos y lo distribuye a las imprentas con las que trabaja ,a la vez exporta para las ciudades de Puerto Maldonado y Quillabamba, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le gusta mucho y de paso le trae muchas satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia sale en la foto con su nieta de su hija mayor.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de material para su negocio (madera).

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Dionicia is a member of the "María Elena Moyano" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Dionicia is 55 years old, lives with her partner, and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her carpentry business.  She makes the wooden parts for stamps which she distributes to the printing companies with which she does business.  She also exports her products to the cities of Puerto Maldonado and Quillabamba.  She has been in this business for years and enjoys her work a lot.  It brings her a lot of financial and personal satisfaction.  Dionicia appears in the photo with her granddaughter (her eldest daughter's child).

Dionicia is requesting this loan to buy material for her business (wood).  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy material for her business (wood)

loans.name: Dorita

texts.en:
Dorita is a 55-year-old married woman who lives in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with her family. She is married to a farmer. Dorita is also engaged in farming. She helps her husband grow and sell rice. Dorita also manages their sari-sari store where she sells items like cookies, chips and other kinds of products.

Dorita has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and additional store items to sell.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and additional store items to sell

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 47 years old and is married with nine children between the ages of 1 and 23 years. 

Evariste has a boutique where he sells rice,soap,sugar,body lotion,juice and so on. He has 10 years' experience. His business is well-organized and clear.

Evariste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more beans, soap, sugar, water, juice, bread, cooking oil and so on. With the profits, Evariste will pay school fees for his children and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like soap, body lotion, sugar, rice, water and  juice.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
urelia es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad, tiene un hijo a su cargo el cual también trabaja. Vive en casa propia. La cual está ubicada en una comunidad llamada Los Portales de la Pradera a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Aurelia  se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace mas de 10 años, tiempo en el cual se ha hecho conocida. Ella  cuenta con u pequeño taller el cual ha instalado en su domicilio. Aurelia confecciona uniformes para comerciantes, colegios e institutos, también, entre otros.

Aurelia está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para poder dar acabados en su domicilio, de esta manera podrá tener un mejor ambiente de trabajo ya que también mejorará la infraestructura del ambiente que utiliza como taller. Aurelia desea adquirir más mercadería para poder cumplir con todos sus pedidos.

Aurelia es una madre que desea que su hijo salga adelante, ella quiere poder ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño, pues la describen como una persona empeñosa y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a 42-year-old mother.  She has a son, who also works, in her care.  She lives in her own house in a community called Los Portales de la Pradera 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Aurelia has been manufacturing clothes for over 10 years, a length of time that has made her very well known.  She has a small workshop in her home.  She makes uniforms for merchants, schools and institutions, among others.

Aurelia is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to do some finishing touches on her house so that she can have a better work environment since she will also improve the infrastructure of the space she uses as a workshop.  Aurelia wants to acquire more merchandise in order to fill all her pending orders.

Aurelia is a mother who wants her son to get ahead.  She wants to be able to provide him with a better quality of life.  People who know her hold her in high esteem and affection and describe her as a dedicated, hard working person.

loans.use: to finish some work on her home to improve her workshop.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, age 23, is a barber. He opened his barber shop in 2006, and he enjoys his work. He considers it a good source of income for himself and his family, which is why he puts forth a great deA. of effort toward improving his business. He aims to invest solidly in his business for the future. Ali and his wife have one child.

Ali is requesting his third loan from A. Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to increase his inventory of the beauty products he uses and sells in his shop, such as hair treatments, gel, aftershave, and severA. other items most frequently requested by his customers.

Ali dreams of a strong future for his family. He is also helping his parents by providing funds to continue building their house. His neighbors describe him as a great father, son, and husband.

Ali hopes to expand his business more in the future and aspires eventually to open a speciA. beauty therapy section.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of the beauty products he uses and sells in his shop

loans.name: Zawadi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Faida,représentante du groupe d’affaire « Zawadi»,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 38 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants qui étudient. Son mari est vendeur de chèvres au marché Kahembe. Elle fait le petit commerce des divers. Elle  installe ses marchandises  dans une boutique (kiosque). Elle exerce cette  activité depuis 1992. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  18 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  25 kg de sucre, 1 carton de laits Nido, 1 casier de Fanta, 25 kg de savon Omo, 10 paires de babouches, 3 cartons de lotions de beauté, sel, allumettes, carton de PH, etc., le reste d’argent servira pour la réalisation de microprojets familiaux.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « zawadi» est majoritairement féminins qui intègrent la discipline et rigueur dans la gestion de leurs affaires.
texts.en: The customer Faida, who is the representative of the Zawadi business group, is a 38-year old entrepreneur; she is married and mother to seven children who are all studying. Her husband sells goats at the Kahembe market. She has a small trading business selling a variety of products. She has all her goods set up on a stand. She has been carrying out this business since 1992 and hduring this time as had eighteen loans from Hékima. This new loan will be used to buy 25kg of sugar, a carton of Nido milk, a case of Fanta, 25kg of Omo soap powder, ten pairs of "babouches" (oriental slippers), three boxes of beauty lotion, salt, matches, boxes of toilet paper etc..; the rest of the money will be used for small family projects. Furthermore, her ambition is to be able to pay for her children's schooling. The customer is grateful Hékima for its actions in favour of poor women who have no access to classic banks. It should be noted that the Zawadi business group is primarily composed of women who manage their businesses with discipline and rigor.

loans.use: to pay for 25kg of sugar, one box of Nido milk, I case of Fanta, 25kg of Omo soap powder, ten pairs of oriental slippers ("babouches"), three boxes of beauty lotion, salt, matches, boxes of toilet paper etc.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: El señor Alberto tiene 60 años de edad vive solo, tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya son mayores e independientes, alberto se dedica a manejar una moto taxi la cual es propia viene realizando esta actividad hace mas de 5 años, los desafíos que enfrenta alberto es la competencia que tiene en la ciudad pero, el los enfrenta levantándose un poco mas temprano para ir a trabajar y ganar un poco mas de dinero, el ´préstamo que esta solicitando es para darle mantenimiento a unidad de transporte, cambiar cadenas y hacer unos arreglos en los asientos de la moto taxi, el sueño que tiene alberto es con el tiempo compra un auto para darlo en alquiler, y así le genere mas ingresos, alberto esta muy agradecido con el apoyo que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Alberto is 60 years old and he lives alone. He has 2 grown-up and economically independent children. Alberto drives his own moto taxi*, an activity he has been engaged in for more than 5 years. Competition in the city is the challenge Alberto has to face, but he tackles it by getting up a little earlier to go to work, thus earning a little more money. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for maintenance works on his vehicle, such as changing the chains and having the moto taxi seats repaired. Alberto dreams with buying a car in the future, in order to rent it out and thus make more money. Alberto is deeply thankful for the support he is being given.

<cite>*A “moto taxi” is a motorcycle with a tricycle-like attachment.</cite>

loans.use: To buy chains and to have the moto taxi seats repaired.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married woman and a mother of three school-aged children. She is 43 years old and lives in Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Josephine owns a service-based business, providing delivery truck services to her local community in order to make a living. Her delivery services are used in the distribution of corn and rice grains. Josephine has been engaged in this service for three years. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 every month from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000.00 to pay the labor costs to repair her delivery truck.

Josephine has been member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Josephine hopes to gain more income and establish a new business.

loans.use: pay the labor costs of repairing her delivery truck.

loans.name: Malick

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire ainé d'une famille de 05 enfants.Son père , âgé de 74 ans, ne travaille plus.Il tenait un atelier de réparation mécanique dont il a transmis la gestion à son fils.Ce dernier allie cette activité avec le commerce de pièces détachées automobile. Les revenus tirés de ces activités lui permettent de supporter les charges alimentaires, vestimentaires, de soins médicaux et de scolarité.Il est sociétaire de l'IMCEC et n'a jamais obtenu un prêt de l'IMF. Aujourd'hui, il sollicite un prêt de 100 000FCFA  pour l'achat de 50 disques, 20 baguettes, 20 boulons et 20 roulements. dont la vente lui sera d'une grande aide pour mieux faire face aux besoins de la famille. Son ambition est d'acheter un taxi et d'ouvrir un grand magasin de vente de pièces détachées.
texts.en:
This borrower is a young single man, and the oldest of five children. His father, aged 75 years, does not work anymore. He ran an auto repair shop and he is passing on the management of it to his son.   The son plans to combine this with a spare parts business.  
The money made from this work allows him to buy food, clothing, pay for healthcare and education.  He is a member of l’IMCEC and has never received a loan from the IMF.  Today, he is requesting a loan of 100,000 FCFA for the purchase of 50 brake discs, 20 rods, 20 bolts and 20 ball bearings, the sale of which will greatly help him meet the needs of his family.  His ambition is to buy a taxi and to open a large auto parts store.

loans.use: to buy 50 disks, 20 rods, 20 bolts et 20 sets of ball bearings.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 33 years old, married to Beth, and they have three school-going children. He has been buying and supplying milk around Ndunyu Njeru town for the last eight years.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more milk for resale.

In future, John hopes to grow his business and become one of the leading suppliers of milk in his area.

loans.use: To buy more milk for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación, el grupo se encuentra en el 4º ciclo, con 10 miembros. Todas ellas unieron con el propósito de generar más ingresos para sus familias, desean abrirse camino y desarrollarse no solo en lo económico, sino también a nivel personal.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Señora Elodia, ella tiene 3 hijos, es casada, su marido es Empleado de una Metalúrgica. Ella es artesana hace varios años, confecciona y vende sus artesanías en forma ambulante por su barrio y también por el centro de la ciudad de Encarnación. Uno de sus sueños es que sus hijas tengan una carrera universitaria y se conviertan en grandes profesionales. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales y accesorios para la elaboración de la artesanía y  volver a vender a sus clientes. Está muy esperanzada en el crédito, ya que este le servirá para procurar mejores condiciones para su familia.
texts.en:
This group was started after one of its members contacted Fundación Paraguaya. It is now in its fourth loan cycle with 10 members. All of these women joined together with the goal of generating more income for their families, as well as developing on a financial and personal level.

One of the group members is Sra. Elodia. She is married and has three children. Her husband is employed at a metal shop. Elodia has worked as an artisan for many years, making and selling handicrafts as a street vendor in her neighborhood. She also sells in the central part of the city of Encarnación. One of her dreams is for her daughters to earn a university degree so that they can become successful professionals.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy materials and accessories for making handicrafts that she can sell to her customers. Elodia is very hopeful that with her loan she can secure better conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials and accessories for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Milagros Elizabeth

texts.es:
Milagros de 23 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mochumí que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace unos años Milagros se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos), frutas y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en casa para su  seguridad, ya que puede atender a la hora que desea, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y necesidades de su hogar.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercadería para abastecer su negocio, con el único objetivo de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos que ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones familiares.  Milagros es una mujer responsable y dedicada que se preocupa por tener más cosas que ofrecerle a su familia al igual que tener mejoras económicas.
texts.en:
Milagros is 23, single and lives with her parents in a house with no basic utilities wich is located in the rural area of the Mochumí District in the Lambayeque Department.  The area is known for its agriculture and livestock farming activity.

For several years Milagros has been selling groceries (milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet tissue, tuna and eggs), fruit and beverages.  Her store is set up in her home for security reasons and so that she can attend to it at any time of day.  The income she receives from product sales goes toward household expenses and necessities.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 2,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternative to invest in her business and buy more merchandise for the store.  Her goal is to expand and have more products to offer to customers.  She also wants to attend to family obligations and pay back the loan.  Milagros is a responsible, dedicated woman to is concered about providing for her family and improving her economy.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is married and has four children, three boys and one girl. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past eight years, she has made a living by running a restaurant, serving mostly neighbors and students who attend a nearby school. Her biggest challenge is competition from other restaurants, but she dreams of expanding her business and improving her family's living standards. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 40,000 to buy utensils and furniture that will allow her customers to eat in greater comfort. She decided to join Yehu to access loans that will allow her to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy utensils and furniture for a restaurant.

loans.name: Chamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 26 лет. Женат. Живет вместе с матерью и братьями. Он предоставляет услугу на мероприятиях и свадьбах. В основном он развозит людей на своем автомобиле. Кроме того он предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области он уже три года. Он берет кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Chamshed lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 26 years old, married and lives together with his mother and brothers.  He provides a service at events and weddings.  He primarily transports people in his car.  Besides this, he also provides a taxi service.  Chamshed has been in this business for three years.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is a God-fearing individual whose principle in life is "To become strong and faithful in times of troubles". She is a 37-year-old mother who is blessed with four children and lives happily in a village. Due to lack of job opportunities, she busies herself with cooking and selling snacks and meals like cassava cake and banana cake which she sells in her food stall. She has been in this business for almost five years now and usually earns a profit of P12,000 a month which she utilizes for their food, clothing and allowances for their children.

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she is asking for an additional capital of P50,000 to buy flour, cassava, bananas, sugar, oil and vegetables to be cooked and sold in her food stall. She believes that she can make an improvement to her business as she continues to work hard and strive for it.

loans.use: to buy flour, cassava, bananas, sugar, oil and vegetables to be cooked and sold in the food stall.

loans.name: El Progreso Del Vallecito Group

texts.es: Esther es integrante D. la Alcancía Comunal “El Progreso del Vallecito” grupo conformado por 08 socias dedicados a diversas actividades comerciales siendo  Esther  la que presiD. al grupo. Esther tiene 36 años D. edad y su familia está conformada por ella su conyugue y  02 hijos menores D. edad, la cual han sido su motivación para seguir adelante. Ella se dedica a la venta D. comida negocio que surgió a raíz que aperturaron  un mercado en su localidad, también cuenta con  una pequeña tienda en su domicilio donD. venD. gaseosas y material D. limpieza (jabón, detergente, etc.) con su trabajo y esfuerzo Esther  ha logrado comprar su vivienda. El deseo D. Esther es D. construir su vivienda ya que solo es D. material pre-fabricado para así poder instalar un restaurante, pues ella sabe que D. esa manera tendrá mayores ganancias. En esta ocasión solicito el préstamo a Edaprospo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio D. comidas comprando arroz, azúcar, menestras en mayor cantidad ya que le sale más económico. La Alcancía Comunal “El Progreso del Vallecito” es un grupo responsables que están agradecidos con el crédito brindado. Esther es la que viste un polo rosado y casaca celeste. Ana no pudo estar presente por motivo D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the 'El Progreso del Vallecito' community bank which has 8 [female] members who work in different business activities.  Esther is the group's president.  She is 36 years old and her family consists of her husband and her two dependent children who have been her motivation to get ahead in life.  Esther's business is selling food, a business which she started when they opened a market in her town.  She also has a small store in her home where she sells soda and cleaning supplies (soap, detergent, etc).  Through her hard work and effort, Esther has managed to buy her own home.  Her wish is to rebuild her house as it is only maD. from pre-fabricated material.  She would like to be able to set up a restaurant in her home as she knows that this would make her more profits.

On this occasion, Esther requested a loan from Edaprospo so that she could continue investing in her food business, buying rice, sugar and mixed vegetables in larger quantities as this works out cheaper.  The 'El Progreso del Vallecito' community bank is a group of responsible people who are grateful for the loan that they are being given.  Esther is the lady in the photo who is wearing a pink top and sky-blue jacket.  Ana could not be present when the photo was taken for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and vegetables

loans.name: Claudia Benita

texts.es:
En el municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón de León, la señora Claudia Benita se ha identificado por ser una persona muy dedicada a atender todas y cada una de las necesidades que se presentan en su humilde hogar de habitación. 

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de algunos útiles escolares para su infante ya que así lo requiere y a la vez, logrará comprar un electrodoméstico como es el caso de un televisor ya que no tiene acceso a uno y de esta manera mejorará las condiciones de su hogar. Ella espera que el crédito sea otorgado satisfactoriamente para dar lugar a la compra de los útiles escolares y el electrodoméstico.
texts.en:
Claudia Benita self identifies as a person who is very dedicated to taking care of each and every need that arises in her humble home in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón, León.

She is asking for a Ceprodel loan to buy some school supplies for her child that are required and also to buy a home appliance, a television set, because she does not have access to one and this way her home condition will improve.  She hopes that the loan will be granted satisfactorily so that she can buy the school supplies and the home appliance.

loans.use: to buy a 21" television set and school supplies.

loans.name: María Angelica

texts.es:
María integrante del Banco comunal “Fuerza de Mujer” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco.
Se dedica al rubro del comercio, ella vende abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas, helados en un local que adaptó en su propia casa. Además de esto prepara y vende ensaladas de todo tipo.
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados mayoristas, a sus proveedores, distribuidoras y en la feria compra verduras para la preparación de sus ensaladas. 
En su negocio de abarrotes, atiende todos los días de la semana, mientras que la preparación de ensaladas solo las realiza de lunes a viernes.
María se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 10 años. 
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para abastecer su negocio. Entre estos también comprará carbón, especialmente para las festividades de fin de año. 
Comenta que su negocio ha sido rentable y que le ha permitido vivir una vida confortable. 
María vive solo junto a su marido, ya que comenta que sus hijas ya están casadas y viven en cada uno de sus hogares, algunos días se dedica al cuidado de sus nietos. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio. 
Comenta que el grupo del Banco comunal al cual pertenece es muy unido y responsable, además de respetuoso con cada uno de sus integrantes. 
Respecto a las capacitaciones comenta que le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias para organizar la contabilidad de su negocio, entre estos registrar sus gastos e ingresos del negocio. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
María is a member of the communal bank “Fuerza de Mujer” which belongs to the city of Temuco. She sells groceries, candies, beverages, ice-cream in premises she set up in her own house. In addition she prepares and sells all kinds of salads. She buys her merchandise at the wholesale supermarkets, from her suppliers and distributors and the vegetables for her salads at the street market. She takes care of her grocery store every day whilst she only makes salads Mondays through Fridays. Maria has followed this routine for the last 10 years.

With the loan she will buy merchandise with which to stock her store. She will also buy coal especially for the year-end festivities. She tells us that her business has been profitable and has allowed to live a comfortable life. Maria lives alone with her husband as she says that her daughters are already married, each with her own home. Some days she takes care of her grandchildren. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity afforded her by Fondo and the hope to invest in her business. She says that the communal bank group she belongs to is very responsable and united, respectful of  each one of its members. With regards the training, she says that they have helped her learn new strategies for organizing her business accounts, such as documenting the business' expenses and income. 

Temuco is the capital of the Araucania region. The city is located 670 kms to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile). In the surrounding areas there is a series of lakes (Pucon, Villarrica) and striking fauna and flora, concentrated in the nearby natural parks. It is of note that this region is inhabited by 50% of the Mapuche indigenous people that exist in our country.

loans.use: to buy merchandise with which to stock her business and also coal specifically for the end-of-year festivities.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 31 years old and is married with two children, ages 2 and 7. To earn a living, Perla raises pigs. She started her business 3 years ago and is able to help her husband in providing for their needs through her business.

Perla is asking for a loan to buy additional feed and piglets to raise. She hopes to continue supporting her family and wants to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 47 años de edad es soltera tiene 5 hijos, vive con los hijos de 28, 24, 22 , 18 y 9 años de edad en  Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC PANGUA, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad Pangua  Chaupiyacu, Parroquia Guanujo Cantón Guaranda, La comunidad está a 15 minutos de la Oficina Los miembros de la Ventanilla Pangua se dedican la mayoría a la Agricultura y ganadería y también a otras actividades donde obtienen mayores ingresos económicos como: el comercio y la construcción.
Margarita se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sembríos de papas además tiene ganado, ovejas, chanchos, terrenos en sembríos y 4 cuadras de terreno y vive en casa propia.
Las comparas y las ventas lo realiza en Guaranda.
Solicita el crédito para comprar ganados, ovejas y abonos. Con la ayuda del préstamo mejorará la situación económica de la familia.
El sueño es poder comprar una casa y conocer otra ciudad.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la situación económica, y en la agricultura la sequia  en el verano.
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar,  tejer, a veces sale a pasear con la familia y visitar a los familiares lejanos.
texts.en:
Margarita is 47 years old, single, and has five children.  She lives in Guaranda in Bolívar Province with her children (ages 28, 24, 22, 18, and 9).  

Margarita is a member of the Communal Bank “Pangua” which is located in the community of Pangua Chaupiyacu and part of Guanujo parish in the canton of Guaranda.  This community is 15 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose.  The members of the Pangua Communal Bank work mostly in agriculture and livestock breeding, but they also engage in other business activities, such as retail and construction, in order to earn most of their income.  

Margarita is a farmer who grows potatoes.  She also has cattle, sheep, and pigs.  Margarita has four plots of land on which she grows her crops.  She lives in her own house.  Her purchases and sales are conducted in Guaranda.  She is requesting a loan in order to buy cattle, sheep, and compost.  With the help of this loan, Margarita will be able to improve her family’s financial condition.  Her dream is to buy a house in another city.  The challenges she faces include the economic situation and the summer droughts.  

In her free time, Margarita enjoys relaxing and knitting.  Occasionally she will go out to spend time with her family and visit relatives who live far away.

loans.use: to buy cattle, sheep, and compost.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра умная и добрая женщина. Она замужем, любящая мать троих детей, из них двое несовершеннолетние. Она занимается купле- продажей резиновой обуви более 15 лет. У нее большой опыт, она торгует на местном рынке и имеет много постоянных клиентов. В бизнесе помогает ей её  муж, и они стараются улучшить свои  жилищные условия дать хорошее образование детям. Гулчехра хотела бы получить займ для оптовой покупки  новой сезонной обуви. Она надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарит вас всех.
texts.en: Gulchehra is a smart and kind woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of three children, two of whom are adolescents.  She has been involved in buying and selling rubber shoes for over 15 years.  She has an extensive experience, sells at the local market and has many regular clients.  Gulchehra's husband helps her with the business, and they try to improve their living conditions and provide a good education for their children.  Gulchehra wants to obtain this loan for a wholesale purchase of new seasonal shoes.  She relies on your help and thanks all of you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of new seasonal shoes

loans.name: Nidia Lucia

texts.es: Nidia Lucia se dedica  a la venta de mercadería en general, desde hace 4 años que tiene este medio de vida. Ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante siempre ha realizado un buen trabajo y se siente agradecida con el apoyo que le brinda. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de calzado, cosméticos, tratamiento, reloj, ropa en general y sabanas. Ha sido con el paso del tiempo que Nidia ha logrado salir adelante con todo el empeño necesario a su negocio. Ella agradece la oportunidad que le han brindado con el financiamiento.
texts.en: Nidia Lucia has been selling general merchandise for four years.  She sells her products in an itinerant manner always doing a good job and she feels grateful for the support it provides.  The reason for the loan is to buy shoes, cosmetics, treatments, clothes in general and sheets.  With the passage of time Nidia has managed to get ahead with all the effort needed by her business.  She is grateful for the opportunity the loan has provided her.

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetics, treatments, watches, clothing in general and sheets.

loans.name: Wiriranai

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 28-year-old Wiriranai from Chitungwiza. He is married with three children, one still attending school. He also cares for one dependent. Wiriranai runs a retail business of buying and selling eggs. The business has been in operation for 15 years. He says the main challenges faced are competition in pricing system and the availability of eggs during the winter season. Wiriranai has requested a loan of $500 to buy more eggs. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to  improve the welfare of his family. In the future, Wiriranai plans to own a wholesale egg market in the central business district.

loans.use: to buy more eggs for resale

loans.name: Rut Marina

texts.es:
Con esfuerzo propio la joven Rut Marina está estudiando la carrera de Ciencias Naturales los días sábados y los días de semana se dedica a laborar como maestra de educación primaria en una comunidad del municipio de El Sauce de donde es originaria, con el fin de prepararse profesionalmente y llegar a tener un mejor futuro.

Es una joven soltera que lucha por lo que quiere, se desempeña muy bien en su quehacer diario, por lo que es la primera vez que está solicitando crédito en Ceprodel para pagar la matrícula de inicio de clases de su carrera y algunas mensualidades que son requisito indispensable para continuar en la universidad.

Ella confía en que el crédito le será otorgado satisfactoriamente y de esta manera continuará su tarea de ser una estudiante que se preocupa por su propio futuro que seguro lo logrará gracias a su gran aptitud y dedicación al estudio.
texts.en:
Through her own efforts, Rut Marina is studying for a degree in Natural Sciences.  She studies on Saturdays and, during the week, she works as an elementary school teacher in a community in El Sauce, where she was born.  Her goal is to train as a professional and enjoy a better future.  

Rut Marina is a young, single woman who wants to do well.  This is the first time that she has requested a loan from Ceprodel.  She is requesting a loan to pay her enrollment fees so that she can start studying for her degree.  She will also pay some fees which she needs to cover in order to continue studying at the university.

Rut Marina believes that she will receive her loan and that it will enable her to continue being a student.  She cares about her own future and is certain that she will achieve her goals thanks to her talent and her commitment to her studies.

loans.use: to pay her registration fees and her monthly instalments

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
Mateo de 20 años de edad, es un joven pujante y lleno de sueños por cumplir, desde chico siempre soñó con tener su propia empresa y construir un buen futuro para él y su familia. Su arte para la cocina ha sido su mayor aliciente y el causante de que a su corta edad ya se proyecte como un gran hombre de negocios.
La difícil situación económica por la que atravesó su familia, le permitió a este joven ver más allá del problema para encontrar una buena solución. Decidió dedicarse a la venta de comidas rápidas con el propósito de colaborarle a su madre con los gastos del hogar y aminorar la crítica situación por la que atravesaban. Gracias a esta actividad, a mejorado considerablemente su calidad de vida. 
Mateo se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de desechables, carnes frías y gaseosas con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mateo, 20, is a thriving young man who has dreams to fulfill.  Since he was small he always dreamed of having his own business and building a good future for himself and his family.  His cooking skill has been his greatest incentive and the reason he can be a great businessman at his young age.

His family's difficult financial situation allowed this young man to see beyond the problem and find a good solution.  He decided to make a living selling fast food so he could help his mother with the household expenses and reduce the critical situation they were going through.  Thanks to this job his quality of life has improved considerably.

Mateo's requesting a loan to buy disposable items, cold cuts, and sodas so he can increase his sales and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy disposable items, cold cuts, and soda

loans.name: Gbekple Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBEKPLE est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sèdonoudé Denise est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sèdonoudé Denise est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un certain Jérôme. Sèdonoudé Denise n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Sèdonoudé Denise est mère de six enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et trois à la charge du couple. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Sèdonoudé Denise vend depuis une quinzaine d'année, des produits divers (farine de manioc, savons, huile, pâtes alimentaires, etc.) dans son quartier. Sèdonoudé Denise s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sèdonoudé Denise sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBEKPLE.

loans.use: Acheter des divers (farine de manioc, huile végétale, savons, etc.)

loans.name: Salomon

texts.fr: Marié à une couturière du nom de Jacqueline et père de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et tous à sa charge, Salomon est âgé de 29 ans. Salomon vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Salomon subvient ensemble avec sa femme aux divers besoins du ménage. Salomon a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire mais a appris la peinture. Pour assurer ses diverses charges, Salomon fait la peinture depuis huit ans et vend des peintures de façon secondaire. Cette activité lui permet de contribuer aux diverses charges de sa famille. Afin de renforcer son activité, Salomon sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé dans le but de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les crédits antérieur ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des peintures.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes, maize and also keeps cows. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 38 years and married with 3 children. Her children are all of school going age and are attending local schools. Ann is quite active in her group and due to her leadership abilities she was elected the Vice Chairlady

Ann has accessed 4 loans from her group of USD 30, USD 60, USD 90 and USD 120. She has used these loans to expand her kiosk and also start the flower farming business. She successfully repaid these loans with the proceeds from her businesses. She makes a profit of USD 75 per month from her kiosk and USD 150 per month from flower sales as she has a ready market. She has been working very closely with her husband in managing the 2 businesses.

loans.use:
To meet the growing demand for goods from her kiosk, she intends to stock a variety of items so as to make her kiosk a one stop shop for her customers.
Loan usage Plan:  To expand her kiosk business by adding a variety of business stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase a small refrigerator or freezer for making ice and storing yoghurt.

loans.name: Pho

texts.en: Pho V. and her husband live in Phnom Penh, Cambodia with their three young children.  Together, they run two small shops in their village.  At one of their shops they sell flowers, which can typically generate about $6.50 in revenue each day.  They sell tools at their other shop, which usually yields around $15.00 in revenue daily.  They use most of the money from their businesses to send their three children to school and hope that they will be able to get them all the way through high school.  V. and her husband would like to use this loan to increase the size of their tool-selling business.

loans.use: To increase the size of her business selling tools

loans.name: Arisleida

texts.en:
Born in Yamasá, a town some 30 kilometers (about 18 miles) northeast of the capital city of Santo Domingo, Arisleida, a mother of two ( 16 and 17), used to sell personal hygiene products. About 4 years ago she started selling (with her husband) fruits, beans, and other foodstuff.

She has established her business on a road which brings a decent developing market. Today she buys the food for resale in the city warehouses. Having to pay expensive public transportation every time she goes to the city, she needs to maximize her grocery purchases to minimize inventory costs. Hence her loan request.

loans.use: Buying supplies for her business
